loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her early 50s, is married with four children. Two of them go to school and two are grown-ups. She has three grand-children who are still going to school. She has been running a fruit and vegetable business where she also sells daga and salt. She works from 4.00am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in her stock of fruit and vegetables, bought a plot of land, bought some bricks, paid school fees and helped with household expenses. She has paid all her loans back successfully. 

She wants a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables and to buy more bricks. Her dream is to one day to be able to start building her own house, now that she has bought enough bricks. 

Christina will share this loan with her loan group "Nazareth". It has 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables and more bricks.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.fr: Âgé de 33 ans, Salomon vit au Bénin et a très peu fréquenté l’école. Salomon est marié à une couturière du nom de Jacqueline. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Salomon vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les différentes charges du ménage. Salomon a appris la peinture-auto, activité qu’il exerce depuis deux ans dans sa région et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. La clientèle de Salomon devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d'être plus compétitif sur le marché, Salomon désire acquérir de nouveaux matériels de travail. Salomon s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Salomon sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Salomon is 33 years old; he lives in Benin and only attended school for a short period.  He is married to a seamstress named Jacqueline.  Salomon and Jacqueline have five children, all in school and their dependents.  In addition to their children, the couple has another child in its care.  Salomon lives with his wife and children and takes care of the various household expenses with his wife.

Salomon is trained as an auto-painter; he has been working in this field for the past two years, in his region.  This professional activity brings him a rather good income.

Salomon has an increasing number of customers.  In order to further improve his business and to become more competitive on the market, he would like to purchase some new equipment.  He buys his materials in a town in Benin and in Nigeria.

In order to meet his customers' needs and to increase his turnover and income, Salomon is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé for the second time.  

His previous loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy paints.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Shirley requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent and other groceries to sell.

Shirley has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena buys and sells fruits, snack items and some home-use products to earn a living and has been in this business for 11 years. Efrena is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Each month, Efrena earns 8,000 PHP and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, she joined GDMPC. In the future, Efrena plans to save her profit for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Jover

texts.en: Jover is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old, is married, and has two children. Jover used his last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita used her last loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. Her business grew and become successful. Now she's taking care of her transport service business and she is asking for a new loan to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 48 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Florenda has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Florenda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora. Está separada del padre de sus dos hijos. Actualmente vive en la casa de su madre, con ella y sus dos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de refrescos, gaseosas y golosinas de diversos sabores y marcas. Esto lo realiza en el frontis de su vivienda donde tiene un puesto, siendo un lugar amplio y cómodo, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora para mantener heladas las bebidas. Se inició con esta actividad hace más de 3 años, por iniciativa propia, con capital fruto de sus ahorros. Trabaja medio tiempo, ya que la otra mitad del día es empleada doméstica, por ello el resto del día atiende su puesto su madre. Le gusta mucho su negocio, pues disfruta de conversar con las personas, además de los ingresos económicos que le permite pagar los gastos de su hogar y darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad el sueldo que ganaba no le alcanzaba. Desea seguir creciendo e implementar un local para la venta de comida, ya que siente que es momento.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores. Y desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios.
Con los 1000 soles solicitados comprará golosinas; como caramelos, galletas, chisitos y otros, en cantidades y al por mayor. También empezará a adquirir los víveres e ingredientes para la elaboración de  las comidas que desea vender.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 46.  She is a very friendly and hardworking woman.  She is separated from her children's father.  She currently lives with her mother and her two children in her mother's house.  She wants to offer her children a better standard of living.

She sells many different flavors and brands of soft drinks and snacks from her porch, where she has a stall, since it is a wide and comfortable space.  She has a refrigerator to keep her drinks cold.  She started this work more than three years ago, on her own initiative, with her savings.  She works half time; the other half of the day, she is a domestic worker.  The rest of the time, her mother staff the stall.  She likes her business very much, since it gives her a chance to talk to lots of people, plus the income allows her to pay her household expenses and to give her children a good education.  Before starting this business, the money she earned did not go very far.  She wants to keep growing and to find a place to sell food--she thinks the time is ripe.

This is her third loan with microfinance partner MFP, and she hopes to keep meeting her targets.  She promises to keep paying punctually, as with her previous loans.  And she wants to keep working with the members of her community bank, since they are all very friendly and civic-minded.  With the 100 soles ($400), she will buy snacks, such as candies, cookies, and Chisitos in large quantities.  She would also like to start acquiring the means and ingredients to make the food she wants to sell.

loans.use: to buy snacks and soft drinks for her food stall.

loans.name: Cinthya Vanessa

texts.es:
Cinthya es una mujer soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias al apoyo de sus padres Cinthya pudo estudiar satisfactoriamente la carrera profesional de Veterinaria, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas calles de la ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Juanes (plato típico de su ciudad) para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, gracias a las enseñanzas de su madres, día a día Cinthya puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, tales como: cecina, chorizo, tacaco y otros potajes típicos de su ciudad, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 20 clientes, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la buscan por su buena sazon y por su trato amble.
Cinthya se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una congeladora e insumos, tales como: carne de cerdo, condimentos, hojas de bijao, entre otros; de esta manera Cinthya tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y podrá conservar mejor los ingredientes para sus potajes, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Cinthya is a single woman who lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Pucallpa.  She is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  Thanks to the support of her parents, Cinthya was able to study for a degree in veterinary science.  In her free time she enjoys going out for walks in the warm city streets and she sometimes cooks a delicious meal of 'Juanes' (a typical dish in her city) to share with her family.

With a lot of effort, having learned from her mother, Cinthya set up a small business selling food such as pork sausage, chorizo, 'tacacho' and other local dishes.  She works around eight hours a day and can serve an average of twenty customers.  She feels happy in her work and she believes that things are going well because her customers seek her out owing to the good flavor of her food and her friendly service.

Cinthya is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a freezer and supplies such as pork, seasonings, bijao leaves, etc.  This will improve her business and the ingredients she uses in her dishes will keep better.  She hopes, as a result, to increase her sales and her income.  She wants to use this income so that she can have her own home in the not-so-distant future.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and supplies

loans.name: Nuvy Grace

texts.en:
Nuvy Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her food stall.

NWTF is relisting Nove Grace's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. Angelina is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Angelina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her business.

Angelina has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon is 56 years old and married with one kid. Ma. Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Corazon runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Corazon has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, age 50, is married and has six children, aged between 10 and 28 years.Three of her children are in school. She resides in the town of Samburu, Kenya.


For over ten years, Lucy has been selling "omena" (small dried fish) retail. She started out selling on a small scale, but as time passed, she invested her earnings in the growth of her business.


Lucy is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES to restock her inventory and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to see an improvement in her earnings, so for this reason, she continues to work very hard despite her advanced age.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Hayde has been in this business for 10 years. Hayde earns more income from fish and dried fish retailing.

Hayde has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Jeannilyn

texts.en:
Jeannilyn is 48 years old and has seven children. Jeannilyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Jeannilyn is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jeannilyn has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jeannilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 42 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from fish retailing.

Julieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Wapita

texts.en:
Wapita is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Wapita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Wapita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Wapita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Wapita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Nouratou Monradeké

texts.fr: Agée de 52 ans, Nouratou Monradeké est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont encore à l'université. Elle dispose d'une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des chaussures et des pagnes depuis 05 ans. Elle fait ses achats dans les marchés extérieurs et ses clients sont composés des togolais et des béninois. Afin de renforcer son activité et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié un prêt à Finadev. Le présent prêt lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'épargner.
texts.en:
Nouratou Monradeké is 52 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom are still in college.

She has a shop in which she has been selling shoes and pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics) for the past five years.  She buys her goods in surrounding markets and sells to customers who come from Togo and Benin.

In order to strengthen her activity and to meet her customers' expectations, she has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev.

This current loan will allow her to contribute to her children's education and to save some money.

loans.use: to buy 12 pairs of shoes, 8 handbags, and 10 "pagnes".

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a very talented lady who sews clothes to financially assist her husband who is a plumber by trade. She has got great sewing skills and knows about the latest fashion trends which helps her fulfilling the clients' needs and making a reasonable profit every month.

Shakeela has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Both of her sons are earning while her daughter is studying. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan investment he will buy plumbing tools, taps, pipes, etc. to improve his services.

He is very experienced and Shakeela is confident about his business success in future.

loans.use: To buy plumbing tools for plumbing business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old and married with 4 children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her general store. Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 28 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Laila works very hard to provide for them. 

Laila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, soft drinks, sugar, etc.

In the future Laila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 53 years old and married with 2 children. Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Amelita has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising chickens and direct selling Avon products.

Amelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 54 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lita has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 43 years old and married with 5 children.

Sherlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Sherlita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from vegetable retail.

Sherlita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 6 children, Agnes works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Agnes is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business.

Agnes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. Aireen has been in this business for one year. Aireen earns more income from raising chickens.

Aireen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Kantutas De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el desino octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, ayudante de minibús, tejido de mantas, atención de saumerío, venta de conservas, trenzado de mantas, taller de carpintería.

La señora Felipa, indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus hermanas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas, ella cuenta que este negocio lo inicio en sus constantes viajes a la frontera de Perú y Bolivia, donde vio que esta actividad era escasa en ese lugar es por eso que inicio este negocio hace seis años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de lana) mismo que adquirirá de los almacenes de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es divorciada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la institución porque son prestamistas de dinero.
texts.en:
The “Kantutas de Los Andes” Communal Bank will begin its eighth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the “Centro Focal de Los Andes”.  The group is comprised of eight members and managed by a board of directors where Felipa is Secretary.  The members of the communal bank carry out varied businesses including owning a neighborhood store, working as an assistant minibus driver, selling woven blankets, providing incensing services, selling preserves, selling braided rugs, and a owning a carpenter’s shop.

Felipa says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one and a half years and was invited to join by her sisters who are members of the institution.  Currently, she is in the business of braiding and selling rugs.  She says that while making frequent trips to the border of Peru and Bolivia, she noticed that this type of business was limited in this area and this is why she started her business six years ago.  

She is taking out this loan to expand her stock of merchandise (wool), which she will purchase from the shops in the city of El Alto for later sale in her sales space.  This type or work will allow her to support her family in the best possible way because she is divorced and has three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the institution because they are money lenders.
.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 40 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She works hard to provide for her family by selling Avon and Natasha products to people in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 22,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell. Cynthia has taken out and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF, and has been in this line of work for 16 years. Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en: Phorn lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 40 years old and has four children, three daughters and one son, all of whom live at home and attend school. To earn a living, Phorn works as a rice farmer and supplements her income by planting cassava. She has been in these businesses for 25 years, and is able to earn about KHR 36,100 per day. She has taken out and repaid two loans from VisionFund, while the other member of this two-person loan group is requesting her first loan. They are hoping to improve their lives by borrowing 2,000,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, Phorn will use a portion of this loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and insecticides to protect her her farmland. She hopes that the price of cassava will increase so that she can earn enough money to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides to protect her farmland.

loans.name: Nab Yiiri Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA représente le groupe NAB YIIRI. Sur  la photo, c’est la trésorière qui a levé la main. La représentante est en tenue blanc avec bébé au dos. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 01an 06mois. 01 va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des céréales (haricot) depuis 05ans. Mme s’approvisionne à YAKO au BURKINA. Ses clients  sont les femmes restauratrices et les grossistes.

Mme veut s’acheter  01 sac d’haricot.

Elle désire renforcer  son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne avoir une voiture dans le futur pour faciliter son travail.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative of the NAB YIIRI group.  In the photo, it is [not her, but the] the group's treasurer who is raising her hand.  

Rasmata is dressed in white and carrying a child on her back.   She is married and the mother of two children; the oldest is 10 years old and the youngest 18 months.  One of her children goes to school and she has two people in her care.

Rasmata has been selling grains (beans) for five years.  She buys her merchandise in Yako, Burkina Faso.  Her clients are wholesalers and women involved in the preparation of meals.

She wants to buy one bag of beans.

Rasmata would like to use her profits to strengthen her activity.  In the future, she would like to own a car, to make her job easier.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of beans.

loans.name: Rosa Marilu

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la calurosa y muy linda ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se ubica en nuestra selva peruana y alberga mucha variedad de flora y fauna muy maravillosa, es una ciudad en la cual uno puede desconectarse del bullicio de la ciudad, sobre todo porque podemos apreciar paisajes maravillosos. Rosa es madre, su hijo tiene 15 años y ella es madre y padre para el ya que el padre de su hijo la abandono y desde ese momento ella se armo de mucho valor y sobre todo mucho amor de madre para sacar a su hijo adelante. Rosa en su tiempo libre disfruta de comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “arroz a la cubana”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo estudio hasta el tercer grado de educación secundaria y le hubiera gustado ser diseñadora de modas, por ello ella trabaja muy duro para que su hijo sea mucho mejor que ella.

Día a día Rosa trabaja en su negocio de servicio de costura, ella elabora prendas y también realiza composturas; trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día. Ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y siempre hace su trabajo con gusto.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como colocar piso de cemento, reforzamiento de paredes, entre otros; de esta manera su vivienda será más segura y mejorara su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchar para poder ver hecho realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su fábrica de confecciones”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a great hardworking woman who loves in the warm and delightful town of Pucallpa, a city located in the Peruvian jungle with an impressive flora and fauna. It’s a city where one can disconnect from the noise of the city and appreciate the beauty of nature since its scenery is very beautiful. Rosa is a single mother: she has a 15-year-old son to whom she is both mother and father because her husband has abandoned them. From that moment she has striven with great courage and above all with deep motherly love in order to provide for her child. In her free time Rosa likes eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “arroz a la cubana” (rice with fried plantain and fried meat). Owing to her meager economic resources she has been able to study up to the third grade of secondary education only, but she would have liked to become a fashion designer, and for this reason she works very hard so that her son can become a better professional than herself.

Rosa works day by day in her sewing shop, creating clothes as well as making repairs. She works around 10 hours a day and she can tend to up to 20 customers per day. She thinks her activity is going well because she is very kind and she always loves what she does.

Rosa is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to make some improvements to her house such as putting a cement floor, reinforcing the walls and other works. In this way her house will be safer and her standard of living will improve, so that she will continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream come true: “To have a dressmaking factory of her own”.

loans.use: To make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has earned a living for the past 20 years by running a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She supplements her income by growing vegetables and sugar cane. She is requesting a loan for PHP 40,000 to buy spare parts for her vehicle. Marina has run her business through hard work and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César tiene 57 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y muy empeñoso. Está casado con Rosa, quien es comerciante, tienen diez hijos, a quienes crió y educó de tal manera que ya todos son independientes. Actualmente vive en su casa, a lado de su esposa, a quien desea seguir brindándole una mejor calidad de vida para así poder tener juntos una vejez tranquila.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de zapatos, zapatillas y sandalias, tanto nuevos como de segundo uso. Para ello cuenta con un pequeño local alquilado en una zona comercial de su localidad, donde atiende a sus clientes y también ofrece el servicio de arreglo de zapatos. Cuando se inició solo vendía los usados, pero con el tiempo fue incrementando su capital y ahora puede vender nuevos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 6 años y desea continuar haciéndolo por muchos años más, pues y le gusta y tiene la libertad de poner su propio horario y días de trabajo. Tiene buenas ventas y eso le permite tener buenos ingresos. Espera, en el futuro, aumentar su capital y su stock de mercadería para ver crecer su negocio.

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP y está contento de contar con este apoyo financiero para continuar con sus objetivos. Se compromete, una vez más, a pagar las cuotas de manera responsable. Y comenta sentirse muy cómodo en su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará más zapatos para su negocio, de esa manera  aumentar la variedad que ofrece.
texts.en:
César, 57, is a good, kind, and very diligent man.  He is married to Rosa, a merchant, and they have ten children who they have raised and educated in such a way that they are already independent.  At the moment he lives in his home along side his wife, to whom he wishes to continue offering a better quality of life so that they can have a quiet old age together.

His work consists of selling shoes, sneakers, and sandals; both new and secondhand.  He relies on a small rented space in a commercial area of his town, where he takes care of his customers and also offers a shoe repair service.  When he began he only sold used shoes, but with time his capital increased and now he can sell new shoes.  He has been doing this work for more than six years and wants to continue doing it for many more years since he likes it and has the freedom to set his own schedule and work days.  He has good sales and this allows him to have a good income.  In the future he hopes to increase his capital and his stock of merchandise in order to see his business grow.

This is his ninth loan with MFP and he is happy to have this financial support in order to continue with his goals.  Once again, he promises to make his repayments in a responsible manner.  He also says he feels very comfortable in his communal bank since his group members are very responsible and always sympathize with others.

With the requested amount, 1000 soles, he will buy more shoes for his business and this way increase the variety that he offers.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to continue selling.

loans.name: Melaluna

texts.en: Melaluna is 29 years old, married and the mother of four children. For the last eight years, she has worked hard to provide for her family by selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines. She supplements her income by selling food and by fishing. She has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. Melaluna has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF, and hopes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more cellphone accessories to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ria Alma

texts.en: Ria is the married parent of five children, and works hard to support her family by selling food items. She supplements her income by raising pigs. Ria is requesting a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food-vending business. She has sustained this business with help from three previous loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items for a food-vending business.

loans.name: Ronesa

texts.en:
Ronesa is 59 years old and widowed with three children.

Ronesa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store.

Ronesa has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Ronesa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and married with 13 children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her general store.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jocelyn aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell to her general store

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Loida has been in this business for eight years. Loida earns more income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Laura, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la cual expende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, y  leche entre otros productos. Laura en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería y surtir su comercio.
Laura está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Our associate Laura belongs to the communal bank "Reyna de los Angeles" in the province of Urubamba, Peru. Our associate has a grocery store where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, beans, milk and other products. With this opportunity, Laura will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise and stock her store. Laura is very grateful to Kiva for giving her a better quality of life for her family and for helping her grow and strengthen her business activity. Our associate appreciates the loan and promises to meet her repayments on time.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, beans, milk and sodas.

loans.name: Marry Rose

texts.en:
Marry Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Marry Rose has been in this business for five years. Marry Rose earns more income from farming vegetables and direct sales of Boardwalk products.

Marry Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 32 years old, married to Ruth, and blessed with two children that he supports. He has run a welding and spare parts shop for the last three years. His monthly income is KES 20,000. 

He has applied for a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to acquire more stock of metals for use in his business.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to get more variety of business items. His future dream is to have a stable business, educate his children, and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of metals for welding work.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 52 años, es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está separada del padre de sus hijos y actualmente vive en su casa propia, la que compró con sus ahorros de varios años en compañía de su actual pareja.

Su negocio es el alquiler de locales comerciales, para eso tiene dos espacios que acondicionó en su vivienda que está ubicada en una zona comercial. Uno ya lo tiene alquilado y en el otro está realizando algunos arreglos para poder alquilarlo nuevamente. Se inició hace más de 9 años, con una capital propio, fruto de sus ahorros, invirtió en su casa pensando en su futuro, contando con el apoyo de su pareja que la apoya con la administración. Decidió a empezar este negocio debido al avance de los años, pues sabe que no tendrá acceso a un empleo, ni jubilación, y esta actividad no necesita mucho esfuerzo físico.

Este es su préstamo número 17 con la institución MFP y está agradecida al saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero para avanzar. Además, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y amables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para el arreglo de las paredes y puertas de su local, además del pago de la mano de obra por el arreglo y pintado del local.
texts.en:
Julia is 52 years old, she is a fighter and a hard worker, with a desire to get ahead. She is separated from the father of her children and currently lives in her own house which she bought with the savings of several years being with her current boyfriend. 
Her business is to rent to local business and to do this she needs to repair two spaces that are connected to her house which is located in a commercial district. She already has one of the two that she rents out and she is trying to get the second through savings in order to rent it out again. She started more than 9 months ago with some of her own money, her savings, and invested in the house thinking in the future, counting on the support of her boyfriend who helps with the administrative work. She decided to start this business because of her advanced years, as she knows she won't have access to employment, nor retirement and this activity does not require much physical activity. 
This is her 17th loan with MFP and is grateful to know that she can continue to count on this financing in order to advance. Furthermore, she comments that she likes her communal bank because she knows the members and considers them responsible and friendly people.  With the requested money, she will reinvest in the purchase of construction materials to repair the walls and doors of her location and also pay for the labor to fix the walls as well as paint them.

loans.use: repair walls and paint her store which she will then rent out.

loans.name: Farah's Group

texts.en:
Farah has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who runs a printing press. With the loan investment he will repair his printing machine and also purchase some printing tools to further improve his business. He is very good at his work and never compromises on quality. Due to his good work he receives regular orders every month.

Farah is hopeful that that by repairing his printing machine, her husband will be able to provide improved services to his clients and make more profits from his business.

loans.use: To repair printing machine for printing business

loans.name: Boymurat

texts.en: Boymurat is glorious and cute. For more than 12 years he has been busy with animal husbandry. He buys cattle, cares for them and then sells to local people. In the local market he has a lot of customers. He has enough experience developing business and that’s why his business has been developing year by year.  He has a lovely wife and 2 smart children. His wife helps him with the business. They want to repair their house because it has bad conditions. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing the house. He waits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Uzima Group

texts.en:
Mwarani, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  He has been running a business selling chips since 2007.  He works from 7.00 am to mid-night daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to make and sell more chips, bought a plot of land, bought iron sheets, paid household expenses and has paid back both his prior loans successfully.  He wants a loan to  buy a sack of Irish potatoes and make more chips to sell. His dream is to one day be able to build his house.

loans.use: to buy a sack of Irish potatoes and make more chips to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria de 46 años de edad,  soltera, con tres hijos bajo su cargo, tiene por actividad brindar servicio de salon de belleza ubicado en su casa de habitacion experiencia que la adquirio  desde  hace 20 años , el negocio lo inico con esfuerzo propio de unos ahorro, y ayuda de un hermano que esta fuera del pais, en la actualidad ha logrado mantener el negocio gracia al  buen servicio que le brinda a su cliente, su entrega al trabajo ya que ella ama lo que hace, lo que cual le ha ayudado a superarce dia a dia, ella esta solicitando el fiananciamiento para la invertir en compra de material de material de trabajo como: tintes, brochas, alisadores, planchas, maquillajes, crema para pediquiur, tratamiento para el cabello entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is 46 years old and is a single mother of three.  She makes a living by offering services at her beauty salon situated in her home and has gained experience by doing this for the past twenty years.  

She started her business on her own with some savings and help from her brother who lives in another country.  Her business has been successful thanks to the good service she provides her clients, her work ethic, and loving what she does which has helped her better herself day by day.  

She is seeking a loan to invest in work material such as dye, brushes, straighteners, irons, makeup, pedicure cream, and hair treatment among other items.

loans.use: to purchase dye, brushes, straighteners, irons, makeup, pedicure cream, and hair treatment among other items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
Susan tiene 26 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, además de tener decisión y ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Carlos, el padre de su única hija, Danja de 7 años. Viven en el local alquilado para su negocio y lo que más desea es trabajar para poder brindarle a su hija una buena educación.

Se dedica a la venta de zapatos y zapatillas de segundo uso. Su local está en una zona céntrica de la ciudad por lo que es muy concurrido; además su mercadería la trae desde la capital y son modelos novedosos y baratos. Inició hace más de 8 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, pues se siente muy feliz cuando vende todo. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta por el respaldo financiero para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual con sus cuotas. Y se siente contenta de pertenecer su banco comunal, ya que ve que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará más zapatos para damas y caballeros, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Susan is 26 years old and is a simple and hard working woman on top of being decisive and having the desire to get ahead. Her boyfriend is Carlos, the father of her only daughter, Danja, who is 7 years old. They live in the same space they have rented for their business and the thing she wants most is to work in order to give her daughter a good education. 

She sells new and second hand shoes. Her store is located in the central district of the city and so it is well-visited. She brings her merchandise from the capital and the shoes are usually new styles and cheap. She started his business 8 years ago and until the present has been working alone. She considers her business profitable because of the earnings she makes and so she is happy when she is able to sell everything in stock. In the future, she hopes to have a larger store that she can sell her merchandise from in more comfort. 

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy for the financial support she has received that has helped her increase her working capital. She knows she will have to be responsible and, above all, punctual in her repayments. She is happy to belong to a communal bank as there is solidarity among the members. With the requested money, she will purchase more shoes for men and women, looking for the best deals so that her sales increase in volume.

loans.use: purchase more shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 51, has a grocery store where she sells groceries such as cabbages, bananas, etc. Every day she sells on a cash basis and also buys her products in cash. She is assisted by her daughter when she goes for teaching children in her private nursery school. However, she operates the grocery fully during the weekends.
 
Everyone living nearby congregates at Jane's store because it is a nice, friendly place and they feel well cared for, which is a growing sentiment among her clientele. Therefore, as her business grows, buying more volume in cash becomes increasingly difficult.

This is why Lucy has turned to Yehu for another Kiva loan. This will allow her to keep a stock of daily consumption products, since she has to have enough inventory to respond immediately to her customers, who are mothers who must prepare food for their families. 

She will use her loan to buy more groceries for sale. Her loan is sure to be successful because she is basing her request on market demand, and her suppliers will give her discounts for buying more volume and paying in cash. This will be beneficial to Jane's income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old.  She is married to Wilson and jointly tends to their family .She has five children between 28 and 16 years. She has a cereals business and has been in operation for thirteen years, earning a monthly income of KES.17,000.

This is her third loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. She will use the loan to purchase dry maize, beans, peas and millet for resale. With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees for her children and use the rest for sustaining her family.

Her dreams and hopes are that her business prospers and in future extends to a wholesale cereals business.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize, beans, peas and millet for resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 45 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de tres años de edad, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 19 años. Maribel ya ha tenido crédito con león 2000 y ha demostrado responsabilidad, honradez, solvencia moral,  los financiamiento le han sido de mucha ayuda para el crecimiento económico de su negocio ya que ha podido invertir en capital de trabajo, el préstamo lo está solicitando para la compra de productos del consumo diario como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevo, leche, pan, tortas dulces, condimentos, hielo, leña entre otros.
texts.en: Maribel is 45 years old, married, with a three-year-old child. She has a small grocery store that has been located in her house for the past 19 years. Maribel has had a loan of 2000 Leon and has shown herself to be responsible, honorable and moral. The loan has provided a lot of help to her with growing her business as she could use it as working capital. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase products for daily use such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, milk, bread, sweet pies, condiments, ice, and firewood among other items.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, sugar, eggs, milk, bread, sweet pies, condiments, ice and firewood among other items.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon Antonio de  43 años de edad de la localidad de Chinandega, soltero con 5 hijos, inicio su negocio desde hace 18 meses dedicándose a la compra y venta de repuestos de bicicleta ubicado en el mercado de su localidad El financiamiento lo quiere para comprar llantas, neumáticos, pega, tornillos, bomba de aire, parches entre otros.
texts.en: Marlon Antonio, age 43, is from Chinandega. He is single and has five children. Eighteen months ago, he started his business; he buys and sells bike parts at a store located in his region. He wants a loan for the purchase of tires, rims, glue, a pump, patches, and other items.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims, glue, screws, a pump, patches, and other items.

loans.name: Mauricio Francisco

texts.es: El señor Mauricio francisco casado de 66 años de edad, con dos hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería desde hace 5 años, el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Inicio el negocio para mejorar sus niveles de vida, sus sueños y metas es crecer más su negocio para así vender más y poder incrementar sus ingresos el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo como: arroz, azúcar, leña, pan, huevos, jabón de baños, jabón de lavar, frutas, verduras, productos de consumo diario para el hogar.
texts.en: Mauricio Francisco is 66 years old, married and has two dependent children.  He has been running a grocery store in his home for five years.  He started the business to improve his standard of living.  His dreams and goals are to further grow his business so that he can sell more and increase his income.  He would like this loan to invest in buying rice, sugar, firewood, bread, eggs, soap, laundry detergent, fruit, vegetables and other staples.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, firewood, bread, eggs, soap, laundry detergent, fruit, vegetables and other staples

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Originally from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Soeurn is 61 years old. She is married with four children, three (two daughters and one son) of whom are still dependent on her for support and are helping the family’s businesses. Soeurn grows paddy rice as the main source of income and supplements her income via planting cassava, raising pigs, and working for others for a fee. She has been with these businesses for 20 years and is able to earn approximately KHR 62,700 per day. 

As the latex from rubber trees always gets a high price, Soeurn plan to grow rubber trees to earn extra income. Therefore, she is applying for the first cycle loan with VisionFund in amount of KHR 4,000,000. She hopes to grow her rubber tree healthfully so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rubber tree seedlings for planting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Judith Audrey

texts.fr: Judith Audrey vit avec son époux et ses quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés dans une école de la place. Le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. Avec un niveau d'instruction secondaire, elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des fleurs, des amuses gueules et des jouets depuis quelques années. Elle se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de satisfaire la forte demande de ses clients qui s'accroît de jour en jour compte tenu du bon emplacement de sa boutique, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev afin de maximiser son profit et de renforcer son stock. Le bénéfice lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de leurs assurer une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Judith Audrey lives with her husband and her four children, who all attend the local school. Her eldest child is 16 years old, and her youngest child is 8 years old.

With a secondary school education, she specialized in the sale of flowers, appetizers, and toys a few years ago. She stocks up at one of the markets in Benin.

Striving to satisfy her clients' strong demand, which is growing daily thanks to the strategic location of her shop, she sought and obtained a micro loan from Finadev in order to maximize her profit and increase her stock. The profits will allow her to help pay for her children's schooling and ensure that they receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy 30 toys, 12 bottles of appetizers, and 20 toys

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children.

Since 2005, Shaker has owned a small shop for selling cigarettes . He has sufficient experience in this field, a good understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate the shop and install an external ceiling. He is aiming to develop his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and install an external ceiling

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
Rozina knows the art of artificial jewelry. Her home is located in a big jewelry market of the city which also helps her capture a wider audience for her business.
Her husband lives abroad and she lives with her mother and 3 children. Her 2 elder children are studying, while her youngest daughter in only 3 years old.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her jewelry-making business. With the loan investment she will buy jewelry-making items such as thread, beads, etc., in larger quantity and better quality.  That will allow her to complete larger orders on time. She is very experienced and expectant that she will be able to make huge profits on this EID (holy day), which is coming soon.

loans.use: To buy jewelry-making items for jewelry  business

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 26 years old and married.

Karar has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3,000 as a youth loan in order to install shutters and two window closets. He also wants to buy a refrigerator. 

He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to install shutters and two window closets in his market. He also wants to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 40 años, es una mujer buena y amable. Está casada con Eduardo, quien se dedica al transporte, y tienen dos hijos, quienes son su razón de esfuerzo y trabajo. Juntos viven en su casa propia y lo que más desea es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de comida como tallarines, frituras, pescado asado y otros; también vende golosinas y gaseosas variadas. La venta la realiza a diario en un centro educativo donde le permitieron tener un puesto interior. Inició hace más de 3 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su esposo y su hijo, ocasionalmente, además de una ayudante de cocina a quien paga por semana de trabajo. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la continua clientela que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Heredó la sazón de su madre, quien le dio las lecciones sobre cómo cocinar y como realizar buenas ventas. Espera seguir trabajando para progresar y salir adelante con su familia, tiene muchos planes, pero por el momento espera la expansión de su negocio.

Este es su crédito número 17 con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por su parte, se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y se siente muy a gusto de poder trabajar con su banco comunal, ya que son buenos y muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará los ingredientes y víveres para la preparación de sus comidas como carnes, arroz, aceites y otros. También golosinas para ofrecer mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Natividad, 40, is a good and kind woman.  She is married to Eduardo, who makes a living through transportation, and they have two children who are their reason for strength and work.  They live together in their own home and what she most wishes for is to be able to offer a better quality of life to her family.

Her work consists of selling food like noodles, fried food, and grilled fish.  She also sells various candies and sodas.  She does her selling daily in an educational center where they allow her to have an indoor stand.  She began more than three years ago and until now she has been doing it with the support of her husband and son, occasionally, in addition to an assistant cook who she pays for her work weekly.  She considers her business profitable enough due to the continuous customers she has and the good profits it leaves her with.  She inherited the seasoning from her mother, who gave her lessons about cooking and how to have good sales.  She hopes to continue working to progress and to get her family ahead in life.  She has many plans, but at the moment she waits for the expansion of her business.

This is her 17th loan with MFP, therefore she hopes to continue with her goals.  For her part, she promises to make her repayments in a timely manner, as she did with the previous loans she has had.  And she feels very at ease working with her communal bank because they are good and responsible people.

With the requested amount, 2000 soles, she will buy ingredients and supplies for the preparation of her food, like meat, rice, oils, and others.  She will also buy candies in order to offer a greater variety.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her food and candy for her stand.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia de 34 años de edad, con dos hijos menores de edad, soltera tiene por actividad ecomomica una fritanga venta de comida tipica de la  su pais ( tacos, enchiladas, tajadas, maduro, gallo pinto, carnes asadas)  ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiempo de tener el negocio 6años, el cual lo aprendio de sus padre y lo inico con esfuerzo propio, en la actualidad esta solicitando el fiananciamiento para la  invertir el el negocio comprado productos para la elaboracion de su comida.
texts.en: Rosa Emilia is 34 years old and single with two children.  She makes a living selling traditional food of her country (tacos, enchiladas, fried unriped and ripened plantain slices, and roasted meats).  Her business is located in her home, and she has had it for 6 years.  She learned the business from her parents and started it through her own efforts.  Currently she is requesting financing to invest in the business so she can buy products to make her food.

loans.use: to buy products to make her food.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es: El banco comunal el triunfo esta comformado por 8 integrantes todos tienne actividad economica diferentes los integrantes son: Graciela, Leyda, Lucrecia, Celso, Maria, Amparo, Imara, Aurelia. Leyda del carmen es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la union del grupo la comunicación la responsabilidad entre todas, Leyda tiene por actividad economica la elaboracion y venta de artesania ubicada en su comunidad, el financiamiento lo quiere la compra de materia prima. Pinceles, pintura, barro, ollas, arcillas. Entre otros.
texts.en:
The El Triunfo community bank is made up of eight members who all work doing different things.  The members are: Graciela, Leyda, Lucrecia, Celso, Maria, Amparo, Imara, and Aurelia.

Leyda del Carmen is the coordinator of the community bank, which means she is in charge of the group meetings and communication among the members.  Leyda works making and selling crafts in her community.  She will use this loan to purchase primary materials, brushes, paint, clay, pots, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase primary materials, brushes, paint, clay, pots, and other items.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es: G.S DIVINO NIÑO NO 10,esta conformado por dos integrantes  Dolores, y Rosa Emilia  tienen varios años de trajar con fundacion leon 2000 lo cual han demostrado ser responsables, trabajadoras, con solvencia de pagos,  por lo tanto en esta ocacion han  sido beneficiada con el programa kiva, lo cual les ha permito incrementar su mercaderia en general  ya que es la actividad a la que se dedica, el financiamiento lo invertiran el la comprar de mercaderia para la sastifaccion de sus clientes como: vestidos, faltas, ropa de ñino, vermudas, camisolines, ropa interior, jugos de sabanas, pantolones de mujer de hombre entre otros.
texts.en: The solidarity group Divino Niño #10 comprises two members: Dolores and Rosa Emilia. They have been working with Fundacion Leon 2000 for several years and have proven themselves to be responsible, hard-working, and solvent in their payments. Therefore, this time they have benefited from the Kiva program, which has allowed them to increase their merchandise in general, which is what they sell. They will invest the financing in purchasing merchandise in order to satisfy their customers, such as: dresses, skirts, children's clothing, shorts, slips, underwear, sheet sets, men and women's pants, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, skirts, children's clothing, shorts, slips, underwear, sheet sets, men and women's pants, and other items.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children that she supports. For the last five years, she has been running a grocery store where she sells assorted vegetables, fruits and cereals, getting a monthly income of KES.20,000. 

She has applied for a loan of KES.60,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to restock and expand her grocery store, especially buying more green vegetables and dry maize to sell. The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business for expansion. Her future dreams is to be successful in life

loans.use: to  buy more green vegetables and dry maize to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonia reside en la ciudad de Ibarra, capital de la provincia de Imbabura, ubicada al norte de la Sierra ecuatoriana. La ciudad cuenta con 181.175 habitantes y es el centro de desarrollo económico del norte del Ecuador. La ciudad tiene una riqueza única de cultura y naturaleza, por lo tanto es una zona turista muy importante del país. La ciudad es conocida por el helado de paila que por su peculiar forma de ser mantienen un sabor a fruta natural que los han hecho famosos alrededor del país. Ibarra también es conocida por un dulce de mora conocido como arrope. El clima de la ciudad es sub tropical con una temperatura que varía de 12°C a 32°C. 

José Antonio de 62 años de edad vive con su esposa Zoila de 51 y sus dos hijos. A pesar de solo haber terminado sus estudios primarios, él fue aprendiz de un zapatero, y con su experiencia en el área abrió su negocio de elaboración de calzado hace 40 años. Desde entonces, trabaja todos los días de la semana para sacar al negocio adelante. Por la dedicación que pone a su trabajo,  José tiene varios clientes especialmente academias militares. José Antonio tiene fe en que su negocio puede crecer. Sin embargo, no ha tenido suerte recibiendo crédito para invertir en su él. Por lo tanto, solicita un crédito a Kiva para poder comprar más materia prima, producir más zapatos, e incrementar sus ingresos. El planea comprar cuero y suelas. De esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y brindará un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Antonia lives in the city of Ibarra, capital of Imbabura province, located in the northern part of the Ecuadorian highlands. The city has 181,175 inhabitants and is the center for economic development in northern Ecuador. 

The city has a unique wealth of culture and nature, so it is a very important tourist area of the country. The city is known for "helados de paila" (fruit sorbets), that because of their uniqueness retain the flavor of natural fruit. This has made them famous around the country. Ibarra is also known for a blackberry sweet called "arrope." The city's climate is sub-tropical, with a temperature that varies between 12°C and 32°C. 

José Antonio is 62. He lives with his wife Zoila, 51, and his two children. In spite of only having finished primary school, he was apprenticed as a shoe-maker, and with his experience in the area, 40 years ago he opened his shop making footwear.  Since then, he has worked every day of the week to keep his business going. 

Because of the dedication he puts into his work, José has several customers, especially military academies. José Antonio has faith that his business can grow. However, he has had no luck getting credit to invest in it. Therefore he is applying to Kiva for a loan so that he can buy more raw material, produce more shoes and increase his income. 

He plans to buy leather and shoe soles. In this way he will improve his family's quality of life and offer his children a better future.

loans.use: To be able to buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Una vitrina que saca afuera de su casa es la que utiliza para exhibir sus productos, el se dedica a vender enchiladas unos de los alimentos mas comunes de la ciudad así es como se gana la vida Alexander un humilde habitante de Estelí, de 31 años de edad, el de oficio operador en micro computadoras también se dedica al comercio desde hace 3 años. Inicio su actividad con capital propio, anteriormente trabaja en un restaurante de la comunidad, del dinero que ahorro de su trabajo decide establecer su propio negocio en su casa de habitación,  este ha sido su primer negocio el cual saca adelante con el apoyo de su mama que le ayuda a atender a sus clientes.
Requiere el préstamo para comprar harina, carne, tortillas, aceite, verduras, etc, toda la materia prima necesaria para elaborar las ricas enchiladas, el estima que el crédito será de ayuda porque podrá invertir mas en su inventario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área de su negocio y llegar a tener su bufet donde pueda ofrecer variedad de comida a sus clientes, su meta próxima es llegar a tener su propia casa para poder ser alguien independiente con el objetivo de vivir cómodamente y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alexander brings a display cabinet outside his house and uses it to show his products. He works selling enchiladas, one of the most common dishes in the city. That is how he earns a living. Alexander is a humble resident of Estelí, he is 31 years old, and is a microcomputer operator by profession. He has also been in business for three years. He started his business with his own capital. He used to work at a local restaurant, and decided to use the money he saved from his job to set up his own business at home. This has been his first business venture, and he is managing to keep it going with support from his mother, who helps him see to his customers. 
He is requesting the loan in order to purchase flour, meat, tortillas, oil, vegetables, and all the raw materials he needs to make his delicious enchiladas. He estimates the loan will be of help because he will be able to invest more in inventory so that he can satisfy his customers' demand. His plan for the future is to expand his business area and to one day have his own buffet, where he could offer a variety of food to his customers. His short-term goal is to own a home so that he can become independent. His aim is to live comfortably and manage to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase flour, meat, tortillas, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married and has two children, ages 11 and 7. She has always wanted to give them a good quality of life. That is why she has had her own business for approximately four years. She started it with a great deal of effort. She sells charcoal as retail. By doing this she has managed to financially contribute to her household so that her family has a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities to get ahead.

She wants to start a new business of selling secondhand clothes. The loan will allow her to buy bundles of clothes for sale.

This way she will manage to have good sales and offer her customers a good variety of products. Also, she will continue to have guaranteed household income for her children to continue having access to a quality education.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La Sra. Felicia tiene 27 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 10 y 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta variedad de comidas en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Felicia va a usar este préstamo para la conexión de alcantarillado para tener un baño en su domicilio, ya que esto le permitirá contar con un servicio básico en su casa y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, la Sra. Felicia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, y utilizara los beneficios para revestimiento y construcción de un baño y ducha, la Sra. Felicia se siente feliz con esta oportunidad que le brindan, ya que hará su sueño realidad que es contar con un baño terminado.
texts.en: Felicia is 27 years old, she is married and she has 2 children aged 10 and 4. She sells different kinds of food in a stall located in a very well-trafficked area of Cochabamba. This is the first loan she is requesting to our institution. Felicia will use it to pay for the connection of a sewer system to have a bathroom in her house, as this will allow her to have a basic service in her house thus granting a more comfortable environment to her family. The reason she is requesting this loan is that she does not have enough money to buy what is needed for the job. Competition is the challenge Felicia has to face in her activity, and she will use the profits to reinvest in the construction of a bathroom with shower. Felicia is happy about this chance that she has been given, as she will make her dream come true by having her bathroom completed.

loans.use: To  pay for the connection of a sewer system to have a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Maria Del Trancito

texts.es: Maria del Transito de 40 años de edad del municipio de somotillo, tiene por actividad economica la venta de ropa usada, desde hace 4años , la cual distribuye de forma ambulante, el cual inicio con ahorros propio y por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para obtener ingresos para su familia, y asi seguir luchando dia a dia para ayudar a sus hijos  y que lleguen a ser profesionales y poder cumplir con su metas y sueños, gracias al apoyo que leon 2000 y el programa kiva ofrecen a los pequeños emprendedores para  para poder tener una herramienta de trabajo propia.
texts.en: Maria del Transito, 40, is from the town of Somotillo.  She's had a business selling used clothing for 4 years. She sells from place to place, and she started the business with her own savings so that she could have a way to work and obtain income for her family.  This way she can continue to strive each day to help her children so that they can become professionals and she can accomplish her goals and dreams, thanks to the support that Leon 2000 and Kiva are offering to entrepreneurs with small businesses so that they can have a tool for their own work.

loans.use: to buy packages of used adult and children´s clothes

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es: Amalia del Socorro de 59 años de edad tiene por actividad economica comerciante, esta emprendedora ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajora de buenas costumbre, en la actualidad ella  esta solicitando financiamiento para mejoras  en su lugar de trabajo, para brindarle mejores condiciones a sus clientes, con el financiamiento comprara material de construccion como: bloques, ladrillos, zinc, arena, cal, hierro, pintura, madera, clavos   entre otros.
texts.en: Amalia del Socorro is 59 years old and she is a retailer. This entrepreneur has proven herself to be a responsible and hard-working person with good values. She is currently requesting a loan to improve her work place in order to offer a better environment to her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy blocks, bricks, zinc, sand, nails and other materials.

loans.use: To buy blocks, bricks, zinc, sand and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds to prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria tiene 49 años y tiene  4 hijos que son de las edades de  16; 9; 7 y 5 años, ella es agricultora se dedica a la siembra de sandia y frutales en su parcela que se encuentran en la localidad de Colonia Porvenir,  este préstamo es el primera secuencia de la institución, la Sra. Victoria va a usar este préstamo para la siembra de sandia y el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, la Sra. Victoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para aumentar su producción,  la Sra. Victoria vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Victoria, 49, has four children whose ages are 16, 9, 7 and 5.  She’s a farmer who grows watermelons and fruit in her field located in Colonia Porvenir.  This loan is the first sequence in the institution and Victoria will use the loan for her watermelon crops and to prepare the soil for planting.  

Victoria faces the business challenge of improving her quality of life and will use profits to increase production.  Victoria sells her products in the local market directly from producer to consumer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to prepare the soil to plant watermelons.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Dominga, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la producción y el comercio mayorista de verduras como legumbres y hortalizas, y lo distribuyen en los diferentes mercados de la región, pero también a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Dominga en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar algunos productos como tomates, cebollas y zanahorias para surtir su oferta.
