Gloria, tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula. 
Gloria  se dedica a la costura. Inicio hace 3 años con su propio capital, especializándose en la elaboración de ropa de cama, forros de muebles y después las vende, no se le dificulto iniciar esta actividad ya que obtuvo la experiencia por su trabajo anterior qué fue en una maquila como operaria de maquina.  También  vende mercadería como zapatos, y ropa como blusas, camisas. El negocio le ha ayudado mucho a mejorar sus ingresos de los cuales a podido reinvertir en el mismo. 
Actualmente ha decidido solicitar su primer préstamo de 7,000 lempiras para poder abastecerse de materiales (telas, hilos), para la elaboración de ropa de cama, forros de muebles y cortinas. Para satisfacer los pedidos de los clientes.
 Su meta es seguir trabajando para tener el capital necesario para ayudar a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 23, is a single mother with three children.  She lives with them in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Gloria is a seamstress.  She started three years ago by using her own capital.  She specializes in making bed linens and slipcovers.  She then sells them.  It was not difficult for her to start this business activity.  That is because she got experience from her previous work, which was in a factory working as a machine operator.

She also sells merchandise like shoes and clothes like blouses and shirts.  The business has helped her a lot to improve her income, which she has been able to reinvest in the business.

She has currently decided to request her first loan for 7,000 lempiras.  With the loan she will be able to stock up on materials (fabric and thread) to make bed linens, slipcovers, and curtains.  She will do this in order to fill her customers’ orders.

Her goal is to continue working in order to have the money needed to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric and thread to make bed linens, slipcovers, and curtains.

loans.name: Mahmadulo

texts.ru: Махмадуло запрашивает новый кредит для увеличения товарооборота. С предыдущего кредита он преуспел и увеличил количество клиентов. Махмадулло не первый раз получает кредит с помощью кредиторов Кива. Он намерен еще раз получить кредит для покупки продуктов и приобретения холодильников. Так как на сегодняшний день у него магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара, Махмадуло хочет заняться только торговлей продуктов питания и открыть продуктовый магазин.
texts.en: Mahmadulo is requesting a new loan to increase his goods turnover.  He succeeded and increased his customer base with the help of the previous loan.  This is not Mahmadulo's first time obtaining a loan with the help of Kiva creditors.  He intends to obtain a loan again and purchase products and refrigerators.  Because, currently Mahmadulo has a store with a mixed selection of merchandise, he wants to get involved in selling products and open a food market.

loans.use: to purchase products and refrigerators

loans.name: Ayaba Elisabeth's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux membres en caution solidaire. Elisabeth, la responsable, est âgée de 33ans. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois vont déjà à l'école, elle a un salon de coiffure où elle vend aussi des chaussures dames. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la sous région et sa clientèle est essentiellement composée des togolaises et des béninoises. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de combler les attentes de ses clientes, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un micro crédit à finadev en vue d'élargir sa commande et d'accroitre son intérêt. Le surplus généré lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de payer ses dettes. Elisabeth se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This relates to a group with two members - acting as mutual guarantors. Elisabeth, the supervisor, is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom already go to school. She has a hairdressing salon where she also sells ladies shoes. She buys her supplies in one of the markets in the local area, and her customers are mainly women from Togo and Bénin.
In order to strengthen her business and to meet the needs of her customers, she has requested and received a micro loan from Finadev so that she can increase the size of her order and generate more interest. The profit generated will allow her to help with the schooling costs of her children and to pay her debts. Elisabeth is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pairs of shoes of various types.

loans.name: Suliko

texts.en:
Suliko is 39 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Khoni District with his wife, Nargizi, and two children (15 and 16 years old). Both of them study in the local school. 

Suliko and Nargizi run an agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with five milking cows and three calves. They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. 

They also own a plot of land where they grow maize, tomatoes, and nuts. The family has a truck; they use it for transportation of vegetables and fruits to nearby villages for selling. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Lari.

Suliko requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and additional vegetables and fruits for sale. After fertilization and properly done seasonal agricultural work, they hope to get a good harvest. 

They will sell the harvested products, together with other vegetables and fruits, in nearby villages. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to finance the studies of their children. Thus, they will be able to create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 38-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. Her husband is a government employee. She has three children, ages 4, 11, and 17. 

Rita operates a sari-sari store within her house. She sells items like seasoning, chips, milk, coffee, toiletries, and other basic household necessities.  

She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and seasoning, which are bought by her neighbors on a daily basis. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements and expansion of her store for a bigger profit.  Any income will be used for family daily consumption, savings, school fees, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and seasoning.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 30 years old, and married, with one child.

Safaa owns a bakery. He established his business in 2011.  He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers. He knows their demands. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2,100 as a Youth Loan to buy a baking machine and a new oven and to install an external ceiling for the shop. He is aiming to gain more profits, which will offer a better living standard for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a baking machine and a new oven and install an external ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es: Maria vive en Las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes. La tienda se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio el cual es de cemento y cuenta con los servicios básicos. El negocio lo empezó hace varios años cuando uno de sus hijos realizo un crédito y le dio un pequeño capital para que pudiera empezar. Ella decidió poner un mini market para no depender del ingreso de su esposo ya que él es jubilado y recibe la pensión. Maria se siente útil y satisfecha de saber que puede aportar en la mantención de su hogar. La atención del negocio la realiza ella sola aunque a veces su esposo la hace compañía. La tienda está bien surtida ya que vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, atún, huevos, colas, verduras etc. con el préstamo va a comprar más de estos productos para el inventario. Su sueño a futuro es poder construir la segunda planta de su casa y así ampliar mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Las Orquídeas, an area north of Guayquil, where she has a grocery store. Her business is located in her home, which is made of cement and receives basic services. Maria opened her store several years ago when one of her children took out a loan and gave her a small amount of capital to get started. She wanted to establish a mini-market so that would not have to rely on her husband’s income. He is retired and receives a pension.

Maria feels useful and is satisfied to know that she is able to support the maintenance of her household. She manages her business by herself but sometimes her husband keeps her company. Her store is well-stocked with basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, tuna, eggs, colas, vegetables, and other items. This loan will be used to buy more of these products to add to her inventory. Her dream for the future is to build a second floor to her house so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, eggs, colas, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Aydee Filonila

texts.es: Aydee es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy II. Tiene 57 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 14 años. Es dueña de un hospedaje y también se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de tubérculos. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece ya que gracias a ello logró construir su hospedaje en otra provincia cerca a la cuidad. Ella dice que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal le enseñan temas motivadores que le ayudan mucho en su vida cotidiana. Aydee invertirá el préstamo que solicita en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar con los acabados de las instalaciones de su hospedaje.
texts.en:
Aydee is a member of the communal bank Rikchariy II.  She is 57 and is the mother of four children.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 14 years.  She is the owner of a hotel and also earns income by farming, specifically by growing tubers such as potatoes.  She is grateful to the institution for the ease with which she has been able to obtain loans; thanks to these loans she has been able to construct her hotel in a province close to her city.  She says that the training she has received through the communal bank has given her a lot of motivation that has helped her a great deal in her daily life.

Aydee will invest the loan funds in construction materials so that she can complete the work on her hotel.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials so that she can finish the work on her hotel.

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es:
Cadith tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy amble, trabajadora y perseverante. Su pareja falleció hace mucho tiempo, con él tuvo cinco hijos, con los que vive actualmente y a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
Su trabajo comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando abre su taller de tapicería en un pequeño local alquilado. Con la ayuda de su hijo, empezó esta actividad hace más de un año.  También se dedica a la venta de carne pollo en el mercado, donde cuenta con un puesto de ventas, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre logra sacar una sonrisa a sus clientes. Cuando se inició en este negocio recuerda que no sabia nada, tuvo que trabajar mucho para aprender y tener mejores ganancias. Actualmente lo realiza con la ayuda de su hija, para la atención al público, estando más de 6 años en esta actividad. Para el futuro espera ampliar su taller de tapicería y seguir creciendo.

Este es su crédito número 19 con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por su parte, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues es una de las fundadoras y se siente muy orgullosa de estar trabajando desde hace mucho tiempo y poder formar al grupo donde todos sean personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 soles, comprará materiales para el taller de tapicería (con 2000 soles) como tapiz, tolderas, hilos, colchones y otros para cubrir mejor la demanda de sus clientes. Con el saldo, invertirá en su negocio de venta de carne de pollo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Cadith is 50 years old, and she is a very nice, hardworking, and persevering woman. She had five children with her husband, who died a long time ago, and she currently lives with her children and wants to provide a better quality of life for them.

Her work begins very early in the morning, when she opens her upholstery workshop in a small rented space. With her son's help, she began this work more than a year ago. She also sells chicken meat in the marketplace, where she has a sales stall. She is a very persuasive saleswoman and always manages to get a smile out of her customers. When she began in this business, she remembers that she didn't know anything, and she had to work hard to learn and to have better earnings. Currently she works with the help of her daughter, to serve the public, having been in this line of work for more than 6 years. For the future she hopes to expand her upholstery workshop and keep on growing.

This is her 19th loan with MFP, which is why she hopes to continue with her goals. For her part, she is committed, once again, to making her payments in installments, as she has done with past loans she had. She is very happy to belong to a communal bank. She is one of the founders and feels very proud to be working for a long time and to be able to form this group where all of the members are responsible, supportive people. With the amount requested, 3000 soles, she will buy materials for her upholstery workshop (with 2000 soles) such as tapestry, thread, cushions, and other items to better cover the needs of her customers. With the balance, she will invest in her business selling chicken meat in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for her upholstery work, and furthermore to buy chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 23 years old. He is married and has two children.

Hashem has owned a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1,800 as youth loan to buy a big generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a big generator.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Pho is a resident living in a small village, Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 32 years old and married with a lovely child attending local school. To make a living, Pho pays full attention to her agricultural business and also works as a paid laborer for extra income. She is very patient in completing her daily tasks at the field and takes cares of her family at home as well. Pho has been in these businesses for five years and typically earns in the neighborhood of USD 3.20 per day.
 
Prior to this loan, Pho had borrowed and paid off three loans already. Those loans were very helpful and had good impact in developing her family-owned businesses and her living conditions. And now, Pho would like to take out another loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle both for business and home use. Her husband will use it to provide transportation services to local people. Pho believes that through the help of the loan her family will be better off gradually. And she hopes to obtain a good quality of life someday.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle both for business and home use.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur has very good ideas and always realizes all of them. He is a very good designer of furniture. He is a master craftsman and sells his beautiful work to local people. If you saw the furniture made by Bahodur, you would like it at once. This furniture gives your home a special touch. 

This wonderful master has a lovely wife and two smart children. His family loves him very much because he is a very careful father and husband. 

Bahodur wants to develop business, but his income isn't enough for it. That’s why he is asking a loan to buy equipment for making furniture in the modern fashion. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy equipment for making furniture.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde es soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño, viven en la casa de su padre  ocupando solo una habitación pequeña, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Belén de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de doce horas vendiendo ropa de forma ambulante a crédito y al contado ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más ropa para mejorar sus ingresos y aumentar  su mercadería.
El sueño de Matilde es independizarse y darle mejor de calidad de vida a su hija.
Es a primera vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Matilde is single, and she has a small child.  They live in her father’s house, occupying only one small room.  The house is located in the Belén area in the city of La Paz.

She currently works for over 12 hours selling clothes in an itinerant manner.  She sells for credit and for cash.  This is the only way that she covers the food expenses and pays for the family’s basic services.

She needs the loan to buy more clothes in order to improve her income and increase her merchandise.

Matilde’s dream is to become independent and to give her child a better quality of life.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to get more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es: Balbina es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer. Tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 2 años. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías (alfombras, frazadas). Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Ella manifiesta que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal le sirven para poder mejorar tanto en el negocio como en su familia. Su sueño es construir su casa donde pueda vivir al lado de su familia. Balbina invertirá el nuevo préstamo que solicita en la compra de hilos de lana de oveja, hilos procesados y rústicos para la elaboración de tejidos artesanales.
texts.en: Balbina is a member of the Banco Comunal Florecer [Community Bank "Florecer"]. She is 42 years old, has a live-in partner, and is a mother of 5 children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for the past 2 years. She works making and selling handicrafts (rugs and blankets). She is grateful to the institution for the loan opportunities offered. She states that the training she receives at the Banco Comunal [Community Bank] helps her to improve her business and family life. Balbina will use the new loan she is asking for to buy wool threads, fine threads, and rustic threads to use in producing handcrafted textiles.

loans.use: to purchase wool threads, fine threads, and rustic threads for the production of handcrafted textiles.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of two children.  Her home is Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the fishing business and seaweed farming for almost ten years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Virgilia is a hardworking woman who wants nothing but to provide a better life for her family, especially for her children. She's been supporting her husband in their business to make it sustainable.

As of now, Virgilia lacks the funds for their fishing business. Virgilia joined CEVI to gain access to the financial services it offers to business-minded individuals like her. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fishing equipment, such as fishing nets, basins and other things. With this loan, she and her husband will be able to increase their catch, thus giving them more sales in their business. 

Virgilia hopes to expand her business in order to augment their income, so that she will be able to send her children to school for a better education.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Olmoskhon

texts.ru: Олмосхон проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. Олмосхон живет вместе с мужем. У нее двое детей. Олмосхон занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты (слива, персик, яблоко виноград и др. виды). Торговлей фруктов Олмосхон занимается более двадцати лет. Она просит кредит для покупки несколько ящиков яблок, винограда, банана и для покупки арбуза.
texts.en: Olmoskhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband.  They have two children.  Olmoskhon is involved in sales at a market.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells fruits, such as plums, peaches, apples, grapes and others.  Olmoskhon has been selling fruits for over twenty years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase several cases of apples, grapes and bananas and to buy watermelons.

loans.use: to purchase several cases of apples, grapes and bananas and to buy watermelons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair windows and floor

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who wants to change his auto-rickshaw body. By replacing his auto-rickshaw body he will be able to save his business asset and also provide better quality transport services to his passengers.

Saima is a very efficient and active lady. She remains at home and does her household responsibilities.She has five sons. Three of them are studying while her eldest son sells fruit.

She is very excited about the future improvement of her husband’s business as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To replace a rickshaw body for transport business

loans.name: Khayom

texts.en:
Khayom is very jolly and intelligent. He likes to work hard as he is a very hard-working man. 

Khayom spends much of his time on the road because he is a driver and transports local people from one place to another. He has a very good character and this is the main aspect of attracting clients. He is the only breadwinner in the family because his wife doesn’t work. They have two children and try to do their best for them. He is asking for a loan to repair his car to develop his business. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To repair car used as taxi

loans.name: Milagros De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señorita Milagros es socia del banco comunal “Fruto Bendito” del Distrito de Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 27 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos. 
Tiene tiempos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y su hermana le ayuda a vender por la carretera.  Toda la mercadería es para repartir. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 shor's, 12 camisas,6 pantalones, 12 polos para niños, 12 polos para adultos, 6 polos para mujeres.
Este negocio es aún pequeño pero gracias a los préstamo ahora puede comprar su mercadería por docenas porque así puede ganar más.  Quiere tener mayor capital para traer más mercadería y surtirla.  Su esposo es trabajador independiente y con lo poco que gana puede cubrir los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Milagros is a member of the Communal Bank “Fruto Bendito”, which is located in the District of Manantay in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  

Milagros has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for some time.  She sells new clothing and her sister helps by selling from a cart.  All of her merchandise is delivered.  

With this new loan of 1,000 PEN Milagros will buy 10 pairs of shorts, 12 shirts, 6 trousers, 12 pullovers for children, 12 pullovers for adults, and 6 pullovers for women.  Her business is still small, but with this loan she will be able to buy merchandise by the dozen so that she can earn more.  

Milagros wants to have more capital so that she can acquire more merchandise and remain stocked.  Her husband is a self-employed worker and with what little he earns they are able to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Ilsia Evelyn

texts.es:
Ilsia, desea comprarse más leña, maíz, bolsas, hilos y telas, para todo esto solicita un nuevo préstamo que le brinde los recursos económicos de los cuales realmente ella no cuenta, ya que son necesarios para poder tener continuidad en negocio siguiendo esta producción de tortillas y poder confeccionar ropa, espera tener un buen efecto que le permite alcanzar sus expectativas.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo ya que compró dos carga de leña y seis sacos de maíz que fueron los que hasta el momento se han dado la producción necesaria, ademas realizo unos trabajos en su vivienda, en estos días a manteniendo un buen nivel de ventas y de ingresos, está creciendo en el negocio por lo mismo espera continuar en este mismo curso a través de este nuevo préstamo.
texts.en:
Ilsia wants to buy more firewood, corn, bags, thread, and fabrics. Obtaining all of these items requires that she ask for a new loan so that she can receive the financial resources that she does not have. These items are needed to continue her businesses of producing tortillas and sewing clothes. She hopes to achieve good results that live up to her expectations.

Her previous loan had a positive effect. Ilsia was able to buy two bundles of firewood and six sacks of corn that have given what she needs to continue producing thus far. In addition, she was able to complete a few repair jobs around her home. These days she has been able to maintain a good level of sales and profits. Her business is growing, so she hopes that this will continue as a result of this new loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, bags, thread, and fabrics.

loans.name: Noemi Antonia

texts.es: Noemi es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer. Tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 3 años y es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes. Ella dice que en su Banco Comunal  aprendió a ahorrar y por ello se siente orgullosa de sí misma, las capacitaciones que recibe son temas que le  ayudan para mejorar su negocio y también en la familia. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda. Noemi invertirá el préstamo que solicita en la compra de abarrotes, golosinas, y de unas maquinas exhibidoras de bebidas.
texts.en: Noemi is a member of the Banco Comunal Florecer [Community Bank "Florecer"]. She is 26 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for the past 3 years, and is the owner of a grocery store. She says that she learned how to save at the Banco Comunal [Community Bank], and feels proud of herself for this. She receives training on topics that help her to improve her business and also her family life. She is grateful to the institution for the loan opportunities offered. Her dream is to build her own home. Noemi will use the loan that she is asking for to buy groceries, sweets, and beverage display cases.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, sweets, and display cases for beverages

loans.name: Muhayyo

texts.ru: Мухайё родилась 1963 году в Исфаре. Она живет вместе с мужем. У них один ребенок. Мухайё успешная и целеустремленная женщина. Она очень счастливо живет с мужем. Мухайё имеет богатый опят в области животноводства. Она разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Ее муж хороший человек. Именно он помогает ей в продвижении ее деятельности. Мухайё увеличивает поголовья скота изо дня в день. Также она получает и продает козье молоко. Она просит кредит для закупа коз и двух овец. Мухайё ждет поддержки со стороны Кива и кредиторов Кива.
texts.en: Muhayyo was born in 1963 in Isfara.  She lives together with her husband, and they have one child.  Muhayyo is a successful and goal-oriented woman.  She happily lives with her husband.  Muhayyo has a rich experience in the animal husbandry field.  She breeds small livestock at home.  Her husband is a good person.  He helps her with moving her business forward.  Muhayyo is increasing her livestock headcount day-to-day.  She also obtains and sells goat milk.  She is requesting this loan to purchase goats and two sheep.  Muhayyo is awaiting the support from Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy goats and two sheep

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 27 years old and single with one child aged three years. She has been into the retail shop and grocery business for three years, earning KES 22,000 monthly. This is Emily’s second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan.

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, some groceries and tea leaves for resale. She plans to plough the anticipated profits  back into her business. 

Her dream is to manage her business well and provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 32 years old and comes from Gaza. He is married and lives with his wife and two children.


Mahmoud has been working as a medical sales representative in a company and has owned a pharmacy for seven years and has two employees helping him. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy an air conditioner, closets, and display cabinets for the pharmacy.

He wishes to develop his work and increase the amounts and kinds of medicine in the pharmacy and so improve his income.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, closets and display cabinets for the pharmacy

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old ambitious young man from Gaza. He has owned a clothing store for guys' wear for three years. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an air conditioner, display shelves and some goods and clothes.

He hopes that by having this loan the amount of clothes displayed will increase and his income as well. He wishes to develop his work and initiate his own family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, display shelves and some goods and clothes.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is thirty-eight years old and married with two children. He operates a pig farming business, and he has been in this business for nine years earning a monthly income of thirty-two thousand shillings.

This will be his fifth loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to purchase twenty-seven piglets for rearing and later sale. He plans to use the anticipated profit to invest back into the business.


He hopes to buy a dairy cow and supply milk to the village dairy in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  twenty-seven piglets.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La señorita Milagros es socia del banco comunal “El Paraíso” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.
Lleva cinco ciclos trabajando con los préstamos que Manuela Ramos que les da cada ciclo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda  mano, y lo hace en su misma casa, tiene la ayuda de su mamá quien vive con ella.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 camisas, 20 pantalones, 10 short, 10 blusas, 5 faldas, 10 polos, 10 pantalones para niños, 5 chompas, 2 casacas, 6 vestidos.
Con los ingresos de su negocio mantiene a su pequeño hijo y también puede ayudar a su mamá con algunos gastos básicos del hogar, esta agradecida con Manuela Ramos por brindarle los préstamo.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of El Paraiso (The Paradise), a Communal Bank located in the Coronel Portillo district, in the De Ucayali department. She is 22 years old, she is single and she has one child.
She has been working five cycles with the loans she has received by Manuela Ramos. She sells used clothes ion her own house, and she is helped by her mother who lives with her in the same house.
With her new loan of 1,000.00 PEN she will buy 15 shirts, 20 trousers, 10 shorts, 10 blouses, 5 skirts, 10 polo shirts, 10 trousers for children, 5 sweaters, 2 zip jackets and 6 dresses.
With the earnings of her activity she provide for her young child, on top of helping her mother paying for some of the basic expenses of the house. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for having granted her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Yuri

texts.ru:
Юрий занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельность в деревне Шишкерт, Сьюникского региона, на протяжении 10 лет.  Юрий разводит пчел, крупный рогатый скот, овец и кур. Также он выращивает овощи и фрукты. Продавая полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию: мед, говядину, баранину, молоко, яйца, шерсть, овощи и фрукты, на рынке города Капана, Юрий имеет возможность содержать свою большую семью
Юрию 47 лет. Он получил специальность водителя в профтехучилище и, параллельно с сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, он работает водителем в одной из капанских организаций. Юрий женат и у него трое детей: сын и две дочери. Жена Юрия работает поваром в одной из капанских столовых, сын помогает отцу в ведении сельского хозяйства, старшая дочь работает в продавщицей в магазине, младшая дочь учится в колледже на связиста. Также с Юрием проживают его родители, которые по мере своих возможностей помогают ему в ведении сельского хозяйства.
Юрию необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драмов, который он потратит на организацию работ по уборке сена и заготовку корма для скота. В частности он потратит деньги на покупку дизельного топлива, аренду сельскохозяйственной техники, покупку веревки для перевязки сена и т.д.
texts.en: Yuri has been involved in agricultural work in the Shishkert village of the Syunik region for ten years.  He keeps bees, cattle, sheep and chickens.  He also grows vegetables and fruits.  Selling the resulting products, such as honey, beef, lamb, milk, eggs, wool, vegetables and fruits, at the market of Kapan, allows Yuri to have the ability to support his large family.  Yuri is 47 years old.  He got a speciality of a driver at a technical college and works as a driver at one of the Kapan organizations parallel to his agricultural business.  Yuri is married and has three children: a son and two daughters.  His wife works as a cook at one of the Kapan cafes, his son helps the father with running the agricultural business, the oldest daughter works as a salesperson at a store, and the youngest attends a college to become a telecommunications worker.  Yuri's parents also live with him, and they help him to run the agricultural business within their abilities.  Yuri needs a loan in the amount of 500,000 dram to organize hay-gathering work and to prepare livestock feed.  He will spend this money partially on buying diesel fuel, leasing agricultural machinery, buying rope to tie the hay, etc.

loans.use: to organize hay-gathering work and to prepare livestock feed

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 36,750 pesos Carmen podrá comprar mercancía para ampliar el inventario de su tienda. Hace 2 años que Carmen comenzó a vender zapatos a sus amigas y vecinos cercanos, hasta que este fue creciendo y pudo instalar una tienda de ropas, zapatos y accesorios. Carmen es casada y tiene una niña de 3 años. 
El sueño de Carmen es tener su casa propia, por lo que cada dia se empeña en dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, para asegurar la fidelidad de los mismos en todo lo que dependa de ella.
texts.en:
With a loan of 36,750 pesos, Carmen will be able to buy merchandise to increase the inventory in her store.  Two years ago she started to sell shoes to her friends and neighbors.  Her business has grown to the point where she was able to open her own store for shoes, clothes and accessories.  

She is married and has a three-year-old daughter.  Her dream is to have her own home. To this end she strives every day to provide good service to her customers so that she can ensure their loyalty and that they come to her for all of their clothing needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sajjad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 20 years old, married, and he has two children.

Sajjad has owned a coffee shop since 2009, offering different types of beverages. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation, and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as youth loan to pay the annual rent for the shop and to buy a small generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop and to buy a small generator

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 47 years old; she is married and lives in a small village of Mtskheta District with her family:  her husband Loseb and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. 

The family earns its living through an agricultural business. They have two milk cows and produce cheese. They sell cheese on the local open market. Along with the agricultural business, Loseb works in construction.  The family's average monthly income is 500 Lari -- which is hardly enough even for food for the family of three. 

Lela requested a loan to repair the bathroom. She will purchase construction materials and do the repair. It is very important for the family to improve the sanitary conditions in the house. With this loan, Lela will be able to improve living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her bathroom.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 27 years old, and married, with no children.

Haidar has owned a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers.  He knows their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2,400 as youth loan in order to buy four refrigerators and expand his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four refrigerators and expand his inventory.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto de 48 años de edad del municipio de chinandega, soltero, tiene por actividad economica una sala de belleza ubicada en su casa de habitacion desde hace 18 años,  herramienta de trabajo que inicio para tener una forma de subsistir, ya que no encontraba trabajo , y como habia sacado cursos  de belleza decidio aperturar su propio negocio en cual en la actulidad le ha sido muy rentable,  hoy en dia tiene mucho clientes fijos y eventuales, el fiananciamiento lo esta solicitando para comprar equipo de trabajo como: tijeras, peines, cremas de afeitar, secadoras, colonias, talcos, cuchillas, peinadores, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto, age 48, lives in the town of Chinandega. He is single and has managed a beauty salon in his home for the past 18 years. Jorge started this business as a way of supporting himself since he did not have a job. He had taken beauty courses and then decided to open his own business, which has been very profitable. Today he has many established clients and walk-in customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy equipment for his work such as scissors, combs, shaving creams, dryers, colognes, powders, razors, barber capes, and other items.

loans.use: to buy scissors, combs, shaving creams, dryers, colognes, powders, razors, barber capes, and other items.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha. Tiene 44 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado. Se siente orgullosa de sí misma porque aprendió a ahorrar, y cuenta con la amistad de sus compañeras de su Banco Comunal. Nos comenta que las capacitaciones que recibe la ayudaron mucho y ahora sabe cómo administrar de manera adecuada su dinero. Su sueño es terminar con el acabado de su vivienda. Agripina invertirá el préstamo que solicita en la compra de semillas de diferentes vegetales.
texts.en: Agripina is a member of the Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha [Community Bank Ccatun Sacha]. She is 44 years old and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 2 years, and works selling vegetables in the market. She feels proud of herself because she has learned to save, and has the friendship of her colleagues from the Banco Comunal [Community Bank]. She says that the training she received there helped her a lot, and now she knows how to manage her money well. Her dream is to finish work on her home. Agripina will use the loan she is asking for to purchase seeds of different vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of different vegetables.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod is a man who always finds new ways of income.  He is energetic and handsome.  Farhod likes to be in a competitive business because he is a very successful business man. 

He has been in animal husbandry for more than ten years.  He buys cattle, raises them and sells them to local people. He has many customers, and many of them are butchers. 

Farhod has a lovely wife and three children. Farhod is only breadwinner in the family. His children are in school, and their needs are growing. He is asking a loan to buy young cattle for developing his business. He awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to raise.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesanias,la socia vende chompas,mantas,telares y chalinas,la socia tiene una tienda donde atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas,telares y mantas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to manage her business of selling handcrafted items such as sweaters, blankets, woven articles, and scarves. She has a store that she operates from 8am to 6pm. Through this business, she has been able to help her son move forward. Her dream is to expand and improve her craft business.

The member is requesting a loan in order to buy sweaters, woven articles, and blankets in bulk. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, woven articles, and blankets in bulk.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru:
Икром занимается торговлей кураги и переработкой абрикосового сада с целью дальнейшей реализации. Ему 37 лет. Икром живет с женой. У него трое детей. Торговлей Икром занимается один, но в переработки абрикоса ему помогает жена. В этой области Икром три года. 
Икром просит кредит для приобретения саженцев абрикосовых деревьев. Кроме того он хочет купить один гектар земли рядом с абрикосовым садом.
texts.en: Ikrom is involved in selling dried apricots and processing of an apricot orchard for future sale.  He is 37 years old.  Ikrom lives with his wife, and they have three children.  Ikrom is involved in sales by himself, but his wife helps him with processing the apricots.  He has been in this business for three years.  Ikrom is requesting this loan to purchase apricot tree seedlings.  Besides this, he wants to purchase one hectare of land next to his apricot orchard.

loans.use: to purchase apricot tree seedlings and one hectare of land

loans.name: Mohidakhon

texts.ru: Мохидахон родилась 1989 году в Исфаре. Она трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Мохидахон не замужем. Она не имеет детей. Мохидахон занимается сушкой и продажей абрикосов. У нее более 20 плодовых деревьев. Мохидахон уже три года занимается этим видом деятельности. Она берет кредит для приобретения саженцев абрикосовых деревьев с целью расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Mohidakhon was born in 1989 in Isfara.  She is a hardworking and responsible woman.  Mohidakhon is not married and has no children.  She is involved in drying and selling apricots.  She has over 20 fruit-producing trees.  Mohidakhon has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan to buy apricot-tree seedlings in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 33 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy dinámica. Está separada del padre de sus tres hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Vive con su anciano padre y sus hijos, donde les brinda educación y una crianza con valores para ser formados como buenas personas en el futuro.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de su localidad. Decidió empezar con esta actividad cuando vio que la economía de su hogar siempre pasaba apuros, tuvo la idea, luego se dio valor y fuerza para lograr concretarla. Empezó a vender ropa trayéndola desde la capital, ya que ahí le costaba más barato, vendía poco y sólo entre sus vecinos, con el paso del tiempo pudo tener un pequeño local y ahora vende en mayores cantidades. Está muy contenta, ya que le genera buenas ganancias con lo cual puede aportar en la economía de su hogar. 

Este es su préstamo numero 7 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que le permitirá estar más tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse más con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará ropa y accesorios de toda variedad, preparándose para la venta en estas fiestas patrias y continuar con su trabajo para seguir ofreciendo novedades a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen is 33 years old.  She is a nice, friendly, dynamic woman who is separated from the father of her three children.  She wants to provide her children with a better quality of life.  Carmen lives with her elderly father and her children.  She provides the children with an education and an upbringing which teaches them values and prepares them as upstanding citizens of the future.

Carmen has been selling clothing from a stall in her town market for three years.  She decided to start this business when she saw that her household was experiencing financial difficulties.  She had the idea and then summoned up the courage and strength to see it through.  She started selling clothing which she bought in the capital city because it was cheaper there.  At first, she only sold a little and only to her neighbors.  Over time, she was able to get hold of small premises and she now sells in larger quantities.  She is very happy because her business makes her good profits which enables her to contribute financially to her household.

This is Carmen's seventh loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support because it will allow her to calmly make progress with her business plans.  She pledges to make her repayments on time and, above all, to work well with the other members of her community bank who are very supportive people.

Carmen will use the 2,000 soles she has requested to buy all kinds of clothing and accessories so that she can get ready for the Peruvian national holidays and continue in her work, offering new products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories for the Peruvian national holidays

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha. Tiene 47 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 2 años. Es dueña de una bodega que tiene en su propia casa y trabaja en ella con la ayuda de sus hijas en sus tiempos libres, por otra parte se dedica a la venta de truchas al por menor. Se siente feliz de pertenecer a su Banco Comunal porque allí aprendió a ahorrar y conoció amigas con las que intercambia experiencias. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Emilia invertirá el préstamo que solicita en la compra de truchas al por mayor y también en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar y bebidas.
texts.en: Emilia is a member of the Ccatun Sacha Communal Bank. She is 47 years old and is the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years. She is the owner of a small store that she has in her own home, and she works there with the help of her children who help her in their spare time. She also sells trout. She feels happy to belong to the communal bank because there she learned to save and also met friends with whom she has exchanged experiences. She is grateful to the institution for the ease with which the loan was offered. Emilia will inves the solicited loan in the purchase of wholesale trout and also purchase goods for her store, such as rice, sugar and drinks.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale trout and groceries such as rice, sugar, and drinks

loans.name: Xenia

texts.es:
Xenia tiene 20 años, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de amable y jovial. Es soltera y no tiene hijos todavía. Vive en una casa alquilada con sus padres y su hermano, a los quiere mucho.
Su negocio es la venta de comida como tallarines, arroz chaufa, pollo frito y refrescos. Para eso instala una mesa y sillas en el frotis de su vivienda, al medio día, donde brinda almuerzos. Se inició con el apoyo de un capital que le brindó su madre hace tres años, trabajó con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logrando ganarse una regular clientela a la que ahora atiende regularmente. Le gusta sentirse una mujer productiva, su negocio la distrae y relaja, además con el ingreso económico que le genera puede apoyar a su familia y pagar sus estudios universitarios por las noches. Lo que no le gusta es el calor de la cocina a carbón, pues perjudica la salud, pero eso no la desanima, ya que tiene planes de continuar y ampliar su negocio.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se siente bien con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará utensilios de cocina como platos, ollas, sartenes; también ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Xenia is 20 years old.  She is a hard-working, dynamic woman who is friendly and cheerful.  She is single and doesn't have any children yet.  She lives in a rental house together with her parents and brother who she loves very much.

Xenia's business is selling food such as noodles, 'arroz chaufa' (a Peruvian-Asian dish), fried chicken and soft drinks.  She sets up a table and chairs out the front of her house at midday and sells lunches there.  She started out with some capital that her mother gave her three years ago.  She has worked with a lot of effort and commitment and gained a bunch of customers who now visit her regularly.  She enjoys feeling productive.  Her business both entertains and relaxes her.  In addition, she is able to use the income that she makes to support her family and pay for her university studies (she studies at night).  What she does not like is the heat from the coal-burning stove as it is bad for her health.  However, she does not become discouraged and has plans to continue in her business and expand it.

This is Xenia's third loan from MFP and she hopes to continue achieving her aims.  She feels happy to be a member of her community bank as she considers the members to be responsible people.

Xenia will use the 1,500 soles she has requested to buy cooking utensils such as dishes, pans and skillets.  She will also buy ingredients for making food.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha. Tiene 48 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 3 años. Es dueña de una bodega de abarrotes. Le gusta mucho ser parte de su Banco Comunal ya que en el recibe capacitaciones con las que aprende mucho sobre su negocio y su familia, y también conoció amigas con las que comparte sus experiencias. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Está feliz porque cada día mejora su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Justina invertirá el préstamo que solicita en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, bebidas, fideos, harina, etc.
texts.en: Justina is a member of the Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha [Community Bank Ccatun Sacha]. She is 48 years old and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 3 years, and is the owner of a small grocery store. She enjoys being a part of the Banco Comunal [Community Bank] very much, because she receives training that teaches her a lot about her business and her family, and also because she has made friends with whom she can share her experiences. She is grateful to the institution for the loan opportunities offered. She is happy because her quality of life, and that of her family, improves every day. Justina will use the loan she is requesting to purchase groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, beverages, noodles, flour, etc.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, beverages, noodles, flour, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja, quien por el momento se encuentra desempleado, uno de sus hijos, su nuera y sus dos nietos. Tuvo en total diez hijos, pero ya son mayores e independientes.

Su trabajo es la venta de plátano. Esta actividad la realiza en el frontis de su vivienda. Ya tiene muchos clientes, porque sus frutas son de muy buena calidad y es una vendedora muy alegre. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede conversar con las personas y bromear entre ellas. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y al principio, cuando se inició, le era muy complicado, ya que tenía que aprender el negocio de cómo conservar el plátano en buen estado, porque en algunas ocasiones se le malogró y perdió su inversión; pero con el tiempo logró aprender y ahora le está yendo mucho mejor. Para el futuro, desea tener un pequeño local donde pueda vender sus plátanos sin temor a que se malogren por lo caluroso de clima de la región.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, pues así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo, donde todos son muy puntuales.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, invertirá, en su totalidad, en la compra de plátanos de diversas variedades, ya que últimamente está teniendo mayor demanda y desea ampliar el tipo y la calidad de su producto.
texts.en:
Juana, 56, is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She and her husband--who, for now, is unemployed--live in a house that they own, along with a son, his wife and their two children.  Juana has ten children, all of whom are grown now.

Juana operates a fruit and vegetable sales business in a space that she's set aside at the front of her house.  She has many customers who rely both on the freshness of her products and her cheerful service.  The business suits her because she likes meeting her customers and sharing a laugh with them.  She has operated the business for 2 years and lost money at first because her fruits and vegetables often rotted before she could sell them.  Over time, she learned the business and says that she's doing much better now.  For the future, she would like to open a small shop where she can sell platanos without worrying that they'll rot in the region's hot climate before she can sell them.

This is Juana's fourth MFP loan and she says that she is grateful for your support because it will help her to carry on her business.  She wants the other members of her community bank to view her as a reliable member and she is committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time.  
Juana will use your 1000-soles loan to stock her business with different kinds of platanos because that's the product she sells that is most in demand.  The investment will help her to provide a wider range of merchandise.

loans.use: to stock her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Mudasirkhon

texts.ru:
Мудасирхон проживает в городе Исфара. Мудасирхон разведена. Она живет вместе с родителями. Ей 42 года. У нее двое детей. Мударисхон занимается торговлей сухофруктов. В основном она занимается переработкой и продажей кураги. Мудасирхон имеет богатый опыт в этой области. Она более пятнадцати лет занимается торговлей. 
Мудасирхон просит кредит для покупки сухофруктов и абрикосов. Она надеется на лучшее.
texts.en: Mudasirkhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is divorced and lives with her parents.  She is 42 years old and has two children.  Mudasirkhon is involved in selling dried fruits.  She primarily processes and sells apricots.  Mudasirkhon has a rich experience in this field.  She has been in sales for over fifteen years.  Mudasirkhon is requesting this loan to purchase dried fruits and apricots.  She hopes for the best.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits and apricots

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 40 años, es una muy buena mujer y madre de dos hijos: Yemilet de 13 años y, el menor, Frank de 7 años, quienes son su razón de esfuerzo, ya que desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.  Está casada con Edson, de 47 años, quien es electricista. La casa donde viven le fuera heredada por sus padres.

Ella se dedica a elaborar piñatas. Instaló su tienda en un espacio amplio de su vivienda, allí recibe a sus clientes, con quienes le gusta conversar. Además de las piñatas, también ofrece todo tipo de artículos para las fiestas infantiles, como globos, gorritos, etc. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 3 años, tiempo que le sirvió para hacerse conocida por la calidad del servicio que brinda. Antes de esto trabajaba para otras personas confeccionando las piñatas, lo que no le permitía tener buenos ingresos. Le está yendo muy bien y como toda mujer emprendedora tiene metas y sueños que en algún momento le gustaría realizar. Pero por ahora solo desea mantener su negocio para seguir juntando el capital suficiente para poder empezar a expandirlo.

Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, por ello espera concretar sus planes. Se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará más artículos para fiestas y los materiales necesarios para la confección de piñatas.
texts.en:
Nilda is 40 years old.  She is a very nice lady and the mother of two children: 13-year-old Yemilet and 7-year-old Frank.  Her children are the reason she works hard, as she would like to be able to offer them a better quality of life.  Nilda is married to 47-year-old Edson who is an electrician.  They inherited the house in which they live from her parents.

Nilda's business is making piñatas.  She set up her store in a large space in her home and this is where she greets her customers who she loves chatting to.  In addition to selling piñatas, she also sells all kinds of items for children's parties such as balloons, party hats, etc.  She has been in this business for more than three years and, during this period, she has become well known for her good-quality service.  Before she started this business she used to work for other people, making piñatas.  That work did not make her good income.  Her current business, however, is going very well and, in common with all entrepreneurial women, she has aims and dreams which she would like to fulfill.  However, for now she is focusing on continuing in her business so that she can continue putting together enough money to expand it.

This is Nilda's fourth loan from MFP and she hopes to be able to carry out her plans.  She pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.  She is very happy to belong to her community bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive people.

Nilda will use the 2,000 soles she has requested to buy more party supplies and the materials she needs to make piñatas.

loans.use: to buy party supplies and materials for making piñatas

loans.name: Vardan

texts.ru:
Вардан занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом на протяжении 10 лет. Он арендует участок земли в деревне Каджаран, Сьюникского региона, где выращивает овощи, в основном картофель, на продажу. А в городе Мегри (Meghri) Вардан выращивает фрукты: гранаты, инжир и персики. Выращенные овощи и фрукты Вардан реализует в городах Ереване, Капане и Каджаране. 
Также у Вардана имеется культиватор, при помощи которого он вспахивает землю для жителей города Каджарана за оплату. Для увеличения доходов своей семьи Вардан хочет купить ручную сенокосилку, которая позволит ему косить сено также за оплату. Для этой цели Вардану необходим кредит в размере 650.000 драм.
Вардану 46 лет и он проживает в городе Каджаране со своей женой, дочерью и сыном. Жена Вардана работает на комбинате города Каджарана, дочь недавно окончила школу, а сын еще учится в школе.
texts.en: Vardan has been involved in an agricultural business for ten years.  He leases a plot of land in the Kadjaran village in the Syunik region, where he grows vegetables and fruits, primarily potatoes, for sale.  Vardan also grows fruits, such as pomegranates, figs and peaches, in the city of Meghri.  He sells fruits and vegetables in the cities of Yerevan, Kapan and Kadjaran.  Vardan also has a cultivator, with the help of which he plows soil for the residents of Kadjaran for pay.  Vardan wants to buy a manual grass mower, which would allow him to cut hay also for pay in order to increase his family's income.  This is why Vardan needs a loan in the amount of 650,000 dram.  Vardan is 46 years old, and he lives in Kadjaran with his wife, daughter and son.  Vardan's wife works at a Kadjaran factory, daughter recently finished school, and son still attends school.

loans.use: to buy a manual grass mower

loans.name: Nidia Marilu

texts.es: Nidia es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy  II. Tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y es madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 5 años. Se dedica al alquiler de aparatos topográficos (nivel, teodolito, estación). Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que ofrece. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es que le enseñaron a ahorrar y las capacitaciones porque cada una de ellas le enseña algo que aplica en su negocio o en su familia. En las reuniones de su Banco Comunal conoció a muchas amigas con las cuales comparte e intercambia sus diferentes experiencias de vida. Su sueño es formar una empresa constructora. Nidia invertirá el préstamo que solicita en el acabado de una oficina de trabajo donde funciona su negocio.
texts.en:
Nidia is a member of the communal bank Rikchariy II.  She is 38 years old, is married, and is a mother of four children.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for five years.  She has a business that rents out topographic equipment (machinery for leveling and surveying).  

She is grateful to the institution for the ease with which she is able to obtain a loan.  What she likes most about the communal banks is that they taught her how to save, and she appreciates all of the training sessions, because each one teaches her something that she can apply in her business or family life.  Through the communal bank meetings she has made many friends, who share their life experiences with each other.  Her dream is to start a construction business.  

She will use the loan proceeds to finish constructing an office for her business.

loans.use: to finish building an office for her business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Татьяна расширила ассортемент обуви и увеличила торговый оборот. На этот раз Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку легких женских босоножек, которые называются "лодочки" и очень популярны в этом сезоне.

Татьяна очень ответственная, у нее не было ни одного дня опоздания по кредиту.

В этом году сын Татьяны поступает в колледж и ему нужна финансовая поддержка мамы. Татьяна надеется, что ее бизнес будет успешным и она сможет заработать достаточно, чтобы помочь сыну.
texts.en: Thanks to her previous loan, Tatyana expanded the selection of shoes and increased goods turnover.  This time, she is requesting a loan to purchase light women's sandals, called pumps, which are very popular during this season.  Tatyana is very responsible.  She never had a late loan payment.  This year, Tatyana's son is starting college and needs financial help from his mother.  Tatyana hopes that her business will be successful and that she would be able to earn enough to help her son.

loans.use: to purchase popular women's sandals

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru:
Махмудчон родился 1983 году в районе Шахритус. Он уже не первый раз получает кредит в нашей организации. Махмудчон успел убедиться в эффективности наших кредитных услуг и решил снова обратиться за помощью. Предыдущий кредит он использовал для приобретения запчастей велосипедов, за счет чего у него увеличилось количество клиентов.  
В этот раз Махмудчон берет кредит в размере 8 000 сомони для покупки запчастей и хозяйственных товаров. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара, чтобы не потерять постоянных клиентов. Махмудчон трудолюбивый и порядочный гражданин Таджикистана. Он готов работать днем и ночью, чтобы обеспечить свою семью.
texts.en: Mahmudjon was born in 1983 in the Shahrituz district.  This is not his first time obtaining a loan from our organization.  Mahmudjon was able to see the effectiveness of our credit service and decided to request assistance again.  He used his previous loan to buy bicycle spare parts, which helped him to increase his customer base.  This time, Mahmudjon is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 somoni to buy spare parts and household goods.  He wants to expand the selection of his merchandise in order to retain regular clients.  Mahmudjon is a hardworking and decent citizen of Tajikistan.  He is prepared to work day and night to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle spare parts and household goods

loans.name: Tegla

texts.en:
Tegla is a 52-year-old married woman. She has seven children, ranging from 12 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be an influential woman.

She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk . She has been involved in this business for five years and has one employee. Her business is located in a good business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern for family use. 

She says her biggest business challenge is the lack of transportation for getting her milk to customers. 

Her business goal is to improve her business by changing the grade of her cows to zero grazing within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a horticulture farmer .

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern for family use.

loans.name: Loida

texts.es:
Loida tiene 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Su pareja es Moisés, quien se dedica al comercio, fruto de esa unión tienen cuatro hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron a base de mucho esfuerzo.

Su actividad es la venta de comestibles y abarrotes de primera necesidad. Para eso acondicionó una bodega en su vivienda hace más de 4 años, con un capital propio. Vio una oportunidad de negocio y la necesidad de sus vecinos, y luego fue creciendo con préstamos de MFP. Además cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo en la atención a los clientes. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos y estar en la comodidad de su casa para cuidar de sus menores hijos. El problema es cuando llueve constantemente, eso dificulta el acceso, pues se malogran las calles por el barro que se forma, pero eso no la desanima. 

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP,  por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual como en créditos anteriores. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 4000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceites, fideos y otros, en mayor volumen, a precio por mayor para así tener mayores ganancias. También comprará gaseosas y golosinas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Loida, 44, is a hard-working woman, an entrepreneur with a strong drive to get ahead in the world.  She and her partner, Moises, a merchant, have four children.  They live in a house that they scrimped and saved to buy.

Loida operates a corner grocery where she sells the everyday products that her customers want.  She used her own savings to start the business 4 years ago and operates it now from a space in her house.  She saw that there was demand for a grocery in the neighborhood and she's grown it with MFP loans.  Her son helps her with the business.  She tells us that she likes owning her own business because it provides an extra income for paying household bills and making improvements to her house.  Her biggest problem is the weather.  Rain is common here and the roads turn to mud when they're wet, something that makes access to her store difficult.  She never lets problems get her down, though.

This is Loida's fourth MFP loan and she says that she is grateful for your support because it will help her to carry on her business.  She is committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time, just as she's done with past loans.  Loida will use your 4000-soles loan to buy bulk supplies of the products she sells--rice, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, etc.--so that she can get them at the lowest cost.  She will buy snacks and sodas that she will sell, as well.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Al-Jwahr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Jwahr.  It consists of five ladies named Gdria, Ameena, Johra, Fawziah and Afaf.  They live in Hadramout, Yemen. 

Johra, who is 49 years old, lives with her family in Hadramout, Yemen.  She sells vegetables, including tomatoes, peppers and onions, in addition to others.  She has been in this business for one year and has a lot of experience in sales.  People prefer her because she always has what they need, offering a quality product and affordable prices in addition to good service. 

Johra is an entrepreneurial woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She is always looking for new opportunities because she wants to be successful.  For some time she has wanted to expand her business by investing in inputs, but she did not have enough capital.  For that reason, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy vegetables, including tomatoes, peppers and onions, and fruits, including apples and bananas.  She has good references and is very responsible.  She is also confident that her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Sulejka

texts.es:
Sulejka tiene 42 años, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y muy dinámica. Su pareja es Justo, de 48 años, con quien tienen tres hijos: Iván de 15 años, Ximena de 11 y la menor, Saori de un año. Juntos, viven en la casa de sus suegros.
Su actividad es la venta de comida rápida, como salchipapas, pollo broaster, arroz chaufa y otros. La venta la realiza en el frontis de su vivienda; desde muy temprano inicia su labor, cuando va al mercado en busca de los mejores ingredientes, una vez en su casa comienza a preparar sus deliciosos platos que le han hecho muy conocida en su barrio. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 2 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su hermana. Lo considera rentable porque le genera buenos ingresos económicos, pues antes de esto trabajaba para otras personas y tenía muchas dificultades, ya que no tenía buenos ingresos económicos y siempre sufría para pagar algunos gastos del hogar, pero decidió que era momento de empezar su negocio propio y ser independiente.  Ahora le está yendo mucho mejor y desea seguir creciendo y convertirse en una prospera empresaria.

Este es el crédito número 6 que tiene con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, pues así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por su parte, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores. Y está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos; papas, aceite en cajas y otros en mayor volumen, para seguir realizando su trabajo. También necesita refaccionar algunas sillas y mesas para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sulejka is 42 years old.  She is a hard-working, entrepreneurial, dynamic lady.  Her partner is 48-year-old Justo and the couple have three children: 15-year-old Iván, 11-year-old Ximena and 1-year-old Saori.  They live together in her in-laws' home.

Sulejka's business is selling fast food such as salchipapas, fried chicken, fried rice, etc.  She makes her sales outside her home.  She starts work very early in the morning, going to the market to find the best ingredients.  Once home again, she starts preparing her delicious dishes which have become very well known in her neighborhood.  She has been in this business for more than two years and she works with the help of her sister.  She considers her business to be profitable because it makes her good income.  Before this, she used to work for other people and had a lot of problems because she didn't make good income and always had difficulty in meeting some of her household expenses. However, she decided that it was the right time to start her own business and become independent.  She is now doing much better and would like to continue growing her business.  She would like to become a prosperous businesswoman.

This is Sulejka's sixth loan from MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support because it makes her feel secure in making progress in her business.  She pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time as she has done with her previous loans.  She is very happy to belong to her community bank because all the members are very friendly and supportive.

Sulejka will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy ingredients for preparing some of her dishes.  She will buy potatoes, oil and other supplies in bulk.  This will allow her to continue in her business.  She also needs to refurbish some tables and chairs in order to provide her customers with a better service.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for making food.  She will also refurbish some tables and chairs

loans.name: Taher

texts.en:
Taher is from Gaza.  He is 30 years old and married, with one child.

Taher has owned a grocery store since the beginning of 2012.  What makes his store special is that it is the only one in the area.

Taher asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy shelves, a refrigerator, and a glass door for the grocery store. After taking the loan, he will be able to increase the goods displayed and increase his income.

His ambition is to own a big supermarket and provide his wife and child with a better life.

loans.use: to buy shelves, a refrigerator, and a glass door for his grocery store.

loans.name: Abed El Wahed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old and married, with three children.

Abed El Wahed has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, snacks, and detergents. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers.  He knows their demands. He has a good reputation and is being well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to buy four refrigerators. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four refrigerators for his store.

loans.name: Tomasa Aquilina

texts.es: Tomasa es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha. Tiene 57 años y es madre de 6 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 15 años. Se dedica a la compra y venta  de tara, cochinilla, y también vende hojas medicinales de coca. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Con su esfuerzo y sus ahorros ella logró construir su vivienda. Las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal le ayudan a  mejorara tanto en el negocio como en su familia. Está feliz porque se siente una mujer exitosa. Tomasa invertirá el préstamo que solicita en la compra de tara y cochinilla.
texts.en: Tomasa is a member of the communal bank Ccatun Sacha. She is 57 years old and is a mother of four children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 15 years. She has a business buying and selling tara plants and cochinilla dye. She also sells medicinal coca leaves. She is grateful to the institution for the ease with which she is able to obtain a loan. Through her efforts and her savings she has been able to build the life that she wants. The training sessions she receives through the communal bank help her to make improvements both in her business and in her family life. She is very happy because she feels that she has been a very successful woman. She will invest the loan proceeds in tara plants and cochinilla dye.

loans.use: to buy tara plants and cochinilla dye.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru:
Мухабат жительница района Кубодиен. Ей 45 лет. Мухабат живет с мужем. Ее муж пенсионер. Сыновья находятся на заработках за рубежом. Сама Мухабат не хочет ждать материальной помощи у детей и намерена сама начать свою деятельность. Ее муж поддерживает ее решение.  
Мухабат взяла в аренду торговую точку на центральном рынке района. Она хочет заняться торговлей детской и подростковой одежды. Мухабат просит кредит для покупки детской одежды (костюмчиков, наборов для новорожденных и детей до школьного возраста) и школьной формы. Так как сейчас большой спрос на школьную одежду, Мухабат намерена закупить одежду для школьников. Она надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Muhabat is a resident of the Qubadiyon district.  She is 45 years old and lives with her husband, who is retired.  Their sons are working abroad.  Muhabat does not want to wait for her children to help her and intends to start her own business.  Her husband supports her decision.
