Muhabat leased a retail outlet at the district's central market.  She wants to get involved in selling children's and adolescent clothing.  Muhabat is requesting this loan to buy children's clothing (suits and sets for newborn and preschool children) and school uniforms.  Because there is a high demand for school clothing now, Muhabat intends to purchase clothing for school children.  She relies on your help.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing and school uniforms

loans.name: Aasia's Group

texts.en:
Aasia has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s fruit selling business.  He gets up early in the morning and starts selling the fruit on his cart by visiting different streets in the city.  Aasia supports him by arranging the fruit on his cart.  With this loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit in order to offer better quality fruit to his clients and increase both his sales and his income.

He has been operating his business for some time now and Aasia is confident that the loan will enable him to be more productive and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fruit for her husband's fruit selling business

loans.name: Nurinisso

texts.ru:
Нуриннисо родилась 1977 году в районе Кубодиен. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сама Нуриниссо занимается торговлей. Она самостоятельная и жизнерадостная женщина. 
Нуриниссо уже шесть месяцев занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется собственная торговая точка, где она продает женскую одежду. Нуриниссо берет кредит для покупки детской одежды. Таким образом Нуриниссо хочет увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Nurinisso was born in 1977 in the Qubadiyon district.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband is working in the Russian Federation, and children attend a secondary school.  Nurinisso is involved in sales.  She is an independent and happy woman.  Nurinisso has been involved in sales at a market for six months.  She owns a retail outlet, where she sells women's clothing.  She is requesting this loan to buy children's clothing.  This is how Nurinisso wants to increase her goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Araz

texts.ru: Araz nachal svoy biznes 4 goda nazad. On prodayet moloko, sir I drugie molochnie produkti v rayone gde on jivet. U Araza stoylo kotoriy on planiruet perestroit tak kak etot uje razvalivaetsa. Segodna on obratilsa za kreditom dla togo chtobi kupit korm dla skota. Eto pomojet uvelicheniu ejednevnogo polucheniya moloka I razvitiu biznesa. Arazu 32 goda, on jenat, u nego dvoe malenkix detey pyati I trex let.
texts.en: Araz started his business four years ago.  He sells milk, cheese and other dairy products in the district where he lives.  Araz has a barn that he plans to rebuild because it is falling apart.  Today, he requested a loan to purchase livestock feed.  This would help him to increase the daily volume of milk and develop his business.  Araz is 32 years old, married and has two small children, who are five and three years old.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Lucia Edna

texts.es: Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y se encuentra en la dulce espera de un nuevo bebé. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 1 año. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Nos comenta que la institución le ofrece facilidades de préstamo por lo cual se encuentra agradecida. Las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal le ayudan a actuar de forma adecuada tanto con sus clientes y en el entorno familiar. Lucia invertirá el nuevo préstamo que solicita en la adquisición de más productos de belleza.
texts.en: Lucia, 35, is a member of the Ccatun Sacha community bank.  She has one child and tells us that she is happily expecting another.  She has been a FINCA Peru client for 1 year.  She operates a business buying and selling cosmetics.  She says that she likes our loan terms and adds that the training that she's received from the community bank have helped her as much at home as they have in her business.  Lucia will use this loan to stock her cosmetics supply business with products that she will resell.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old.  He is married and has three children who attend school.  He runs a cybercafé and has been in this business for four years.  He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This is will be his first loan from KADET LTD.  Peter plans to use the entire loan to purchase a photocopier and two computers. 

He plans to reinvest the anticipated profit into the business.  He also hopes to expand his business and open a computer college in the future.

loans.use: to buy a photococopy machine and two computers

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex tiene 29 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor, además de muy entusiasta para los negocios. Su pareja es Nanci, quien brinda servicios de belleza y es la madre de su hijo Anderson de 2 años. Juntos viven en la casa de sus suegros.

Él se dedica a la venta de madera aserrada. Para ello habilitó un local alquilado donde tiene todas las máquinas de aserrío y corte de madera. Compra la madera en tablones, luego las convierte en tablillas y las vende a buen precio. Lleva dedicándose a esta actividad alrededor de 3 años, con el apoyo de algunos ayudantes a quienes paga por semana trabajada. Ha logrado crecer a base de esfuerzo y dedicación; además le gusta, pues les brinda trabajo a otras personas y se siente muy contento con el apoyo que viene recibiendo de la institución MFP. Por tanto, desea continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer.

Este es su primer préstamo y comenta que se encuentra muy cómodo con este banco comunal, pues no ha tenido ningún problema y considera que son personas puntales y piensa seguir perteneciendo al grupo.
Con el préstamo solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de madera de diversas variedades, en tablones. De esa manera aumentará su stock y podrá seguir sacando tablillas para la venta.
texts.en:
Alex, 29, is a hard-working man and passionate about building his business.  His partner, Nanci, has a beauty salon and the couple has a 2-year old son, Anderson.  They live with Alex's in-laws.

Alex operates a lumber business.  He has a workshop where he keeps the saws that he uses to cut wood into smaller pieces.  He buys sheets of wood and cuts them into strips so that he can get the best price for them.  He has operated the business for 3 years and employs a few workers who he pays by the week.  He has worked hard to build the business and says that he likes being able to provide work to others.  He says, too, that he is grateful for the support that he's received from MFP and wants to carry on the business and grow it.

This is Alex's first loan and he tells us that he is happy with his community bank.  He hasn't had any problems and considers the other members to be reliable.  He adds that he wants to continue with the group.
Alex will use your 1000 new soles loan to buy sheets of different kinds of wood.  The investment will allow him to stock the supplies he needs to carry on the business.

loans.use: to stock his lumber business.

loans.name: Alipio Jr.

texts.en:
Alipio is a 41-year-old married man and the father of two children, from Bohol, Philippines. He has sold snack food in the community for almost ten years now. 

Alipio lacks the capital for his business to grow and become sustainable. He is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy additional ingredients for tempura and fish balls, such as flour, cooking oil, and seasonings.  Some of the loan will be used for the renovation of his house.

Alipio believes that if he is provided support financially, he will be able to improve his business and increase his income. Moreover, he wants to continually send his children to school for better learning. Alipio dreams of nothing but to see his family enjoy the fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for the snacks he sells.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells cooked rice and kenkey (like a sourdough dumpling) near Kwarhinkrom. She has received an education through the primary level.  She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Grace has been selling cooked rice and kenkey for 20 years. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees.  

She will use her loan to buy raw rice in bulk. Grace hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in her business and fund her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy raw rice in bulk.

loans.name: Meyling Angelina

texts.es: Meyling está finalizando su carrera de Contador, está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación y así poder finalizar sus estudios universitarios. Para ella es muy importante obtener su título ya que las ofertas de trabajo tienen como requisito el título universitario. Desea poder conseguir un mejor trabajo con mayor renumeración. Ella está pagando sus estudios con los ingresos que percibe de su empleo.
texts.en: Meyling is in the final year of an Accounting course.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to pay her university fees so she can finish her degree.  She says that she has to finish her degree because any future job that she wants will require that she have one.  She wants a better job so that she can earn more.  She is paying for her studies with the income that she receives from her [current?] job.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Babir

texts.ru: Babiru 45 let, on jivet s jenoy I 3 detmi, 2 iz nix xodat v shkolu, starshiy rebenok pomogaet emu vesti biznes. U nego prodaja jivotnix I molochnix produktov. Babir uje 19 let zanimaetsa skotovodstvom I vpolne preuspel v svoem dele. On xochet uvelichit chislo jivotnix I rasshirit svoy biznes. Babir xochet vzat kredit v 1500 AZN dla pokupki 2 ovec.
texts.en: Babir is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children, two of whom attend a school and the oldest child helps him to run his business.  Babir sells livestock and milk products.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 19 years and is quite successful in his business.  He wants to increase the quantity of his livestock and develop his business.  Babir wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to buy two sheep.

loans.use: to buy two sheep

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the mother of two sons and a daughter. All three of them are enrolled in school and getting their education.

She knows sewing and works for her neighborhood clients to financially support her husband, who is an embroidery expert.
She is very creative in her work and receives regular orders every month.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who will buy beads, thread, and embroidery frames in larger quantity and of better quality. This will help him prepare better-looking clothes and increase his orders and income.

Nasreen is very much hopeful about the business success of her husband after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials and frames.

loans.name: Nena

texts.es:
Nena tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy valiente y emprendedora. Tiene seis hijos, a quienes cuida y da educación hasta que ellos puedan ser independientes. Vive en su casa propia, a lado de su esposo Emilio, de 56 años, quien es docente y es quien le brinda las fuerzas para seguir  trabajando para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, de toda variedad, para damas, caballeros y niños. Su mercadería la compra en el centro comercial de su ciudad por fardos y la lleva a vender por las rivera del río en los caseríos y zonas alejadas. Se inició con esta actividad por la idea e iniciativa de su esposo, quien es profesor en un caserío. Aunque su trabajo le resulta un poco pesado, por los viajes que realiza, y porque tiene que cargar su mercadería ella sola, sabe que debe esforzarse al máximo. A pesar que vende mucho, a ella le gustaría tener mayores ganancias y vender en mayor volumen. Por eso, desea seguir trabajando y hacer crecer su negocio.

Este es el crédito número 12 que tiene con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por su parte, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con sus cuotas de pago como en sus créditos anteriores. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de ropa usadas en fardos, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Nena, 57, is a brave, hardworking woman. She has six children and will care for and educate them until they can go off on their own. She lives in her own house with her husband Emilio, 56, who is a teacher. It is Emilio who gives her the strength to keep working toward a better life.

She sells secondhand clothing of all sorts, for women, men, and children. She buys her merchandise by the bale in the market in her city and sells it in the villages and other farflung areas. Her husband, who teaches in one of the villages, inspired her to start the business. Because she has to travel a lot and transport the merchandise by herself, the work can be difficult. She has to give it all her effort. Although she already sells a lot, she would like to increase her income and have a greater volume of sales. That's why she wants to keep working and expand her business.

This will be her twelfth loan with MFP, and she is hoping to be able to pursuing her goals. She is committed once again to making her payments on time, as she did for previous loans. She is also happy to be part of a village bank because all the other members are very friendly, supportive people.

She will use the amount requested—1000 soles—to buy more bundles of secondhand clothing, looking for low prices for her bulk purchases.

loans.use: to buy bales of secondhand clothing for her business.

loans.name: Luis Benito

texts.es: En la ciudad de Quevedo vive Luis, tiene 35 años y es panificador. Esta felizmente unido y su esposa es quien le ayuda en el negocio, tienen 2 hijos quienes estudian en el colegio fiscal. Hace varios años abrió una panadería en la parte frontal de su domicilio donde tiene una vitrina para mostrar sus productos y en la parte trasera el horno. Su labor empieza desde las 3 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche que cierra, abriendo todos los días, la labor la realiza solo ya que se necesita de fuerza física para el proceso del amasado al momento de meter al horno su esposa le ayuda. Aprendió la panificación por la enseñanza de uno de sus familiares, como le gusto el negocio decidió abrir su local propio. Luis no ha tenido mayores inconvenientes, ni con la delincuencia ni con el ministerio de Salud ente regulador que brinda los permisos de funcionamiento al tratarse de consumo alimenticio. Con el crédito Luis comprar manteca, harina, huevos, una mesa y otra vitrina. Espera con el tiempo poder ganar dinero para realizarle arreglos a su casa.
texts.en:
Luis is a baker who is 35 years old and lives in the city of Quevedo. He loves his wife very much, and she helps him at their bakery business. They have two children who are in school. Several years ago, they opened a bakery in the front portion of their house, where they have a display case and window to show and sell products. At the back of the house is the oven. Luis begins work at 3:00 in the morning to prepare and bake his products, and he does not close the bakery until 11:00 at night. His bakery is open every day of the week, and he works very hard by himself to knead and make all the dough necessary for his baked goods. When the items are ready to go in the oven, his wife helps him. He learned this craft from one of his family members, and since he liked their business, he decided to open a business of his own.

Luis has not had major setbacks, not even from crime and vandalism, or from the Ministry of Health, whose permission is necessary to obtain operating permits. With the support from this loan, Luis plans to purchase butter, flour, eggs, a table and another cabinet for his bakery. He hopes, in time, to be able to save up money to repair his home.

loans.use: to purchase butter, flour, eggs, a table and another cabinet for his bakery.

loans.name: Orostakhon

texts.ru: Оростахон молодая женщина, она вдова и мать двоих детей.Работает  в аэропорту финансистом.У неё взрослая дочь и сын которые учатся в России.К сожалению её муж умер недавно и она воспитывает детей  со своей матерью.Они вместе живут.Оростхон хотя немного затрудняется в содержании семьи и обучении детей за пределами города,она смело смотрит в будущее, что скоро дети поддержат её после окончания вуза.Так как её бытовые условия немного ухудшились, она хочет отремонтировать квартиру и поэтому обратилась к нам за финансовой помощью.Заранее благодарит нас за поддержку.
texts.en: Orostakhon is a young woman.  She is a widow and a mother of two children.  She works as a financial analyst at the airport.  Orostakhon has a grown daughter and son, both of whom are studying in Russia.  Unfortunately, her husband recently passed away, and she is raising the children together with her mother.  All of them live together.  Although, it is a bit hard for Orostakhon to support her family and educate her children outside the city limits, she looks bravely toward the future, knowing that her children will soon support her after finishing their education.  Because her household conditions slightly worsened, Orostakhon wants to make repairs to her apartment, and this is why she requested financial help from us.  She thanks us for the support in advance.

loans.use: to make repairs to her apartment

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.ru: Тошпулот мужчина в возрасте 50 лет, женат имеет восьмерых детей.Сам занимается дехканским хозяйством по посеву арахиса.Кроме этой работы он так же откармливает скот. Он имеет доход от купли и продажи скота. В основном он покупает крупно рогатый скот. Тошпулот сотрудничает с нашей  организацией уже девятый год, и за весь период сотрудничества он увеличил численность скота в несколько раз.На полученный кредит Тошпулот хочет купить скот и корм для скота. Он выражает огромную благодарность нашей организации за поддержку и финансирование.
texts.en: Toshpulot is a 50 year-old man, married and has eight children.  He is involved in a dekhan business, sowing peanuts.  Besides this work, he also fattens up livestock.  He has an income from buying and selling livestock.  He primarily buys cattle.  Toshpulot has been partnering with our organization for the ninth year now and increased his livestock quantities several fold during this period.  Toshpulot wants to use this loan to buy livestock and livestock feed.  He expresses a sincere gratitude to our organization for the support and financing.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Gulsunjon

texts.en:
Gulsunjon is a woman with a wonderful nature. She wants to live in a wonderful house but her house is in a bad condition. She works hard to repair her house but her income from animal husbandry is small. She is one of the best businesswomen - she has worked for more than 15 years and has enough experience. She has a very friendly family and her husband helps her with the business. They have a child and want to comfort him with all the modern conveniences. 

Gulsunjon is asking for a loan to buy building materials to repair her house. She waits for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 36 years old. She lives in a small village of Dusheti District with her parents, who are pensioners. Khatuna is busy with an agricultural business. She has 2 milking cows and produces dairy food: cheese, curd, and yogurt. Part of the dairy food is used by the family members and the rest is sold on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Khatuna requested a loan for purchasing an additional milking cow. She wants to expand her agricultural activity in order to make it more profitable. With three milking cows, she will be able to produce more dairy food. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, Khatuna will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business. As a result of the above-mentioned activity, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Nerith

texts.es:
Nerith tiene 53 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jeremías, de 54 años, y su hija Anais de 19 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Tuvo en total siente hijos, pero los otros ya son mayores e independientes.

Su trabajo es la venta de flores naturales y artificiales en un pequeño puesto en el cementerio general de su localidad. Adicionalmente, vende refrescos helados en su vivienda, de lo que se encarga su hija. Se inicio en el negocio de las flores hace más de 8 años y le gusta mucho porque disfruta de conversar con las otras vendedoras. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad  tenía problemas económicos, ahora  le está yendo muy bien, aunque todavía no se siente realizada. Desea implementar una tienda a la venta de flores, ya que siente que es momento de empezar a crecer y tener un local propio.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto cuenta con este apoyo financiero para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida, como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo.  
Con los 2000 soles solicitados comprará más flores artificiales, comprará seis cajas, valorizadas en 200 nuevos soles cada una. También invertirá en el negocio de refrescos, con la compra de los insumos que usa para la preparación.
texts.en: Nerith is 53 years old and is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Jeremías, who is 54, and their daughter Anais, who is 19. They hope to be able to provide their daughter with a better quality of life. They have six other adult children who are now living independently. She makes her living selling real and artificial flowers from her small stand in her local cemetery. Additionally, she sells frozen drinks from her home, which her daughter is in charge of. She started the flower business more than eight years ago, and she likes it very much because she enjoys talking to the other vendors. Before starting this activity she had financial problems. Now things are going very well, although she feels there is still more she wants to achieve. She wants to open her own floral shop, and she feels that now is the time to go into business for herself. This is her third loan from MFP. She is counting on this support to be able to continue toward her goals. She promises to repay her loans fully and punctually, as she has with her past loans. With the 2000 soles she is seeking, she will buy six boxes of artificial flowers, which cost 200 soles each. She will also invest in her business selling frozen drinks, purchasing the ingredients she needs in order to make them.

loans.use: to buy six boxes of artificial flowers, and also to invest in her other business selling frozen drinks.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 22 years old and is from Gaza. He has a food stall for selling different kinds of fruits and vegetables. He's had this business for 2 years.

Mahmoud asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile and an electrical scale. He hopes that his sales will increase and his transportation budget will decrease after buying the automobile and the scale, which will help buy more goods and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile and an electrical scale.

loans.name: Khouth

texts.en:
Khouth is 47 years old and married with a single child who attends a local school. Khouth is an industrious farmer who pays full attention to agricultural businesses including rice husbandry and hog-raising. In addition, she uses her spare time at home to manage a small store selling sweets and packaged biscuits and spices, from which she can pay for her daily food. Uplifting her family out of poverty and educating her child to the college level are her priorities.

To improve her business activities, Khouth would like to take out a loan of KHR 4,000,000 from Kiva lenders. She will divide this loan into three portions, which will be used for each business. She will invest in her rice business, install more piglets for fattening, and purchase merchandise to increase her store such as spices, cooking ingredients, cigarettes, shampoos, and other home use products. She has a strong belief in developing her current businesses. Her patience and hard work will lead her to success in the future.

loans.use: to invest in her rice business, to install more piglets for fattening, and to purchase merchandise to increase her store such as spices, cooking ingredients, cigarettes, shampoos, and other home use products.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with one child and her child doesn’t go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water.

Sarah has a business selling used clothes and sells to all categories of people but on retail. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings to buy more bales of used clothes. She moves door to door selling used clothes and has been in the clothing business for 4 years. She works 6 days a week and sells on a retail basis only. 

Sarah's major business challenges include debtors and seasonality. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. She hopes to see her business increase so that she can get a permanent business premise and also build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Mame Loty

texts.fr: Madame Mame Loty est une femme mariée qui vit sur le territoire sénégalais. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle pratique la vente de légumes qui lui génère des bénéfices grâce  auxquels elle  gère ses besoins quotidiens. Elle est en possession  d’une maison où elle a entamé des constructions. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500000frs dans le guichet de l’U-IMCEC ou elle est membre. Elle  a déjà remboursé 6 prêts  antérieurs. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer le cadre de vi de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Madame Mame Loty is married, and lives in Senegal. She has been a retailer for 15 years. She sells vegetables, generating profits that she uses for her everyday expenses. 

Madame Loty owns a house and has begun making some improvements. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs from the U-IMCEC branch where she is a member. She has already repaid six previous loans. This new loan will allow her to improve her children's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe. Tiene 40 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 5 años. Se dedica a la venta de cereales molidos. Ella dice que en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y eso es lo que más le gusta, las capacitaciones que recibe son muy buenas ya que contienen temas que ayudan a uno para así poder mejorar en el negocio y en la vida familiar. Su meta es lograr terminar con el acabado de construcción de su vivienda. Marina invertirá el préstamo que solicita en la compra de cereales al por mayor y también para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Marina is a member of the Guadalupe Comunal Bank. She is 40 years old and the mother of three. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for the past 5 years. She makes a living selling ground cereals. She said that she has learned from her communal bank how to save money, and that is the thing she likes most about the bank. The trainings that she receives are very good because they cover topics to help one improve their business as well as their family life. Her goal is to finish building her home. Marina will invest the loan that she has requested in purchasing cereals at wholesale and also for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals at wholesale

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is 36 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in the Kaspi District with her family: husband George and their three children who are 6, 10, and 12 years old. All three children study in the village school. Elene and George are busy with their agricultural business. They have four milking cows, three calves, and a pig. They produce cheese and curds and sell them in Tbilisi (the Capital of Georgia). They sell calves and piglets as well in nearby villages. 

Elene has requested a loan to purchase food for the cattle; Elene and George will use this food to feed their cattle during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now, but the price increases by 30-40% during the fall months. This will allow Elene to save significantly on the cost of feeding the cows. Since the cows will be fed properly through the winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family. The calves will also be fed properly and the grown calves will be able to be sold for a good price. This will increase the family's income. With the increased income, they will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business in order to expand it and make more profitable. As a result, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Aboud

texts.en:
Aboud is from Iraq. He is 46 years old and married, with seven children.

Aboud is the owner of a barber shop since 2011. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers, so he knows their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

Aboud has applied for $1200 loan to install an external ceiling and shutters in his shop. He also wants to make an advertising light box. He is aiming to develop his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and shutters.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer. Tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de locería (vasos, platos, azafates) en zonas rurales de la ciudad. Maribel está agradecida con la institución por todas las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece, dice que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal son muy buenas, de lo que mas se siente orgullosa es que aprendió a ahorrar. Su meta es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de locerías al por mayor como platos, tazas, vasos, azafates, etc.
texts.en: Maribel is a member of the 'Florecer' community bank.  She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years.  Her business is selling home products such as cups, dishes and trays in rural areas of the city.  Maribel is grateful to the institution for all the loan facilities that they offer.  She says that the training she receives as a member of her community bank is very good.  The thing she feels most proud of is the fact that she has learned how to save.  Her goal is to provide her children with a good education.  She will invest the loan that she has requested in buying home products wholesale such as dishes, cups, glasses, trays, etc.

loans.use: to buy home products such as dishes, cups, glasses, trays, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives with his two working siblings. He supports his two brothers as they all seek to live a proper life. They are responsible for managing the family expenses and taking care of their only parent. 

Mohammad started his own independent business in 2011. He works as a taxi driver, transporting clients from town to town upon request. He looks forward to gaining more clients. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his car and repair its wheels as well. This loan will allow him to boost his work, serve a wider range of people, and--most importantly--increase his earnings. Mohammad is a young and hard-working man, and this will help him achieve his goals in a short time period.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his car and repair its wheels as well.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 59 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida. Su pareja es Luis, quien es mecánico de motos, y con quien tiene cinco hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Actualmente, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja, dos de sus hijas y la pareja de una de ellas. 

Su trabajo es la costura, realiza diseño de ropa y costura a pedidos, su trabajo es muy solicitado en su barrio, ya que es la única que realiza esta actividad. Ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, ahora tiene su propio taller, empezó con una máquina de coser hace más de 44 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Aún recuerda que cuando se inició tenía muchas dudas y dificultades, pero a base de esfuerzo y mucho trabajo pudo superarlo. Adicionalmente, se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones y locales comerciales.

Este es el crédito número 17 que tiene con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Además está muy comprometida en pagar, una vez más, las cuotas a tiempo y de manera responsable. Se siente muy cómoda en su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales (telas, hilos, botones, cierres, elásticos y otros) para seguir con su trabajo de costura. También adquirirá algunos materiales de construcción para arreglar los cuartos que pone en alquiler.
texts.en:
Esther is 59 years old.  She is a woman who has always worked hard to do well in life.  Her partner is Luis, a motor mechanic.  The couple have five children who are already grown up and live independently.  Esther currently lives in her own home together with her partner, two of her daughters and one of their partners.

Esther works as a dressmaker.  She designs clothing and sews to order.  Her work is very much in demand in her neighborhood as she is the only person who does this work.  She learned the business from her mother at a very young age and also studied at a vocational center.  She now has her own workshop.  Esther started out with one sewing machine more than 44 years ago and has been working alone up to now.  She still recalls that when she started out she had a lot of doubts and difficulties but, thanks to her efforts and hard work, she was able to make progress.  In addition, she also rents out rooms and commercial premises.

This is Esther's 17th loan from MFP and she hopes to continue achieving her goals.  She pledges, once again, to make her repayments responsibly and on time.  She feels very comfortable within her community bank as her fellow group members are very responsible and supportive.

Esther will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy materials (fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners, elastic, etc.) so that she can continue in her dressmaking business.  She will also buy some construction supplies so that she can fix up some rooms that she rents out.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and to fix up some rooms that she rents out

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en: This is Fawzi, a 53-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children, who are still attending school. Unlike other women in her place, Fawzi’s wife cooperates with him to enhance their family’s financial situation. She strives to work really hard and doesn’t hesitate to offer help whenever needed.  As for Fawzi, he has owned a grocery store in his town since 2007. He has clients from all over the neighboring villages who pass by his shop to purchase their needs of food and provisions. Fawzi is very welcoming and friendly, which has contributed to his success at work. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy supplementary products for his business. He’s sure that with the diversification of products, his sales will increase by minimum of 20%. This is how Fawzi works to better develop his business.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products for his business.

loans.name: Gloria Amanda

texts.es: Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe. Tiene 34 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 1 año. Se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de tubérculos, y también vende quesos. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece, ella dice que las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal son muy buenas ya que contienen mensajes de superación y valoración para las personas. Su sueño es tener un carro para que pueda movilizarse junto a su familia y que también le ayude en su negocio. Gloria invertirá el nuevo préstamo que solicita en la compra de abono para la siembra de tubérculos.
texts.en: Gloria is a member of the Guadalupe communal bank. She is 34 years old and is the mother of three. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year. She makes a living planting and harvesting tubers, and she also sells cheese. She is thankful to the communal bank for the money lending services they offer. She says that the trainings that she receives from her communal bank are very good, with messages of how to overcome struggles and personal value. Her dream is to have a car so that she has transportation for her family and it would also be a help to her business. Gloria will invest the loan she has requested in buying fertilizer to plant tubers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to plant tubers.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel de veinte y seis  años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. Él es una persona luchadora, desde hace 10 años se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas junto a sus padres. Poco tiempo después Israel, emigro a la ciudad a trabajar como empleado en una tienda, fue ahí donde se acompaño con su esposa. 

Israel solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar arena, cemento, hierro, pago de mano de obra, para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda proyecto que desea concretizar junto con su esposa. Esto lo hace con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, pues expresa que tendrán un hogar más cómodo para sus pequeñas hijas. Su deseo es proporcionarles el estudio a sus hijas e instalar un pequeño negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta básica como: fríjol, arroz, entre otros.
texts.en:
Israel is twenty six years old and lives together with his life partner and their two children.  He is a hard-working person who has been working in agriculture together with his parents for ten years.  Israel recently emigrated to the city to work as an employee in a store.  This is where he met his wife. 

Israel is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy sand, cement and iron.  He will also pay labor costs so that he can have some improvements made to his home.  He would like to carry out this work together with his wife so that they can improve the family's quality of life.  He says that this will give him a more comfortable home for his young daughters.  Israel's wish is to provide his daughters with an education and to set up a small business selling basic household products such as beans, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and iron, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en:
Marifat is a successful business woman. She is kind-hearted and good-natured.  For more than four years, she has owned a business selling women's clothing.  At first she sold children's clothes, but then she changed her business because this kind of business gives her more income. She has a growing business.  She knows all aspects of her dealings very well. 

Her husband is an engineer, and he can’t help Marifat with her business. They have four children and love them very much. 

She wants to expand her business, but doesn't have money for it. She is asking for a loan to buy goods to increase her inventory. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes to give her a wider assortment to sell.

loans.name: Kaed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old and married. with three children.

Kaed has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, snacks, detergents, and other products. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers.  He knows their demands. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3,000 loan in order to buy two refrigerators and a generator. He also wants to install an external ceiling for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family wtth better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators and a generator.

loans.name: Patricia Zulma

texts.es:
Patricia es una joven muy trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, conocida porque se desarrolla la agricultura en especial se cultiva maíz, frejol, entre otros, podemos encontrar también haciendas antiguas y playas hermosas. Patricia es muy responsable y sobre todo una muchacha con muchas ganas de salir adelante , ella se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería ambiental ya se encuentra en el último ciclo de su carrera y ha podido estudiar debido a que a la vez trabaja en la municipalidad de su ciudad en el área de saneamiento ambiental, anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo celulares pero gracias a ese optimismo y ganas de salir adelante logro obtener ese empleo; a la vez Patricia apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar y con ello aliviar a sus padres con los gastos. Ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo y en sus estudios porque estudia y trabaja con gusto y responsabilidad y sobre todo porque quiere que sus padres se sientan orgullosos de ella.

Patricia agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para sus estudios como maquetas, libros, entre otros y también realizar los pagos de cuotas de su universidad, de esta manera podrá tener los implementos para poder seguir estudiando y así seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Ser una gran profesional y apoyar a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Patricia is a very hard-working and optimistic young woman who lives in the city of Imperial.  This city is known for its agriculture, particularly its corn, beans, etc.  Here one can find old haciendas and beautiful beaches.  Patricia is a very responsible girl who has a great desire to do well in life.  She is currently studying for a degree in environmental science.  She is in her final year and has been able to study thanks to the fact that she also works in the city hall as an environmental sanitation engineer.  She used to work selling cell phones but, thanks to her optimism and desire to get ahead in life, she managed to land her current job.  Patricia supports her parents with their household expenses and thereby lightens their burden.  She believes that she is doing well in her job and her studies because she enjoys working and studying and does so responsibly.  Above all else, she wants her parents to feel proud of her. 

Patricia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy materials for her studies such as models, books, etc.  She will also pay her university fees.  This will allow her to have available all the tools she needs to continue studying, working and fighting to make her greatest dream come true: to be a successful professional and support her parents.

loans.use: to buy study materials (books and models), and to pay her monthly university fees

loans.name: Branco Daniel

texts.es:
Branco es un joven de 18 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de su corta edad él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene grandes aspiraciones y muchos deseos de apoyar a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus hermanos y amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, día a día Branco trabaja como vendedor en una empresa distribuidora de golosinas de su ciudad, él trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que sus jefes lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Branco se encuentra my agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una habitación en la parte trasera de la casa de sus padres, de esta manera Branco podrá contar con una habitación que pueda usar para él, ya que al ser varios hermanos siempre han compartido el mismo dormitorio, así el desea poder brindar un poco mas de seguridad, bienestar y comodidad para su familia y poco a poco en un futuro no muy lejano Brando espera terminar la construcción total de la vivienda de sus padres.
texts.en:
Branco is an 18-year-old man.  He is single and lives together with his parents and siblings in the city of Chincha.  In spite of his young age, he is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has great aspirations and a great desire to support his family.  Unfortunately, owing to his need to work and support his parents with the household expenses, Branco was not able to study for a degree.  However, he still dreams of studying for a degree in industrial engineering.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his brothers and friends and he sometimes cooks a delicious 'carapulcra con sopa seca' to share with his family.

With a lot of commitment and enthusiasm, and thanks to his parents' support, Branco works daily as a salesman in a candy company in his city.  He works approximately ten hours a day and feels happy in his work as his bosses value him because of his good work and friendly treatment of others.

Branco is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to build a room out the back of his parents' home.  This will give him a bedroom of his own.  Because he has a number of siblings, in the past they have always shared the same bedroom.  He would like to provide his family with a little more security, well-being and comfort and in the not-so-distant future he hopes to completely finish building work on his parents' home.

loans.use: to build a room in his parents' home

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Grace, a  mother of two, is married to a farmer. For the past four years she has operated a provisions kiosk near Kwarhinkrom, using her income to pay her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions including milk, Milo, bread, and soft drinks. Grace hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions like milk, Milo, bread, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 50 years old. He lives in a small village in Mtskheta District with his mother, Nutsa. Nutsa is a pensioner and Gocha is a truck driver. He offers transportation services to local farmers and gets a service fee for the work. He also owns a plot of agricultural land where he grows various vegetables. 

Gocha requested a loan for repairing his truck. It is damaged and is already risky to drive, so Gocha has stopped operations. After repairing the truck, he will be able to offer transportation services to local farmers. He also plans to sow lucerne (a type of legume) on his plot. After properly doing this seasonal agricultural work, he hopes to get good harvest. He will sell the harvested lucerne to local farmers. This will increase his family's income. With the increased income, Gocha will be able to create better living conditions for himself and his mother.

loans.use: to sow lucerne (a type of legume) and to repair his truck.

loans.name: Nimo

texts.en: Nimo, a mother of five who is married to a farmer, has been selling banku and waakye near Kwarhinkrom for the past 20 years. Banku is cooked and fermented maize or cassava dough, and waakye consists of rice and beans mixed together. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees, and her loan will help her to buy more maize and rice. Nimo hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba, who is married to  a sanitary worker and has three children, has been selling salted and smoked fish near Kwarhinkrom for five years. She uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Her loan will help her to purchase more fish in bulk. Aba hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish in bulk.

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en:
Dorjpalam, 37, is one of the skilful drivers in Mongolia. Now he works as a chief driver for a construction company. He lives with his wife and his two children on his own small plot of land in the ger district (a ger is traditional Mongolian traditional dwelling) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Dorjpalam's family owns a small old house and it has not had any repairs or renovation in last several years. It was built in the early 1990’s with uninsulated brick walls. In winter, his house becomes very cold and his children always get sick due to the cold. Because his house has a heat-loss problem, it costs him a lot to buy coal fuel every winter. In Mongolia winter is severe and freezing cold. Most of the households in the ger districts use coal and other kind of toxic fuels such as used tires, shoes, etc. As you know it is extremely harmful to peoples' health, the environment, and the air around the cities. As a result, Dorjpalam decided to put insulation in the walls of his house before this coming winter. Recently, the Mongolian government and many other people, institutions, and enterprises have been caring and starting some projects to decrease air pollution in the cities. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy bricks and foam to put insulation in the walls of his house. In addition, his co-workers and friends will support him in this project.

loans.use: To buy bricks and foam to put insulation in the walls of his house.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas, a borrower from Iraq, is a 28-year-old youth client who is married and has one child. He has owned a small grocery shop since 2011, and having acquired sufficient experience in this field, has a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Abbas is requesting this $2000 loan to install shelves in his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install shelves in his shop.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a housewife and remains at her home to carry out her household responsibilities. She has a 26-year-old daughter who helps her in her daily tasks. Her husband has a business of selling spare parts. He also provides spare parts repair services to his clients. He has great technical skills and knows his industry very well.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy spare parts and tools in larger quantity that will allow him to improve his sales and income. Nasreen has a lot of confidence in her husband that he will successfully be able to improve his business after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is 42 and has four children. She is unmarried. She sells maize and salted fish near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for six years. Adjoa uses her income to feed and clothe her children, as well as to pay their school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more maize and salted fish. With the new profits, Adjoa plans to continue to expand her business and fund her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and salted fish

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, a 46-year-old Lebanese woman, is married and living with her husband, who owns a satellite shop, and four children, three of whom are still studying while the youngest has started to work.

An ambitious and above all hardworking woman, Fatmeh has for many years been working as a very talented tailor who is well-known in her town. She works from home to meet her clients' demands in a short period of time. With her requested loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l., she will purchase required supplies such as textiles, needles, strings, etc.

Fatmeh hopes to open her own tailoring factory as soon as she can in order to enhance her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as textiles, needles, strings. etc.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 48 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in Mtskheta District with her family: her husband, Emzar, and their three children (14, 19 and 21 years old). The youngest child studies in the village school, the second is a student, and the oldest helps his parents in the family agricultural business. Inga and Emzar have two milking cows and produce cheese. They also own a plot of land where they grow green plants. They sell them to the local population for plantation of greenery in their yards. Inga and Emzar own a mini tractor as well. Emzar provides seasonal agricultural services to local farmers and gets service fees for his work.

Inga requested a loan to repair their second tractor. She will rent out the tractor to local farmers and will get additional income. With increased income, Inga and Emzar will be able to create better living conditions for their three children.

loans.use: to repair her tractor

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her young brother and sister. She has a business of selling used clothes and she sells to all categories of people both at retail and wholesale prices. She has been in this clothing business for three years and works seven days a week at the market. 

Agnes has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she becomes a wholesaler and also to build her own house and educate her children up to the university level. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia esta casada y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en casa de sus familiares ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Tunari en la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de ocho horas tejiendo mantas, también cuenta con una librería como segundo ingreso  y con lo que gana no le alcanza, es por eso que solícita el crédito para aumentar y variar su mercadería en la librería ya que la elaboración de mantas es muy sacrificado y moroso, ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El sueño de Lidia es mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lidia is married and has one child who is of school age. She lives with her family members in a one room house located in the Villa Tunari zone of the city of El Alto. 

She currently makes an income as she works more than eight hours a day weaving blankets. She also has a bookstore as a second source of income. Her income is not enough, which is why she is requesting a loan to increase and vary the merchandise in her bookstore. Weaving blankets is very hard and creates debt for her because it does not cover food costs, education, and the payment of basic services for her family. 

Lidia's dream is to improve her income to be able to become independent and improve her quality of life. 

This is the second loan she has requested from IMPRO and the first loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to increase the merchandise in her bookstore.

loans.name: Alogojesuton 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ALOGOJESUTON 1 est composé de vingt neuf personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Adénikè Florence est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Adénikè Florence a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Adénikè Florence est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Désiré. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adénikè Florence et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Adénikè Florence vend depuis quatre ans, des tissus par le système de distribution. Adénikè Florence s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Adénikè Florence et les autres membres du groupement ALOGOJESUTON 1 sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group ALOGOJESUTON 1 comprises 29 persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Adénikè Florence, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. With the goal of boosting their business, so as to cope better with the demands of their customers, the group members are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time. 

Adénikè Florence dropped out of secondary school. She is 37 years old and married to a retailer named Désiré. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Adénikè Florence and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. To help with the diverse needs of the family, she has been selling fabrics via the distribution system for four years at a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering their business and further satisfying their customers, Adénikè Florence and the other member of the group ALOGOJESUTON 1 are requesting an initial loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase their level of business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a single lady with no children, but she takes care of two of her sister's children. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her sister's children and rent. Janepher has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for six years. 

Janepher has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She goes door to door selling used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is hoping to get enough profits to build her own house and also to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Alogojesuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ALOGOJESUTON est composé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant de ce groupement, du nom de Germain est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Germain est âgé de 61 ans et est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Catharine. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Germain vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Germain n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la pêche, activité qu’il exerce depuis une quinzaine d’années et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. De façon secondaire, Germain vend des poissons et des filets dans un marché de sa région. Germain s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Germain sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement ALOGOJESUTON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group ALOGOJESUTON comprises thirteen persons who reside in the same district. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Germain, is the one in the photo with his hand raised. He is 61 years old and married to a retailer named Catharine. The couple have three children, not all in school but in their care. Germain lives together with his children and wife. The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple. 

Germain did not go to school but learned how to fish. This is a business he has been working at for about fifteen years, and it brings in significant revenues. On the side, Germain sells fish and some nets at a market in his region. He gets his supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and revenues, Germain is requesting, along with the other members of the group ALOGOJESUTON, a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy cord to make fishing nets

loans.name: Jeanne Modoukpè's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe constitué de deux membres en caution solidaire. Jeanne, la responsable est âgée de 31 ans. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle vend les condiments depuis quelques années. Elle fait ses achats dans les marchés de la place et ses clients sont composés des habitants du quartier et de ses environs. Dans le souci d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et de répondre favorablement de la demande de ses clients, Jeanne a fait recours au micro crédit de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et  d'offrir des services médicaux adéquats à ses enfants. Jeanne se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This would be a group composed of two members who guarantee one another in solidarity. The official is 31 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has been selling condiments for a few years. She makes her purchases at a local market, and her customers are made up of residents in and around the neighborhood. 

Concerned about increasing her sales and responding favorably to the demands of her customers, Jeanne has turned toward Finadev micro-loans. This loan will enable her to grow her extra revenues and to provide adequate medical care for her children. Jeanne is found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy condiments (2 baskets of tomatoes, 2 baskets of chili peppers, 4 baskets of okra, 10 measures of salts) and 4 baskets of vegetables

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 38-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. Her husband is the one taking care of his family and covering his children’s education costs. Abir has a big and important role in maintaining and supporting her husband in every single small detail concerning their family. Abir opened an internet shop in her town in 2005. People also meet at her place to enjoy their time with friends, play internet games and take a coffee. Today, she’s in need of a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy more computers in order to enlarge her shop. In that way, she will be able to receive more clients and surely earn higher revenues.  In the near future, she’s planning to open a snack shop near her internet shop.

loans.use: to buy more computers

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is married and has four children. She sells sandals, shoes, and bags near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for four years. She uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more goods to resell. With the new profits, Comfort plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

Ahmad has owned a food market since 2011. He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, dairy products, detergents and other products. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers. He knows about their demands. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Ahmad is requesting an $1800 loan in order to buy a generator and install an external ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and install an external ceiling for the shop

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is single and has two children. She has received schooling through middle school. Cecilia sells cloth, bags, and sandals near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for 10 years. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children as well as pay their school fees and the accommodation and utility bills. Cecilia will use the loan to purchase more cloth, bags, and sandals. With the new profits, Cecilia plans to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth, bags, and sandals.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
Muslima is very cute, glorious and plodding. She is a very beautiful and wonderful woman.

Muslima is a woman who works hard every day to improve her living conditions. For more than three years, she has had her own business. She sells children's clothes and shoes. Muslima knows all aspects of her deal very well. She has four children and a lovely husband. She must work hard to enter her children in good schools.  She is asking for a loan to buy goods for developing her business. She waits for your help and support.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Rosa Delmira

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus 2 pequeños hijos, cuyas edades son de 3 y 7 años, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde varios años decidió separarse de su pareja, desde entonces ella es padre y madre para sus pequeños; ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante junto con sus pequeños, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Enfermería; en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear juntos con sus hijos por las acogedoras calles de la ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias a su deseo por salir adelante, desde hace un año Rosa puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 45 clientes, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la recomiendan por sus productos, precios y buena atención.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, menestras, golosinas, entre otros; de esta manera Rosa tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder utilizar para terminar construcción total de su vivienda y con ello asegurar el futuro y bienestar de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 36 year old woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her two young children. aged  3 and 7. Unfortunately, for different reasons, she decided to separate from her spouse. Since then, she is both father and mother to the children. She is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic woman who puts all of her effort into getting her children ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of  financial resources, and because she needed to pay her expenses, she was unable to go to college, but she would have liked to study nursing. In her free time, she likes to go with her children to the prettier streets of the city. 

On her own intiative, and thanks to her wish to get ahead, a year ago, Rosa opened her own business selling groceries. She works at her business about 12 hours a day and serves an average of 45 customers a day.  She likes her job and belives it is going well, since her customers recommend her because of her products, prices and good service. 

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, oil, milk, vegetable stews, snacks and more. This way, Rosa will keep her business better stocked and will be able to increase her sales and financial income. In the not so distant future, she will be able to use that income to completely build her house and ensure the future and wellbeing of her little ones.

loans.use: to buy merchandise or her business, such as rice, sugar, milk, vegetable stews, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has one child.

Amer has owned a video games and play area since 2004. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good understanding of local customers, and knows what they like. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy three play stations and an air-conditioner and to install shutters. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy play stations and an air-conditioner and to install shutters

loans.name: Abed Alnasser

texts.en:
Abed Alnasser is a 37-year-old married man who lives in one of the villages of Ramallah.
He lives with his wife and four children, three of whom are in school. He has owned a grocery store for a year and a half and he works in it along with his wife. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy shelves, goods, and a display refregirator for his grocery store.
Abed Alnasser hopes that after taking this loan he will be able to increase the goods displayed in the store and thus increase his income to provide a better life and education for his family and children.

loans.use: to buy shelves, goods, and a display refregirator for his grocery store

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25-year-old man. He’s single and lives in Lebanon with his parents and two siblings. Despite his young age, Mohammad is obliged to work continually as he is responsible for helping his father cover the family expenses. His youngest sibling is also working in order to supplement the family's income. Mohammad owns a restaurant where he provides his customers with delicious food such as “Foul”, one of the Lebanese traditional dishes that have been passed down from generation to generation. Regardless of being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation. That’s the reason why he’s asking today for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing additional food provisions. In the near future, Mohammad requires hiring new employees in order to help him achieve the work tasks.

loans.use: to purchase additional food provisions

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and one sibling. His father is the one responsible for covering their costs and expenses. As for Wassim, he started his own business in order to take some responsibilities from his father. He has been repairing computers since 2008 from his home. He also visits his customers at their places, if needed. In parallel, he has been working at a local hotel since 2009. Today, he intends to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a scanner for his business in addition to some related supplies. This Kiva loan will certainly develop his work and enrich his way of living. In the future, he plans to open his own computer shop.

loans.use: to purchase a scanner and related supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 60 years old and single. She keeps poultry and has been in this business for two years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 shillings.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to purchase more stock of chicks to rear and chicken feed. She plans to plow the anticipated profit back into her business. 

Her hopes are to expand the business and have a happy home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA GENERACIÓN” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de gorras, venta de comida, venta de salchipapas, venta de mantas, venta de ropa deportiva, tejido de fajas.

La señora Claudia, indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que trabaja en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de elaboración de prendas artesanales en tejido y costura, ella cuenta que el conocimiento de este negocio se lo enseño su madre hace muchos años atrás, ya que ella le apoyaba en la elaboración de estos productos, posteriormente ella inicio su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de lana y tela) mismo que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y todos los asesores que les ayudan.

En la fotografía se encuentra la prima de Doña Marina, quien esta vestida de chompa negra, quien acompaña al grupo en su día de desembolso.
texts.en:
The. “NUEVA GENERACIÓN” communal bank is in its ninth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of twelve members and is led by a board of directors of which Claudia is the secretary. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. Among them, we have knitting hats, selling food, selling salchipapas, selling blankerts, selling sports cloths and weaving skirts. 

Claudia indicates that six years ago she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a counselor that works in the institution. Right now, she has a business making woven and knitted artisanal clothing. She learned about this business from her mother many years ago when she used to help her make these products. Later she started her own business. 

The loan she is taking out now is to grow her capital (buying wool and fabric). She will buy these things in ths distributors and later sell her products in the markets of the city of El Alto. This work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, since she is in a common law marriage and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the trainings about health and all of the consultants who help them. 

Marina's cousin can be seen in the photo. she is wearing a black sweater. She was with the group on its disbursement day.

loans.use: to buy wool and fabric

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is thirty nine years old and married with three children. She runs a clothing business and has been in this business for ten years earning a monthly income of forty thousand shillings. 

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it for adding more stock of skirts, shorts, and trousers. She plans to use the anticipated profit to purchase a plot. She hopes to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: to add more stock of skirts, shorts, and trousers for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 45 years old and married. He is from Bethlehem and has four children.

He has a greenhouse where he plants different kinds of vegetables.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy manure, compost and saplings and to repair the greenhouse. He hopes to provide his family with a better life, increase his income and ensure his family has a stable financial life.

loans.use: to buy manure,  compost, and saplings, and to repair the greenhouse.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 60-year-old widowed woman. She has two children, 11 years and 16 years old. She describes herself to be an influential and social woman. 

Miriam operates a dairy farm where she sells milk.  She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located at a very competitive spot, and her primary customers are dairy companies and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the poor roads for delivering milk to customers. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern. 

Her business goal is to buy ten more dairy cows within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits generated.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 30 years old and married. He runs a computer services business. He has been in this business for eight years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 shillings.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to buy more modems, flash disks and printing papers for the business. He plans to use the anticipated profit to open a kiosk for the wife. His future hope and dream is to have cyber cafe.

loans.use: to buy modems, flash disks and printer paper

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 34 years old and married with three children. She runs a green grocery business, which she has done for five years. She earns a monthly income of 12,000 shillings.

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase onions, potatoes and carrots. She plans to use the anticipated profit to open another green grocer business. She hopes to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, carrots and onions to sell
