loans.name: Bader

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has four children.
 
Bader repairs cars. He has had a small garage since 2007. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy two specialized machines for his work and some other equipment. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two specialized machines and other equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bed covers and curtains to sell

loans.name: Pablo Carlos

texts.es:
En la calurosa ciudad de Nazca, Perú, caracteriza por albergar a Las “Líneas de Nazca”, las cuales son extensos dibujos en medio de un gran campo árido las cuales tienen las formas de animales y que según algunos estudios eran utilizados por la antigua cultura Nazca como calendario astrológico; en esta ciudad vive Pablo. Pablo tiene 52 años es un hombre muy trabajador y sobre todo muy carismáticos, es padre de 2 hijos a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes ha trabajado muy duro para sacarlos adelante y sean personas de bien; cuando tiene un tiempo libre a Pablo le gusta leer sobre todo porque lo distrae de las preocupaciones del día a día, también como buen peruano le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Adobo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser un Ingeniero.

Día a día pablo trabaja como agricultor en su pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado garbanzo, él le dedica a su cultivo alrededor de 7 horas diarias ya que siempre vela porque que su sembrío este bien regado y también que no le entre ninguna enfermedad; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy dedicado y porque siempre trabaja con muchas ganas.

Pablo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, de esta manera el podrá obtener frutos buenos y una buena cosecha, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá seguir luchando día a día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Poder obtener el título de propiedad de su parcela”.
texts.en:
In the warm city of Nazca, Perú--known for the "Nazca Lines," which are extensive drawings in the middle of a great arid field, which have animal shapes and according to some studies were used by the ancient Nazca culture as an astrological calender--in this city lives Pablo.  Pablo is 52 years old and is above all, a very hard-working and charismatic man.  He is the father of two children whom he loves so much and for whom he has worked very hard to help them get ahead and become people of means.  When Pablo has free time he enjoys reading above all because it distracts him from the worries of each day.  Also, as a good Peruvian, he really enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, which is the delicious "Adobo."  Due to his few economic resources, he was only able to complete high school, but he would have really liked to study to be an engineer.

Day after day Pablo works as a farmer on his small plot of land in which he has planted garbanzo (chick peas).  He dedicates around 7 hours a day to his crop since he always watches over it so that his plantings are well watered and also so that no disease enters.  He believes that all is going well in his work because he is very dedicated and because he always works with great effort.

Pablo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have offered, he will be able to purchase compost and fertilizers for his crop, enabling him to obtain a good harvest.  Thus, he will be able to improve his income and continue striving daily to make his great dream of "obtaining the property title to his farm" a reality.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en: Dalia is a 29-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and three siblings. One of them is working.  Her father is the one taking care of the family. He strives to work really hard to satisfy their needs. As for Dalia, she started her own business at an early age. She opened her own recharge card shop in 2010 and still has it. She is a wholesaler. Her job consists of buying big quantities of recharge cards and then selling them to the neighboring shops.  Today, she is asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the quantity of cards she needs. She confirms that this Kiva loan will certainly boost her sales and thus her profits. Dalia is trying to benefit from her sales increase during the summer because of the he number of tourists visiting the country.

loans.use: to purchase recharge cards

loans.name: Sharbonu

texts.ru: Шарбону  46 летняя женщина, замужем, имеет двоих детей. По профессии она работает в сельской больнице, медсестрой а ее муж строитель.Но у них очень маленькие доходы поэтому  они дополнительно занимаются откормом и продажей скота.В основном Шарбону откармливает коров и телят а продажей занимается ее муж.Этим доходом они очень довольны поэтому хотят развивать свой бизнес. На полученный  кредит она хочет купить ещё трех молодых бычка для откармливания.
texts.en: Sharbonu is a 46-year old woman, married, with two children. She works as a registered nurse in  a village hospital. Her husband is a construction worker. However, their income is very low, which is why they also fatten and resell livestock. Sharbonu mainly takes care of fattening cows and calves, and her husband takes care of selling the animals. They are very satisfied with this source of income and would like to develop their business further. Sharbonu would like to use her loan in order to buy three young bulls for fattening.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old and married but still doesn’t have children.

Ammar has owned a shoe shop since 2010, selling shoes. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers. He knows about their demands. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Ammar is requesting a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 47 years old and married with two children. She runs an M-pesa business which is known as a local money transfer and phone accessories business. She has been in this business for two years, earning monthly income of 50,000 shillings. This will be her first loan from KADET Ltd which she plans to use for purchasing more accessories and increasing her M-pesa float. 

Beth plans to use her anticipated profits to open another M-pesa business. She hopes to become a prosperous business lady in future.

loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories and increase her M-pesa float.

loans.name: Alogojesuton 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ALOGOJESUTON 3 est composé de vingt personnes qui vivent dans un même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Laure est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Laure a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et ne vit plus avec son mari. Laure est âgée de 44 ans et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Laure vit seule avec ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Laure mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits et des tissus de façon ambulante. Laure s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Laure sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement ALOGOJESUTON 3, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Alogojesuton-3 group is composed of 20 individuals living in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that the group is seeking financing from ALIDé, in order to expand their business. The group’s representative, by the name of Laure, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Laure has left school after the primary level. She is separated from her husband. Laure is 44 years old and the mother of two children, both in her care and attending school. Laure lives alone with her children. Together with her husband, she provides for the household needs. In order to make a living, Laure sells fabric and miscellaneous items as a street vendor. Laure stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to meet customer demand and increase her sales volume and her revenues, Laure, together with the other members of her group, is seeking her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fabric and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used shoes to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Liliam Mireya

texts.es: Liliam tiene en su domicilio una mini tienda la cual empezo vendiendo colas por la ventana, con el pasar el tiempo fue comprando de poco a poco víveres y variedad de artículos o lo que las personas de su barrio más le pedían. Actualmente arreglo la parte frontal de su casa ubicada en Playas, compro unas perchas y puso su mini tienda. el trabajo lo realiza sola ya que dice estar en buen estado de salud y sentirse joven, abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Los productos que más vende son arroz por libra, colas, jugos, golosinas, azúcar y víveres etc. Liliam asegura no tener problemas ya que su barrio es tranquilo y es conocida. Espera poder conseguir el crédito ya que con el compraría productos para agrandar su tienda, se siente muy contenta con sus logros ya que al tener su tienda puede pasar tiempo con sus hijas. Liliam es madre soltera de dos niñas de 10 y 6 años, por lo que desea ampliar su negocio vendiendo más productos para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Liliam has a mini shop in her home which she began by selling soft drinks through the window. With the passing of time she gradually began buying groceries and a variety of products or whatever the people in her neighborhood were requesting the most. Currently she has adapted the front part of her home, located in Playas. She purchased some racks and set up her mini shop. She handles the work herself since, she says, she is in good health and feels young. She opens up at 7 a.m. and closes at 9 p.m. Her most-sold items are rice by the pound, soft drinks, juices, candy, sugar and groceries. Reassuringly, Liliam does not have problems since her neighborhood is calm and she is known. 

She hopes to obtain the loan because she will purchase products with it that will expand her shop. She is very happy with her achievements since her shop allows her to spend time with her daughters. Liliam is a single mother to two girls, 10 and 6 years of age. Therefore she wishes to expand her business selling more products in order to make more income.

loans.use: to purchase rice by the pound, soft drinks, juices, candy, sugar and groceries.

loans.name: Johana Cecibel

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Agrupación 24 De Mayo. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johanna, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  5 y 3 años  de edad, el mayor  estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio.

Nuestra amiga tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual tiene un soda bar, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes bocadillos de picar y bebidas como batidos de frutas y productos elaborados como gaseosas, cervezas entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días pero más que todo por las tardes y noches que es cuando más vende. Lleva 6 años con este negocio el cual le ha permitido salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar pues a él no le alcanza  para cubrir los gastos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su negocio, va a comprar sodas, jugos, frutas y cervezas para satisfacción de sus clientes. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.

Su meta es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks in the hamlet of Rocafuerte the members of the communal bank "Agrupación 24 de Mayo" meet. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by the inhabitants, which are recognized throughout the entire country. 

In this place we met Ms. Johanna, 28, who is married and from this relationship has two children, 5 and 3 years of age. The eldest goes to school. Her husband earns a living in farming and commerce. 

Our friend has a small shop in her home where she has a soda bar. There she offers her customers small snacks and drinks such as fruit smoothies, soft drinks and beer among other things. She works every day but especially in the afternoons and evenings which is when she sells more. She has had this business six years which has helped her get ahead and help her husband with household expenses, since he does not have enough to cover the costs. 

She will use this loan to further stock her business. She will buy sodas, juices, fruit and beer in order to satisfy her customers. She has been with the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because she has made many friends in the group. 

Her goal is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, juices, fruits and beer.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has five children.

Ahmad has owned a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good understanding of local customers. He knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Ahmad is requesting $3000 as a loan to buy an air conditioner and a refrigerator. He also wants to install an external ceiling for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and a refrigerator. He also wants to install an external ceiling for his shop

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Twenty-two-year-old Liza is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol, in the Philippines. She is married and has an eight-month-old son. Her husband also works on the farm. Liza is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings, and to pay for the labor she needs for land preparation. This is the only livelihood that she and her family have to support their needs so Liza is determined to ensure that it will be profitable. The income from the farm will provide her family with food and savings. 

In the future, Liza hopes to have another business so she can better support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Koukin Yaare Group

texts.fr:
Mme Alizeta est responsable du groupe KOUKIN YAARE. Elle se porte bien ainsi que sa famille. Elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 13ans.1 va à l’école et elle a 10personne a sa charge.

Elle est tisseuse depuis 30ans. Son activité de tissage avance tout doucement. Elle est très contente. Mme s’approvisionne dans les boutiques environnantes de secteur 07 en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter une (01) balle de fils de tisse et  de teinture toute couleur confondue.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut s’occuper de sa progéniture. Elle ambitionne  agrandir  son atelier de tissage et s’occuper de la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. Alizeta is the leader of the "Koukin Yaare" group. She supports both herself and her family well. She is a widowed mother of four children. The oldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 13. One attends school, and Ms. Alizeta has ten people in her care.

She has been a weaver for 30 years. Her weaving business is progressing gradually. She is very pleased. Ms. Alizeta gets her supplies at the shops around sector 7 of the city. Her customers are men and women.

With her profits, she wants to take care of her offspring. Her ambition is to expand her weaving workshop and take care of her child's education.

loans.use: To buy one bale of weaving yarn and various dyes.

loans.name: Dissina Dama Group

texts.fr: Âgé de 47ans, Mr Tchassama est marié à une cultivatrice. Ils ont 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Ils ont 09 et 04ans. Depuis 1997, il s’est donné à la culture de la terre et le fait avec joie en RÉGION CENTRALE. Deux personnes l’aident pour avoir un bon rendement et il est à son quatrième crédit de WAGES. Cet argent lui servira à s’approvisionner en outils de travail. Avec le profit, il veut construire un logement, augmenter la superficie cultivable et assurer la santé et la scolarisation des enfants. Il est dans une association « DISSINA DAMA » et est nommé par les autres pour les diriger. Il est constitué de femmes et d’hommes et sont en majorité dans la culture de la terre. Ils sont prêts à vite solder le crédit afin de faire une autre demande.
texts.en: Mr. Tchassama is 47 years old and married to a farmer. They have two children, one of whom is in school. The children are aged 9 and 4. Since 1997, he has dedicated himself joyfully to farming in the central region. Two people help him in order to have a good harvest, and he is on his fourth loan from WAGES. This money will serve to obtain supplies of work tools. With the profits, he wants to build housing, add to his cultivable acreage, and ensure his children's health and education. He is in a group named "Dissina Dama" and was named the leader by the other members. The group comprises men and women, most of whom are farmers. They are ready to quickly repay the loan in order to seek another one.

loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Jasem

texts.en:
Jasem is from Iraq. He is 74 years old, married and has five children.

Jasem has owned a food store since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, beef, chicken, fish and dairy products. He has the experience he needs to run his business, and has developed a good understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Ousséwou

texts.fr: Femme d’architecte, Ousséwou est âgée de 42 ans et mère de trois enfants. Le premier est âgé de 20 ans et le dernier de 14 ans. Ousséwou est une revendeuse de profession depuis les années 2003 et exerce comme activité la vente du maïs et des oignons destinée à tout acheteur. Elle travaille toute seule et son activité se déroule dans un marché de la place. Ousséwou est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et dans le but de maintenir le cap, elle fait appel au soutien financier de cette dernière afin de s’acheter du maïs et des oignons. Elle compte ainsi épargner assez d’argent pour agrandir son activité et assurer  à sa famille tous ses besoins vitaux.
texts.en: The wife of an architect, Ousséwou is 42 years old and has three children. The oldest is 20 and the youngest is 14. Ousséwou has been a retailer by profession since 2003 and runs a business selling maize and onions to all types of customers. She works all by herself and runs her business at a market in the area. Ousséwou is a longstanding client of WAGES and with the goal of maintaining her course, she is seeking financial support from WAGES in order to buy maize and onions. She intends to thereby save enough money to expand her business and ensure that her family's vital needs are met.

loans.use: To buy onions and maize

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a rice farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has four children, ages 3, 9, 11 and 20. She is focused on giving her children a better chance at life, which motivates her to work very hard on her farm.

Ludivina wants to increase the production of her farm. She is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides for her farm. With the profits from her harvest, she will be able to pay her children's school tuition and their fares to travel there. She will also be able to feed her family with nutritious meals.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Manibessibe

texts.fr: Revendeuse de profession, Manibessibe est mariée à un transitaire et est mère de deux enfants dont un sur les bancs de l’école. Son premier et son dernier enfant sont respectivement âgés de 04 ans et 07 mois. Manibessibe est âgée de 27 ans et vend des casseroles et des bois de chauffage au domicile conjugal depuis 2009 sans l’aide de personnes. Ayant compris que le recours à la dette permet d’augmenter sa rentabilité économique, cette ancienne cliente de WAGES sollicite de nouveau un crédit pour l’achat des casseroles. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité les surplus de son revenu et comme perspectives d’avenir, agrandir son activité tout en assurant pour ses enfants la meilleure des éducations.
texts.en: A retailer by profession, Manibessibe is married to a forwarding agent and is the mother of two children, one of whom attends school. Her two children are 4 years old and 7 months old, respectively. Manibessibe is 27 years old and has sold pans and firewood at her home since 2009, without the help of other other people. Having understood that obtaining credit will allow her to increase her economic profitability, this longstanding client of WAGES is seeking a new loan to buy pans. She wants to reinvest her surplus income in her business and, in terms of future plans, to expand her business while ensuring the best possible education for her children.

loans.use: To buy pans.

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has two children.

Diaa has owned a grocery since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3000 as a loan to install shelves, a refrigerator and a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install shelves, a refrigerator and a generator

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is thirty seven years old and married with two children. He has been in both the dairy and crop farming business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

This will be his fifth loan through KADET LTD and this time he plans to purchase water pipes for irrigation. He plans to use the anticipated profit to improve his business.

One of his hopes and dreams is to buy a dairy cow and supply milk to his village in future.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for irrigating the vegetables on his farm

loans.name: Simion

texts.en: Simon is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a farm and a quarry where he sells building blocks and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are teachers and farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 5800 loan to buy a solar lantern. His business goal is to own another quarry within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy land.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Dora Juana

texts.es: Dora de 55 años vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, este sector está en una parte de surgimiento y promete convertirse en una zona con mucho movimiento comercial.  Hace muchos años invirtió un capital abriendo una tienda de víveres, anteriormente en este sector había poca competencia pero con el paso del tiempo ha ido aumentando, Dora no está muy preocupada ya que tiene cliente y está muy bien ubicada. El negocio lo empezó cuando su esposo la abandono y al ser ama de casa tenía poco conocimiento para laboral en alguna empresa. La decisión que tomo fue muy acertada ya que gracias a ella a sacado adelante a sus hijos y les ha dado la educación. El negocio lo atiende ella desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche vendiendo productos como arroz, azúcar, pollo, detergentes, enlatados, embutidos, lácteos etc. espera comprar estos productos con el crédito para aumentar su inventario y surtir su negocio. Su meta a futuro es construir varios departamentos en su vivienda para vivir de las rentas cuando deicida descansar de su negocio.
texts.en:
Dora is 55 and lives in the Orquídeas of Guayaquil. This is an emerging area and promises to become an area with a lot of commercial activity. Several years ago, Dora invested some capital to open her general store. Before, there had been little competition in this area, but little by little the competition has increased. Dora is not very worried since she has a good clientele and is in a good location. 

She started the business when her husband abandoned her. Since she had been a housewife, she did not have the knowledge needed to work in a company. The decision that she made was a good one, and it allowed her to help her kids get ahead in life. She was able to give them an education. 

She opens her business from 10 in the morning until 11 at night, selling products such as rice, sugar, chicken, detergents, canned goods, sausage, dairy products, etc. She hopes to purchase more of these products with the loan in order to increase her inventory and stock her store. Her goal for the future is to construct various apartments in her home so she can live off the rent when she decides to take a break from her business.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, chicken, detergents, canned food, sausage, and dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her vehicle

loans.name: Fanny Rudith

texts.es:
Fanny es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pequeño hijo de 9 años, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separo de su pareja, desde entonces ella es madre y padre para su pequeño; ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante junto con su pequeño, gracias al apoyo de sus padres quienes siempre han estado a su lado, Fanny pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no ha podido ejercer su profesión, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde tempranas horas de la mañana, día a día Fanny trabaja como boletera en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, ella trabaja un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 75 clientes, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que sus jefes la consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable.
Fanny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo y puesta de falso piso de su vivienda; de esta manera Fanny podrá tener su vivienda en mejores condiciones, así podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su pequeño hijo, y poco a poco en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder tener un negocio propio para con ello asegurar el futuro y la educación de su pequeño.
texts.en:
Fanny is a woman of 29 years. She lives in the city of Ica with her young 9 year old son. Unfortunately, for various reasons she has been separated from her husband for many years. She has to act as both mother and father to her little one. She is friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic. She dedicates all her efforts to getting herself and her son ahead in life. Thanks to the support of her parents, who have always been at her side, Fanny was able to study the professional career of nursing. Unfortunately, due to the need to work and pay her bills, she has not been able to use her profession. She would like to be able to work as a nurse. In her free time, she likes to dedicate some of her time to reading. Sometimes she cooks up a delicious Ají de Gallina [shredded chicken with peppers and sauce] to share with her family. 

With a lot of hard work, and thanks to the support of her family, Fanny works day after day, starting early in the morning as a ticket seller at a transportation company in her city. She works about 12 hours a day, and can attend to about 75 customers. She enjoys the work and her bosses regard her highly because of her diligence and friendly treatment. 

Fanny is thankful for the Kiva loans. Thanks to their support, she will be able to make improvements on her home. She wants to plaster the walls and install a false floor for her home. This way Fanny will be able to keep her home in better condition, and thus be able to provide better security and well being for her young son. Little by little in the near future, she hopes to have her own business that she can use to assure the future and the education of her little one.

loans.use: make improvements on her home

loans.name: Salima

texts.fr: Salima est mariée à un chauffeur et est mère de famille de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Son ainé est âgé de 11 ans et son benjamin de 05 ans. Elle est âgée de 36 ans et est de profession revendeuse. Salima exerce son activité dans sa boutique toute seule et vend des produits d’alimentation générale. Pour renforcer plus ses capacités et devenir la meilleure dans mon milieu, Salima qui a déjà eu deux microcrédits auprès de WAGES en sollicite un troisième pour l’achat des produits d’alimentation générale. Avec les surplus de ses revenus, elle souhaite épargner assez dans le but de diversifier ses sources de revenu et d’assurer un bel avenir à toute sa famille.
texts.en: Salima is married to a driver and is mother to three children, who are all at school. Her eldest child is 11 years old and her youngest five. She is 36 years old and is a retailer by trade. She carries out her business alone in her shop and sells general grocery products. In order to strengthen her capacity and become the best in her neighborhood, Salima, who has already had two microloans from WAGES, is requesting a third so that she can buy general groceries. With what remains of her income, she would like to save enough to diversify her sources of income and ensure a good future for all her family.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products.

loans.name: Fidan

texts.en:
Fidan is 30 years old. He is married and has only one child, who is two years old. He lives in Kosovo. Two years ago he started his business of washing vehicles by borrowing money and now he has managed to provide income for his family.

Fidan is a hardworking person who works seven days a week in his car washing business. He wants to increase the capacity of his business, in order to be able to satisfy his clients, meet the demand for the service of washing vehicles, and gain more interested clients. This will permit him to increase his business and give his clientele good care. 

The loan he’s asking for is to repair his car wash to provide better service and have more customers. In this way he will obtain a better income to sustain his family, and he is grateful to KosInvest for the support that they provide him.

loans.use: to repair his car wash.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: Elle s’appelle Abiba et est âgée de 38 ans. Mariée à un chauffeur, Abiba est une mère de famille de trois enfants dont deux scolarisés. Le premier enfant a 12 ans et le dernier est âgé de 04 ans. Abiba est une revendeuse de profession et son activité se porte sur le commerce des objets en plastiques. Elle travaille seule depuis les années 2004 en tant qu’ambulante et ses produits sont destinés à toute personne. Pour sa première fois, Abiba sollicite un crédit à WAGES pour renforcer ses activités et acquérir des objets en plastiques. Dans une envie d’évolution, Abiba souhaite réinvestir ses profits supplémentaires dans son activité. Elle espère ainsi prospérer dans son activité et pour sa famille, assurer un épanouissement certain.
texts.en: This customer's name is Abiba and she is 38 years old. She is married to a driver and is mother to three children, two of whom are at school. The eldest child is 12 years old and the youngest four. Abiba is a retailer by trade and her business is the sale of plastic products. She has been working alone since 2004 on a door-to-door basis and she sells her products to all sorts of people. Abiba is requesting a loan for the first time from WAGES, so that she can boost her business and get new plastic products. With a desire to develop her business, Abiba wants to reinvest her future profits in her business. She thereby hopes that her business will prosper and she will be able to ensure that her family blossoms.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls.

loans.name: Aboudourazizou

texts.fr: Jeune célibataire âgé de 29 ans, Aboudourazizou est de profession revendeur depuis les années 2007. Il exerce comme activité la vente de vélo et de matériels informatiques dans sa boutique destinée à toute la population. Pour juguler les quelques risques de concurrence liés à sa profession, Aboudourazizou qui a déjà obtenu un microcrédit à WAGES sollicite de nouveau pour l’achat des matériels informatiques. Il compte augmenter son autofinancement avec ses revenus additionnels. Comme perspectives, ce dernier souhaite augmenter sa part de marché et assurer un bel avenir pour à sa famille.
texts.en: Aboudourazizou is a young single man, who is 29 years old and has been a retailer by trade since 2007. He sells bicycles and computer equipment in his shop to all sorts of people. In order to stamp out some of the competition risks linked to his trade, Aboudourazizou, who has already had one micro-loan from WAGES, is requesting a new loan to buy computer equipment. He is planning to increase his self-funding with his additional income. his aim is to increase his market share and ensure a good future for his family.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment.

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr: Jeune femme célibataire, Essénam travaille comme une revendeuse depuis les années 2007. Son activité principale se porte sur la vente de mèches, des tissages, des pagnes et des produits cosmétiques destinée à toute personne désireuse de s’en acquérir. Elle exerce cette activité dans sa boutique et travaille sans l’aide de personnes. Pour renforcer son commerce, Essénam qui vient de connaitre WAGES sollicite son premier crédit afin de s’acheter des mèches, des tissages, des pagnes et des produits cosmétiques. Elle souhaite ainsi réinvestir le surplus de son revenu dans ses activités tout en espérant que son activité prospèrera et qu’elle puisse subvenir aux besoins de sa future famille.
texts.en: Essénam is a young single woman, who has been working as a retailer since 2007. Her main activity is the sale of hair extensions, hair weaves, "pagnes" (colourful pieces of fabric) and cosmetics, which she sells to all sorts of people wanting to buy these products. She has been carrying out this business in her shop without any help from anyone else. In order to build up her business, Essénam, who has just got to know WAGES, is requesting a first loan so that she can buy hair extensions, hair weaves, "pagnes" and cosmetics. She would like to invest what is left over from her income into her business, while at the same time hoping that it will prosper and that she will be able to provide for her future family's needs.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair weaves and cosmetics.

loans.name: Al Diouma

texts.fr: Madame Al Diouma habite dans une des localités du Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis plus de 3 ans   dans le secteur du commerce plus particulièrement dans la vente de pâte d’arachide et de poissons séchés. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans son activité. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants âgés de 10  et 25 ans respectivement. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pâte d’arachide et de poissons séchés à revendre. Ce financement pourra l’aider à augmenter son fond de roulement et améliorer ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Al Diouma lives in one of Senegal's towns. She has been a trader, notably selling groundnut paste and dried fish, for more than three years, and thus has three years' experience in this field. She is married and mother to two children, aged ten and 25 years old respectively. She is a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs, with which she plans to buy groundnut paste and dried fish for resale. This loan will enable her to increase her working capital and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy groundnut paste and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province. He is married and has no children. He owns a retail shop and has been operating it for one and a half years. Apart from this, he gets his additional income from operating a cyber cafe. Ronald learnt about Milango through friends and joined the organization with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. The challenges he face are price fluctuation and inflation.

Ronald is applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenya shillings to purchase soap, milk, bread, sugar, and cereals. The extra income from the loan will be added to savings to expand the business and further his studies. His future plan is to expand the business to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, bread, sugar, and cereals.

loans.name: Bukengere Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bililo est une femme dynamique,âgée de 49ans. Présidente du groupe de crédit Bukengere est mariée à un homme d’affaire et  mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle vend des bassins, paniers en plastique et des casseroles. Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à l’achat de 10 douzaines des casseroles à 260$,  15 douzaines de bassins à 135$ et 10 douzaines de paniers à 145$. Son vœu  est de devenir grossiste ; ainsi, elle remercie Hekima  pour ses actions.
texts.en: The customer, Bililo, is a dynamic woman who is 49 years old. She is president of the Bukengere loan group, married to a businessman and mother to eight children, who have all been or are being educated. She sells bowls, plastic baskets and saucepans. The loan she has requested will be used to buy 10 dozen saucepans for $260, 15 dozen bowls for $135 and 10 dozen baskets for $145. She would like to become a wholesaler and thanks Hekima for its actions.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen saucepans, 15 bowls and 10 dozen baskets.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman who lives in Limuru, Kenya. She has been a farmer for three years and earns a monthly income of 16,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the money to buy seeds and prepare her land for planting season. She plans to purchase a dairy cow with the anticipated profit.

She also hopes to become a successful business woman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and prepare her land for planting season

loans.name: Kombo

texts.en:
Kombo lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six children. He owns a food cafe that he has been operating for eight years. He started the business using a loan from friends.

He learned about microfinance organization Milango through an employee and joined the organization with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business. His main challenges are low profits during low seasons, taxes and customers not paying on time.

Kombo is applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenyan shillings (KES) to enlarge his business premises and build a grocery store. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to purchase utensils for the business. His future plans are to expand the business into a big restaurant.

loans.use: to enlarge his cafe and build a grocery store.

loans.name: Sonia Corina

texts.es:
Sonia es una joven de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad podemos apreciar la “Laguna de Huacachina”, la cual se encuentra en medio de maravillosas dunas y sobre todo recibe a muchos turistas en todo el año, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho leer algunos libros, en ocasione también le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Escabeche de pollo”. Ella logro estudiar la carrera de enfermería, pero trabaja actualmente en su negocio.

Día a día Sonia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de alfalfa y heno, ella tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual siembra la alfalfa para después venderla, ella trabaja alrededor de 5 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque siempre es honrada con ellos.

Sonia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar heno y empacarlo para poder ofrecerlo a los clientes, tambien compra de abono para su cultivo d ealfalfa, de esta manera ella podrá tener más productos para ofrecer a los clientes y sobre todo porque mejorara sus ingresos, de esta manera ella podrá seguir trabajando para hacer  realidad su más grande sueño:”Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Sonia is a young woman 28 years old. She lives in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized by having a warm and comfortable climate. We can also appreciate that we have in this city the Laguna de Huacachina, which is in an environment of marvelous dunes and it receives many tourists all year long. Crops especially grown here include cotton, grapes, asparagus, and paprika among others.

When she has a little bit of free time she likes to read some books. She also enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes which is the delicious escabeche de pollo (pickled chicken). She studied nursing, but currently works in her business.

Sonia works every day in her little business selling alfalfa and hay. She has a little plot where she grows alfalfa in order to sell it later. She works around 5 hours a day and she can assist up to 20 customers daily. She believes that it is going well in her business because she is very friendly with the customers and above all because she is always honest with them.

Sonia is very happy with the Kiva loans and thanks to the help given to her she could buy hay and make bales in order to offer it to her clients. Also she buys fertilizer in order to grow alfalfa, and in this way she can have more products to offer her customers and above all because she can improve their income. In this way she can continue working in order to achieve her greatest dream: to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy hay and manure

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is forty-two years old and married with two children. She runs a retail shop business, and she has been in this business for three years, earning a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD  and she plans to use it for purchasing stock of body oil and perfumes to add to her inventory for sale. 


She plans to use the anticipated  profit to purchase a plot of land, and she hopes to have a stable life in future.

loans.use: to purchase  more stock of  body oil and perfumes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 58 años, es una mujer muy generosa, amable y trabajadora. Su pareja es Arturo,  quien es comerciante y el padre de sus trece hijos. Actualmente viven en su casa (propia) con dos de sus hijos: Nepsi 19 y Biger de 11 años. 

Su negocio es la venta de pescado fresco. Su actividad empieza desde muy temprano, cuando se dirige al puerto para comprar el pescado fresco y de buena calidad; luego lo vende de manera ambulatoria por los diferentes asentamientos humanos, en unos triciclos y con un parlante para llamar a los clientes. Esta actividad la realiza cerca de 5 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su pareja quien lleva uno de los triciclos. Lo considera rentable porque le permite tener ingresos trabajando sólo medio día y el resto del tiempo puede dedicarlo a su familia y su hogar. Antes el dinero no le alcanzaba para solventar los gastos de su hogar; pero ahora, aun tiene planes de seguir trabajando y hacer crecer su negocio.

Este es su crédito número 16 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo financiero, ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila. Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará más pescado fresco, en mayor cantidad y variedad.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old.  She is a very generous, kind, hard-working woman.  Her partner, Arturo, is a salesman and the father of her thirteen children.  They currently live in their own home together with two of their children: 19-year-old Nepsi and 11-year-old Biger.

Maria's business is selling fresh fish.  She starts work very early when she heads to the port to buy fresh, good-quality fish.  She later sells the fish as an itinerant vendor in different housing developments.  She makes her sales from tricycle-carts equipped with a loudspeaker which she uses to call her customers' attention.  She has been in this business for nearly five years and has help from her partner who uses one of the tricycle-carts.  She considers her business to be profitable because it makes her income only working half days.  This means she is able to spend the rest of her time taking care of her family and home.  In the past, she didn't have enough money to cover her household expenses but now she has plans to continue working and growing her business.

This is Maria's 16th loan from MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support because it will give the security she needs to continue working peacefully.  She is also very happy to belong to her community bank as all the members are very responsible and supportive.

Maria will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy more fresh fish.  She will buy a larger quantity and variety.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, 30, is from Nyahururu; she is married with two children (ages 6 and 4).

Rosemary is a farmer and also has a cereal business that she's been doing for the past five years. She has applied for her first loan of 5000 KES from KADET to buy maize, millet and beans to add to her cereal stock for sale. 

She hopes to improve her standard of living in the near future and ensure that her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy maize, millet and beans.

loans.name: Lili Elivira

texts.es:
Doña Lili, sigue con su negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, surtiendo cada día, para lograr mejores ventas, mejores ganancias para cubrir sus gastos personales, negocio que ha crecido con préstamos otorgados por Afodenic y ayuda de sus tres hijos casados e independiente, siendo una mujer soltera. En el día vive acompañada de su nuera y nieto.
Sus créditos han sido para seguir comprando ropa variada, con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en ropa: dos docenas de camisetas bebe león, tres docenas de camiseta tricotextil, quince unidad pantalón mis Ruddy, una docena de toallas de mano, siendo muy demandados por sus clientes estos productos.
texts.en:
Lili continues with her business of selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics, provisioning every day in order to achieve better sales and better earnings to cover personal expenses. The business has grown with funded loans through Afodenic and the help of her three married and independent children, being a single woman. During the day her daughter-in-law and grandson stay with her.

Her loans have been in order to continue buying varied clothing. She will invest this new loan buying clothing: two dozen baby lion shirts, three dozen t-shirts of the brand TricoTextil, 15 units of my Ruddy pants, and a dozen hand towels since there is a high demand for these products.

loans.use: to invest in clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has a son who is 3 years old. He describes himself to be keen. He operates a motorcycle  where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a busy town and his primary customers are local residents from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent harassment from the city council. 

Joseph will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to improve his business  to taxi operation services within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have bought his own car.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has two children, both attending school. He owns a transport business which he has been operating for three years.

He learnt about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges he is facing are insecurity at night and low income during low seasons.

Justus is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy another motorcycle. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His plan for the future is to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Evila

texts.es:
Evila tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy generosa, amable y trabajadora. Su pareja es Augusto, con quien tiene cinco hijos, a quienes quieren mucho. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron con el trabajo de ambos.
Su trabajo es la venta de pescado. Desde muy temprano se dirige al puerto donde busca el pescado más fresco de diversas variedades para ofrecer a sus clientes los mejores productos.  La venta la realiza en un pequeño mercado informal al costado del puerto, allí acondiciona un espacio donde acomoda su pescado y realiza la venta. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 3 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su pareja. Antes de empezar con esta actividad tenía muchos problemas económicos, pues lo que traía su pareja no le alcanzaba para los gastos de la casa. Ahora se siente muy bien, ya que genera buenos ingresos y siempre tiene clientes. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo financiero que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila. Por su parte, está comprometida en seguir siendo una socia puntual en sus cuotas, así como fue en su anterior crédito. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará más pescado fresco de toda variedad, al por mayor, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen. También adquirirá madera y otros materiales para arreglar y mejorar el lugar donde vende.
texts.en:
Evila is 33 years old. She is a very generous, kind and hardworking woman. Her spouse is Augusto, with whom she has five children, whom they live very much. The house where she lives is their own; they bought it with their hard work. 

Her work is selling fish. Very early she goes to the port where she seeks out dofferent varieties of the freshest fish to offer her customers the best products. She sells at a small informal market next to the port. She has a space there where she sets up her fish and does her selling. She has been doing this job for more than 3 years and she does it with the help of her spouse. Before doing this, she had a lot of financial problems with her spouse, because what he brought in wasn't enough for the household expenses. Now she feels good since she generates good income and always has customers.

This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has a financial backup that will guarantee her to be able to work with peace of mind. She is committed to continue being punctual in her payment, as she was in her previous loan. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all of the members are responsible and supportive.

With the amount she has asked for, 1000 soles, she will buy more fresh fish of all varieties wholesale, seeking low prices to buy in volume. She will also acquire wood and other materials to improve her sales space.

loans.use: to buy more fish and fix her sales space.

loans.name: Leysi

texts.es:
Leysi tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, empeñosa y decidida a sobresalir.  Es viuda del padre de sus tres hijos. Actualmente vive con su hija menor, María de 17 años, en su casa propia, la que construyeron con la ayuda de su difunto esposo.

Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, golosinas y gaseosas. Para eso cuenta con una bodega que instaló en su vivienda, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, ha sabido ganarse la preferencia por el buen trato que les brinda. Se inició hace más de un año con un capital propio y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de su hija. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable pues sus productos son de primera necesidad y tienen salida a diario. Antes tenía problemas, pues la economía de su hogar disminuyo con el fallecimiento de su esposo, por eso tuvo que generar sus propios ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está contenta de saber que cuenta con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con su banco comunal por el apoyo y la solidaridad que recibe de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general, golosinas y gaseosas para surtir su tienda, así tendrá un stock variado disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Leysi is 45 years old.  She is a very hard-working woman who is determined to make progress.  She is widowed from the father of her three children and currently lives with her youngest daughter, 17-year-old Maria, in her own home which she built with the help of her late husband.

Leysi's business is selling groceries, basic household products, candies and soda.  She has a grocery store in her home where she serves her customers in a very friendly manner.  Most of her customers are neighbors and she has known how to gain their loyalty through the friendly manner in which she serves them.  She started her business more than a year ago, with her own capital.  Up to now, she has worked with the support of her daughter.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because her products are household staples and they sell every day.  In the past she had problems because her household finances fell when her husband passed away.  For that reason, she had to start making her own income in order to cover her household expenses.

This is Leysi's second loan from MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support for making progress in her business.  She feels comfortable belonging to her community bank because of the support and solidarity she receives from her fellow members.

Leysi will use the 1,500 soles she has requested to invest in buying general groceries, candies and soda to stock her store.  This will give her a varied stock to sell.

loans.use: to buy more food products, candies and soda to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is engaged. He owns a video library that he has been operating for one year. He started the business through his little savings.

He learnt about Milango through an employee and joined the company with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is purchasing stock.

Dickson is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to enlarge his business by buying a computer for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay college fees for his sister. His future plans are to expand the business and open other businesses in other areas.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a barber shop that he has been operating for two years. He started the business through his little savings.

He learnt about Milango through an employee and joined the company with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are finding customers, price fluctuations and inflation.

Abdalla is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase shaving machines, mirrors, etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to purchase another shaving machine. His future plans are to expand the business by opening other barber shops.

loans.use: To purchase shaving machines, mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Randall

texts.en:
Randall is an amazing athlete.  He is a professional windsurfer, and he has used his experience testing and using water sports products to develop a new technology to revolutionize the sport. His company, called Dry Freak, has developed a line of water and UV repellant clothing for uses in a variety of water-based sports. Dry Freak products are light weight and will not soak. They feature protection from 95% UVA / UVB, have natural odor control, are hypoallergenic, eco-friendly and are made without sweatshop labor.

Randall describes his business as one of his greatest passions. He loves doing what he does and loves to hear feedback from people who use his products. This loan will help Randall purchase more product inventory so he can increase his sales revenue. Financing is something he has struggled with in the past, and this loan will help him continue to provide his technology to water sport athletes.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sewing machines.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Accion just financed a cleaning business in Miami, Florida.  Owner Mario began his own cleaning company after coming to the United States from Cuba almost four years ago.  Mario had a dream of running his own business, a dream that could not be realized back home.  Two years ago, Mario began offering his cleaning services to commercial properties around where he and his family live.  His business has been growing ever since.  He decided early on to focus his services on cleaning commercial and business properties.  He has grown his clientele by providing exceptional customer service which has increased referrals based on word of mouth.   

Mario lives with his wife and young son.  He works hard to ensure that opportunities are available for his son in this country.  He loves spending time with his son playing baseball and going to parks.  Mario has had one obstacle standing in his way from true business success.  He has never borrowed or established his credit with a financial institution.  He learned from a friend about Accion and is so happy to have been approved for a business loan. He needs funds to professionally market his services to get larger contracts.

loans.use: to professionally market his business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Hawa sells tomato, rice, and eggs near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for eight years. She uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Hawa will use the loan to purchase more tomatoes, rice and eggs. With the extra profits, Hawa plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, rice and eggs

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a green grocery stall which she has been operating for the last seven years.

Purity learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, some customers not paying on time, and the seasonal business climate.

Purity is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to stabilize the stocking of her business by buying sacks of vegetables and tomatoes wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business. Her plans for the future are to expand to a wholesale grocery and employ workers.

loans.use: To buy sacks of vegetables and tomatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is thirty-four years old and  married  with one child. He runs a retail shop selling phone accessories.He has been in this business for five years, earning a monthly income of twenty-six thousand shilling.

This will be his sixth loan with KADET LTD and he plans to buy more stock of earphones, phone batteries and chargers for resale. He plans to use the anticipated  profit to plough back into the business.


He hopes to open another shop in the Kikuyu town in future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of earphones, batteries and chargers.

loans.name: Tania Mirtha

texts.es:
En la alegre ciudad de Chincha, ciudad caracterizada por su gastronomía, por sus bailes de origen afroperuano, así como también la generosidad de sus pobladores, vive Tania, Tania tiene 31 años y es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, junto a su pareja tiene 2 pequeños de 9 y 6 años de edad, a los cuales ama muchísimo y junto a su esposo trabajan para poder darles una vida digna y hacerlos personas de bien. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho Salir a pasear con su familia y sobre preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos, la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”, debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el nivel secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo y dedicación Tania trabaja en su negocio de alquiler de equipos de sonido y también vende abarrotes en su vivienda, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo los trata con mucho respeto y por ello cree que le va bien en su negocio por su gran carisma.

Tania está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá comprar una consola de varios canales, con lo cual podrá tener un equipo más adecuado y podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio ya que el sonido se escuchara de mejor manera; con esta mejora ella mejorar sus ingresos y podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Tania lives in the cheerful city of Chincha, a city which is noted for its cuisine, its Afro-Peruvian dances and the generosity of its residents.  Tania is 31 years old.  She is a very hard-working, enthusiastic woman.  She and her partner have two young children who are 9 and 6 years old.  She loves them very much indeed and both she and her husband work hard in order to give them a decent life and ensure they become good people.  Whenever she has a little free time, Tania really enjoys going for walks with her family and, above all, preparing one of her favorite dishes, the delicious 'carapulcra con sopa seca'.  Owing to her parents lack of money, she was not able to study beyond high school.  She would have liked to have studied at university.  

Tania works in her business with a lot of enthusiasm and commitment.  Her business is hiring out sound equipment.  She also sells groceries from her home.  She works around 10 hours a day.  She is very friendly with her customers and, above all, she treats them with a lot of respect.  She believes that her business is doing well because of her great charm.

Tania is very grateful for the help of Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a multi-channel console.  This will give her more suitable equipment and she will be able to offer a better service because the sound will be better.  This improvement will allow her to improve her income and she will be able to continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream come true: to own her own home and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a multi-channel console

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married and has two children. Her husband is a civil servant. She has received schooling through middle school. Lucy  sells soap and maize near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for eight years. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. Lucy  will use the loan to purchase more soap and maize. With the new profits, Lucy hopes to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soap and maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. 

She owns a secondhand clothing shop, a business that she's been running for five years. Her family also gets some income from her husband’s employment.

Carolyne learned about Milango Financial Services through an employee and joined the organization with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are that some customers don't pay on time and the high purchase price of clothing.

Carolyne is applying for a loan of 15850 KES to purchase bales of secondhand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to start a transportation business in future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a resident of the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children who all attend school. She owns a retail shop, a business that she has been operating for seven years. Besides this, she also owns a hardware and mobile accessories shop.

She learnt about Milango through an employee with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are finding customers and the high prices of the items she sells.

Kibibi is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to purchase timber, nails, paint, and accessories she sells in the shop. The extra income will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standard of her family. She aspires to expand her business and open a wholesale business.

loans.use: To purchase timber, nails, paint, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 35-year-old woman operating a small retail shop that majorly deals in consumer goods. Stella applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 to pay school fees for her daughter in secondary school. They have a family of four children and they are all of school-going age. 

Stella's husband is a builder by trade and earns a small income from it. Stella started the business to supplement her husband's income since it could not sutain the whole family.

Stella believes that from her income of about 15,000 Ugx per week, supplemented by her husband's income, she will be able to pay back the loan.

Despite her meagre income, Stella's goal is to fight tooth and nail to send her children to school. She believes education is the best Investment a parent can give a child.

loans.use: pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a resident of the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. She is single. She owns a business offering secretarial services that she has been operating for four years. She started the business through her own little savings and a contribution from her parents.

She learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are customers not paying on time, purchasing stock, and high fuel and transport costs. 

Mary is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to purchase printing paper and service the machines. She aspires to expand her business and move to a bigger place than the place she is currently.

loans.use: to purchase printing paper and service the machines

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She sells cooked rice and fish near Kwarhinkrom. Adjoa has been selling cooked rice and fish for 20 years. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees.  Her loan will be used to buy more rice in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice in bulk.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. She is single but has one child who attends school. She owns a charcoal shop which she has been operating for two years. Besides this business, Purity is also employed as a housekeeper.

Purity learnt about Milango through an employee and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are high cost of transport and seasonal weather.

Purity is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to expand her business by buying charcoal and packing sacks. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to provide for her family and pay school fees for her children. Her plan for the future is to open a cereals shop.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and packing sacks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells cloth, bags, and sandals near Kwarhinkrom. Elizabeth has received an education through middle school. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a purchasing clerk. 

Elizabeth has been selling cloth, bags,  and sandals for 10 years. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more sandals and bags. She hopes to use the new profits to  continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sandals and bags.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells fresh and fried plantains and cassava near Kwarhinkrom. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been selling cassava and plantains for four years. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more plantains and cassava. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more plantains and cassava

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a widow and has six children.  Esi sells earrings, powder, combs, and creams near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for 12 years. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children, as well as pay their school fees, accommodation and utility bills. Esi will use the loan to purchase more earrings and powder. With the new profits, Esi plans to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more earrings and powder

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 28 años, es una mujer alegre y con deseos de superación. Su pareja es Tedy, quien se dedica a la construcción civil, y es el padre de sus dos hijos: Elizabeth de 16 años y Marcos de 14 años. Juntos, viven en la casa que construyeron en el terreno que le fue heredado por su madre.

Su actividad es la confección de ropa y lencería. Oficio que aprendió observando a su hija menor cuando realizaba sus trabajos escolares, luego decidió estudiar y comprar una máquina de coser con sus ahorros. Hace 6 meses se instaló en su vivienda y desde entonces la buscan por los buenos acabados que realiza. Adicionalmente, brinda servicio a domicilio de cosmetología, pedicura, manicure, tinte de cabellos, etc. 
Le gusta el oficio de la costura porque le gusta y puede apoyar a su pareja en solventar los gastos de su hogar. Pero comenta que le incomoda el tener que estar sentada en una misma postura, lo que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. Sus planes son de comprar otras máquinas de coser para poder implementar más su pequeño taller.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen historial crediticio que le permita el acceso a créditos futuros. Además de estar contenta con su banco comunal, pues aprende mucho de las reuniones y charlas que recibe.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, invertirá en arreglar su máquina de coser y con el saldo comprará materiales de costura, como telas, hilos y demás.
texts.en:
Fanny is 28 years old. She is a happy woman eager to succeed. Her partner is Tedy, who works in construction. He is the father of her two children, Elizabeth who is 16 years old and Marcos who is 14 years old. They live together in the house they built on land that was inherited from her mother.

Her activity is making clothing and lingerie. She learned this profession by watching her youngest daughter when she had school work. Later she decided to study and to buy a sewing machine with her savings. Six months ago she set up at home and since then she is looked for because of the quality finish of her work. Also, she provides home service of cosmetology, pedicures, manicures, and hair dyes.

She likes the sewing business because she enjoys it and she can help her partner pay the household expenses. But she says that it is uncomfortable having to be seated in one position, which causes back pain, but this does not discourage her and she continues working and struggling. Her plans are to buy other sewing machines in order to expand her small workshop.

This is her first loan through MFP. Therefore she promises to complete her loan payments as agreed in order to have a good credit history so that she can obtain future loans. Also, she is happy with the communal bank because she learns a lot during the meetings and talks that she receives. 

With the requested amount of 800 nuevos soles, she will fix her sewing machine and with the balance she will buy sewing supplies such as fabrics, threads and more.

loans.use: to fix her sewing machine and to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria  tiene 52 años ella se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza todos los días en su tienda que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela platos variados.
La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con su hijas quienes le ayudan a preparar y atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra por mayor de insumos (papa, arroz, fideo y otros) para lograr tener una despensa llena, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien, la Sra. Gloria es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de comida está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and sells food for a living.  She works every day in her business which is located in her home.  There she prepares a variety of dishes to sell to her customers.  This business is the main source of income for Gloria and her family and she works together with her daughters who help her to prepare the food and serve customers.  

Gloria will use her loan to buy supplies wholesale (potatoes, rice, noodles, etc.) so that she has a full pantry.  Her previous loan went very well.  Gloria is a very hard-working person.  She has been selling food for many years and is very grateful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, noodles and potatoes

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is 39 years old and has four children. Her husband is an electrician. Adjoa owns a cold store near Kwarhinkrom, which she has operated for 14 years. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more frozen meat for her store. With the new profits, Adjoa plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen meat for her store.

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa sells children’s dresses and soap near Kwarhinkrom.  She is married  and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Abenawa has been selling children’s dresses and soap for three years. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more soap and dresses. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dresses and soap

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is divorced and has two children. She has received schooling through the primary level. Aba sells 'kako' (salted fish) and onions near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for eight years. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children, as well as pay their school fees. She is also responsible for paying the accommodation and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more salted fish and onions. With the new profits, she hopes to continue to grow her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more salted fish and onions

loans.name: Yuli

texts.en:
The daughter of a silversmith, Yuli specializes in handcrafted Balinese jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

Yuli has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

Yuli was born near Celuk, renowned for hand-crafted silver and gold. "My mother is a silversmith. After finishing her housework, she spends the rest of the day working with silver. She taught me the art, and it allowed me to pay the tuition for my education. My husband is also a silversmith. We work together, complemented by our different backgrounds."

"I send my deepest gratitude to all of you who are supporting my efforts. I look forward to increased sales in the upcoming months as a result of this microcredit. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Yuli's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4984

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of silver at a bulk rate

loans.name: Mfariji Group

texts.fr: Mateso est une cliente  ambitieuse, présidente du groupe de crédit  mfariji est âgée de 50ans. Mère de 4enfants  tous scolarisés,  est mariée à un commerçant.
