Elle est vendeuse des friperies depuis  sa jeunesse  et  est  au 13ème cycle de crédit chez Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 2 ballons de friperie. Son vouloir est de  devenir grossiste et prie Dieu de bénir Hekima d’avantage.
texts.en: Mateso is an ambitious client.  She is 50 years old and president of the Mfariji loan group.  She has four children who have all attended school and is married to a trader.  She has been selling used clothing since she was young and this is her 13th loan cycle with Hekima.  She will use this new loan to stock up with two bundles of used clothing.  Her wish is to become a wholesaler.  She prays to God to bless Hekima.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Twiyubake Group

texts.fr:
Annociate  fait partie du groupe  Twiyubake et  habite à Gitega .Elle a 29 ans et est mariée à  Therence, un  cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de  7mois à 11 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de bière locale depuis 5ans. 

Elle est à son trezième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer beaucoup de litres de bière locale à vendre,  pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait agrandir son business, en augmentant son capital.
texts.en:
Annociate is a member of the Twiyubake group and lives in Gitega.  She is 29 years old and married to Therence, a farmer.  The couple have four children who are between 7 months and 11 years old.  

Annociate has been selling local beer for five years.

This is Annociate's 13th loan from Turame.  She will use her Kiva loan to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas so that she can prepare many liters of local beer to sell and earn more money.

In the coming years, Annociate would like to expand her business, increasing her capital.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas so that she can prepare and sell many liters of local beer

loans.name: Cinamula Group

texts.fr: La cliente Yalala est une femme  courageuse, présidente du groupe de crédit cinamula. Agée de 35ans, mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés est mariée à un médecin.  Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais et est au 13ème cycle de crédit chez Hekima. Le crédit demandé  va lui servir à l’achat de 100kg de poissons. Elle souhaite ainsi devenir grossiste et  remercie Hekima pour ses prêts.
texts.en: Yalala, the president of the Cinamula loan group, is a courageous woman.  She is 35 years old and the mother of five children who are all in school.  She is married to a doctor.  She sells fresh fish and this is her 13th loan cycle with Hekima.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy 100kg of fish.  She hopes to become a wholesaler and thanks Hekima for her loans.

loans.use: to buy 100kg of fish

loans.name: Rugwasanye Group

texts.fr: Muderwa est une  femme  entrepreneur du groupe rugwasanye dans lequel  elle assume la fonction de la présidente.  Agée de 42ans est mère de 3 enfants  tous scolarisés  et mariée à un homme sans emploi.  Elle est vendeuse des produits alimentaires dont les riz et les haricots depuis 2004. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour l’approvisionnement de 3 sacs de 100kgs de haricots et 3sacs de 50kgs de riz.  Son vœu est  de  construire une maison familiale. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima  et  prie Dieu de le bénir d’avantage.
texts.en: Muderwa is an entrepreneur who belongs to the Rugwasanye group.  She is the group's president.  Muderwa is 42 years old and the mother of three children who are all in school.  Her husband is unemployed.  Muderwa has been selling food products such as rice and beans since 2004.  She is requesting this loan to stock up with three 100kg sacks of beans and three 50kg sacks of rice.  Her wish is to build a family home.  She thanks Hekima and prays to God to further bless her.

loans.use: to buy three 100kg sacks of beans and three 50kg sacks of rice

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: El señor Gerardo tiene 34 años, vive en Belén a 30 Km de Santa Rita. Está casado con la Sra.  Martina y tiene 5 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el Sr. Gerardo es agricultor y sus hijos también le ayudan se dedican a la agricultura y siembra de papa, maíz, yuca y tienen plantas de guineo con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas para la siembra de sus productos como maiz y también lo utilizara en lo que es el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, ya que con el anterior credito le fue muy bien. Él Sr. Gerardo nació en Chuquisaca,  hace 11 años que él vino de Chuquisaca porque lograron conseguir una parcela en Santa Cruz, ya que se vinieron buscando un mejor futuro para el y su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 34 years old. He lives in Belén, 30 kilometers from Santa Rita. He is married to Martina and has 5 school-age children. Garardo is a farmer and his children help him tending to the agriculture and planting of potatoes, corn, cassava, and they have banana trees. With the money from the loan they will buy seeds for growing their products such as corn and also to use in the preparation of the land for planting, as the previous loan went very well. 

Gerardo was bone in Chuquisaca. Its been 11 years since he came from Chuquisaca because they were able to get a parcel of land in Santa Cruz, as they came looking for a better future for himself and his family. He is a hardworking person and grateful with the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: to clear the fields and plant corn.

loans.name: Bunyibunyi Group

texts.fr: Borauzima est  trésorière dans le groupe Bunyibunyi et est à son  6ème cycle de crédit  chez Hekima. Elle vend des produits de 1ère nécessitée (huile cosmétique pour enfants et les savons). Avec le crédit  sollicité, elle pourra se procurer se 100 bacs de savons, 20 boites de sachets rayés et 2 douzaines de huile cosmétique. Elle craint la multiplicité des taxes de l’Etat et la concurrence mais  pense accroitre son entreprise pour subvenir aux besoins de sa  famille. Elle remercie Hekima pour son appui aux femmes actives  économiquement pauvre.
texts.en: Borauzima is the treasurer of the Bunyibunyi group and this is her sixth loan cycle with Hekima.  She sells essential products such as baby oil and soap.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy 100 lots of soap, 20 boxes of striped bags and two dozen lots of baby oil.  She is afraid of the large number of State taxes and the competition but plans to grow her business so that she can meet her family's needs.  She thanks Hekima for supporting working women who are financially poor.

loans.use: to buy 100 lots of soap, 20 boxes of striped bags and two dozen lots of baby oil

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana sigue trabajando Como conserje, de sus tres hijos uno trabaja y dos estudian, su esposo siempre apoyando, el labora como panificador, ambos se esfuerzan para lograr un techo mejor para sus hijos, entre tantas dificultades han logrado las mejoras a través de financiamiento en Afodenic. Hoy en día desean mejorar su higiene personal en comprar un inodoro e instalar las aguas negras, ya que a un tienen letrina y en invierno se le hace muy incomodo. Comprara: arena, cemento, hiero, bloques lámina de zinc, puerta, tubos, pega, y el inodoro, para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ana continues working as a concierge. Of her three children one is working and the other two are in school. Her husband is always helping her, he works as a baker. Both of them work hard to have a better living situation for their children. Among many difficulties they have made improvements through financing with Afodenic. 

Now they wish to improve their personal hygiene by purchasing a toilet and installing a sewage system because they still have a latrine and in the winter it does not make them very comfortable. She will buy sand, cement, iron, blocks, metal sheeting, a door, pipes, paste and a toilet to begin the work.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, pipes, blocks, sand and cement to install a sewage system.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe  tiene 50 años, ella se dedica a la venta de leche en su mismo barrio y también entrega a una empresa de lácteos sus productos, también se encarga del criado de vacas y venta de las mismas, este  préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Guadalupe va a usar este préstamo  para compra de una vaca lechera para su negocio. Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es querer tener más vacas para incrementar su producción de leche y así vender en mas  cantidad y generar mayores ingresos, la Sra. Guadalupe  enfrenta retos en su negocio que el precio alto en la compra de alimento de las vacas ya que para producir más leche necesitan estar bien alimentadas, Ella va a utilizar los beneficios para comprar más  vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 50 years old. She makes a living selling milk in her neighborhood and also delivering her products to a dairy business. She also manages the raising and selling of cows. This loan is her second loan with the institution. Guadalupe is going to use this loan to buy a milk cow for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is her desire to have more cows in order to increase her milk production. In this way she will sell larger quantities and generate greater income. 

Guadalupe confronts challenges in her business because of the high price of cow feed, since she needs her cows to be well feel in order to produce more milk. She is going to use the profits to buy more milk cows.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: La Sra. Emiliana  tiene 40 años y es soltera con cuatro  hijos que son de las edades de 6, 9, 15 y 18 todos ellos se encuentran estudiando, la Sra. Emiliana se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y variedad de verduras en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la zona  Amboro,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Emiliana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de abarrotes refrescos, y variedad de dulces para surtir su tienda,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra.  Emiliana enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la competencia de muchas tiendas que hay en su barrios, la Sra. Emiliana es una persona muy amable y atiende bien a su clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería y así de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, el deseo de la Sra. es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y el de poder terminar de construir su casita.
texts.en: Emiliana is 40 years old. She is single with four children who are 6, 9, 15 and 18 years old and all of them are students. Emiliana works selling groceries and a variety of vegetables in her neighborhood store which is located in Amboro. This loan is her first sequence with the institution. Emiliana is going to use this loan in order to buy groceries, refreshments, and a variety of sweets in order to supply her store. Her reason for asking for a loan is that she lacks working capital. Emiliana faces challenges in her business such as competition from the many stores that are in her neighborhood. Emiliana is a friendly person and she treats her clients well. She is going to use the proceeds to continue buying merchandise and thus be able to generate more income. Her desire is to see her children become professionals and to be able to finish constructing her small house.

loans.use: to buy groceries, refreshments, and a variety of sweets in order to supply her store

loans.name: Chikwanine Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kulondwa est présidente de l’association d’affaire cikwanine. Elle est âgée de 36 ans et mère de 9enfants dont  7scolarisés et est au 12eme cycle de crédit chez Hekima. Elle achète  des souliers usagers à Goma et tantôt à bukavu qu’elle revend au marché de kavumu.  Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 100 paires de souliers; ainsi elle remercie Hekima infiniment d’avoir donné du courage et de l’argent aux femmes à faible revenue.
texts.en: Kulondwa is president of the Cikwanine business group.  She is 36 years old and the mother of nine children, seven of whom are in school.  This is her 12th loan cycle with Hekima.  She buys used shoes in Goma, and sometimes Bukavu, which she then re-sells in the market in Kavumu.  She will use the loan she has requested to stock up with 100 pairs of shoes.  She is immensely grateful to Hekima for having given hope and money to low-income women.

loans.use: to buy 100 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La señora Aida dedicada al comercio de frutas esto en el mercado de la zona por donde ella vive, ya hace muchos años atrás que realiza esta actividad, ella provee de buena calidad de frutas a todos sus clientes, temprano compra las frutas al por mayor y por este motivo solicito el  crédito, y después lleva a su puesto en el mercado, ella es una joven mujer emprendedora que realizando este trabajo ayuda a su familia económicamente, para mantener la alimentación de sus hermanitos que son menores que ella, ella pretende ayudarles hasta que ellos sean profesionales, ese es uno de sus objetivos primordiales, ya que por casos de la vida ella tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hermanos, y ella hace el papel de madre para sus hermanitos siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia ella es una persona con ganas de superación y de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos y de un día tener un negocio grande donde tenga mas utilidades.
texts.en: Señora Aida sells fruit in the local market. She has done this for many years now, providing high-quality fruit to all of her customers. She buys the fruit at wholesale early in the morning, and later brings it to her stall in the market. She is requesting this loan for buying the fruit wholesale. She is a young, enterprising woman who helps her family economically through her work. She helps provide food for her younger siblings, and hopes to help them until they are professionals. This is one of her most important goals, as circumstances in life have meant that she has had to take care of her siblings and take on the role of their mother. She is always thinking about her family's well-being and has a desire to get ahead and improve the quality of life of her loved ones.  One day should would like to have a large business where she can have better profits.

loans.use: to purchase fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce is a 28-year-old man, married with three children. He primarily deals in selling banana juice – a delicacy in his area. People from all walks of life flock to his pub to get banana juice. Pastoralists from grazing, farmers from the garden and children from school are among his major clients.

Wilberforce has a very humble background. He started business at the tender age of 10 after dropping out of school. His greatest strength is honesty – that has kept him going for long. He has done a lot of odd jobs in his life including looking after other people's cattle and ploughing their gardens among others.

His peers confess that Wilberforce is their role model and most of them are emulating his hard work. Wilberforce started his business so as to survive the hard economic times that were hitting hard on him. He got married and responsibilities increased. He had to take care of his family. He also wanted to start a permanent business, get an address and stop looking around for odd jobs.

Wilberforce hopes to improve his standard of living, construct a better house for his family, prepare his children for school and also start a business for his wife.

loans.use: to restock more banana juice for sale

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA ENEDINA,SE ENCUENTRA CASADA CON 4 HIJOS CURSANDO LA PRIMARIA
ENEDINA TIENE UN LOCAL DE CENTA DE JOYERIA DE PLATA 
DEL CUAL A PODIDO SOLVENTAR ALGUNOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR I DE EDUCACION DE SUS HIJOS
ENEDINA RENTA EL LOCAL DONDE TIENE APROXIMANDAMENTE DE 2 A 6 AÑOS 
LO CUAL NO SON SUFICIENTES SUS INGRESOS
ENEDINA DECEA PODER PAGAR LOS GASTOS ESCOLARES DE INSCRIPCIONES DE SUS HIJOS
PARA PODER FORJARLES UN BUEN FUTURO Y ASI SUS HIJOS ESTEN PREPARADOS EN UN FUTURO
ASI MISMO DANDOLES UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Enedina is married with four children in primary school. She has a store where she sells silver jewelry, which has allowed her to cover some of the household expenses and the education of her children. Enedina rents the locale which she has had for two years of six total. 

What her income has not covered is the registration fees for her children, which she hopes to pay in order to give them a good future and for her children to be prepared for the future, thus giving them a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to pay school registration fees.

loans.name: Rhuderhekuguma Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mutula est présidente dans le groupe rhuderhekuguma depuis 2cyle de credit. Engagée dans la vente des boissons sucrées et alcoolisées depuis plus de 20ans  est âgée de 52 ans, mère de 12 enfants  dont  6 sont scolarisés ;  est mariée à un homme d’affaire. Le credit demandé va lui servir à l’achat de 16 caisses des boissons  sucrées et alcoolisées.  Elle remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour ses actions.
texts.en:
Mutula has been president of the Rhuderhekuguma group since their second loan cycle.  She has been selling soda and alcoholic beverages for more than twenty years.  Mutula is 52 years old and the mother of 12 children, 6 of whom are in school.  She is married to a businessman.

Mutula will use the loan she has requested to buy 16 crates of soda and alcoholic beverages.  She thanks Hekima and their partners for their actions.

loans.use: to buy 16 crates of soda and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Uzinduzi Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis, who is in her early 20s, is married with one small child who is still a baby. She has been a food vendor for one year now. She works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to pay rent in a better place for her business, bought a TV set, restocked the missing items in the food business and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to to increase her food stocks. 

Mwanahamis will share this loan with her loan group "Uzinduzi" with 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stocks of food

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Husband and wife Paul and Madeline have always had a passion for music. Both have played a variety of instruments since their childhood and currently teach music at local schools. This passion has motivated them to open their very own music school in New Orleans, which will offer private music lessons for a plethora of instruments. Paul and Madeline are extremely excited to open their own school as it will greatly benefit its current and future students by having one central and safe location for students to perfect their craft instead of going house to house to give lessons. "We want to inspire a sense of community among students, teachers and parents," explains Paul. 

Paul and Madeline are confident that their business will thrive as they are located in an area of New Orleans that they believe is its own micro-economy where local businesses support each other. 

Paul and Madeline think the Kiva program is great and would not be able to open their business without this loan. "It's cool that lenders share the risk with borrowers, it's a great way to show support to small businesses around the world," says Paul. 

Paul and Madeline will use their Kiva loan for improvements to the building, grand opening expenses, advertising, instruments, and sound proofing equipment.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Madeline from United States

loans.use: to purchase music stands & instrument shelves

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Doña Josefa una humilde ama de casa de 48 años de edad es originaria de  la costa atlántica Bluefields- Managua, casada, madre de seis hijos mayores de edad, viven independientes,  ella a pesar de ser una persona que no realizo estudios debido a que su situación económica se lo impidió es una mujer muy trabajadora de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos también vende tortillas negocios que tiene en su casa de habitación. Inicio su actividad echando tortillas para el consumo de la familia, luego los vecinos de la comunidad pedían a doña Josefa que les vendiera tortillas, ella decide establecer su negocio porque vio que era rentable, generaba ingresos diarios ahora no solo se dedica a la venta de tortillas pues también vende ropa para obtener más ganancias para el hogar, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijas que le ayudan a atender a los clientes. 
Su esposo tiene su propio negocio pues es dueño de una panadería y aporta con los gastos del hogar como otros ingresos. Josefa solicita el crédito para comprar ropa, zapato, perfumes, bisutería, etc. Ella estima este  préstamo será de ayuda porque podrá comprar mercadería variada para invertir en su negocio de ropa, incrementaran sus ventas, generando a la vez mas ganancias.  Ella tiene como planes futuros hacerle mejora a su vivienda para tener mejores condiciones de vida, sus metas próximas es poder trasladar la panadería de su esposo a su casa para evitar los gastos de pagar alquiler del local y poder obtener mejores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Josefa is a humble housewife who is 48 years old. She originates from the Atlantic Coast of Bluefields-Managua. She is married and the mother of 6 children who are older and live independently. Despite that she could not complete her schooling due to the economic situation that impeded her, she is a very hardworking woman involved in commerce. 

She makes a living selling clothing and shoes, as well as tortillas. She has these businesses in her house. She began her work making tortillas for her family's consumption. Then, her neighbors in the community requested Josefa to sell them her tortillas. She decided to establish her business because she saw it as profitable. She used to generate daily earnings but now she makes a living not only selling tortillas but also clothing, in order to receive greater earnings for the house. 

In her business she receives help from her daughters who help her to attend to the customers. Her husband has his own business; he is the owner of a bakery and contributes to the household expenses with other earnings. 

Josefa is requesting the loan to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes and jewelry, etc. She states that this loan will be of help because she will be able to buy varied merchandise to invest her clothing business. This will increase her sales, generating greater earnings at the same time. She has future plans of making improvements to her house to have a better standard of living. Her next goal is is to be able to move her husband's bakery to the house to avoid the cost of paying rent for the space and be able to receive greater earnings for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes and jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a training truck.

loans.name: Sayra Areli

texts.es:
Sayra, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos de, vive en el municipio de Choloma. 
Su negocio es venta de productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, harina, lácteos, refrescos, churros, carnes, embutidos etc. el cual lo estableció hace 4 años y lo atiende todo el día. Mayra inicio con fondos propios, tenía un dinero ahorrado y decidió  invertirlo para generar más ingresos. 
Para mantener surtido el negocio ha solicitado tres préstamos, con el actual que es de L.21000.00  y también lo va invertir para comprar más productos tales como: granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, embutido, harina, azúcar y refrescos.
 La meta que tiene es llegar a tener una solvencia económica que le permita vivir bien con su familia.
texts.en:
Sayra, age 32, is in a common-law marriage, and she has three children.  She lives in the Choloma municipality.

Her business is selling food products like rice, beans, sugar, lard, flour, dairy products, soft drinks, churros, meat, and sausages, etc.  She established her business four years ago, and she tends to it all day.  Sayra started with her own funds.  She had money saved, and she decided to invest it in order to generate more income.

In order to keep her business stocked, she has requested three loans.  She will use the current loan for 21,000 lempiras to buy more products like basic grains, dairy products, meat, sausages, flour, sugar, and soft drinks.

Her goal is to have financial solvency, which will allow her to live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, meat, sausages, flour, sugar, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Diana Fiorella

texts.es:
Diana tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la calurosa ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos  muy visitados el cual es la “Laguna de Huacachina”, se encuentra en medio de Dunas Maravillosas en las cuales se practica deportes de aventura como el Sandboard, también se le conoce por su riquísima gastronomía y sobre todo por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Diana en sus tiempos libres disfruta de escuchar música y sobre todo porque también le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco de Cabrito”. 

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Diana logro estudiar la carrera de Profesora de Ingles y gracias a ello trabaja en una institución educativa dando clases de este idioma, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y ella cree que le va bien en su trabajado porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene mucha paciencia para enseñar y sobre todo enseñar a los niños.

Diana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá comprar carpetas individuales para dar clases particulares en su vivienda, de esta manera ella podrá tener un ingreso mas y así seguir poder seguir luchando para hacer su sueño realidad:” Tener una escuela de Ingles”.
texts.en:
Diana is 23 and lives in the warm city of Ica, which claims one of the country's most visited tourist attractions, Huacachina Lagoon. The lagoon is surrounded by sand dunes where visitors can practice a sport known as Sandboard.The area is also renowned for its delicious food and gracious people. In her free time, Diana likes to listen to music and, most of all, eat one of her favorite dishes made from goat meat, "Seco de Cabrito."

Through hard work and dedication, Diana studied to become an English teacher and now teaches English classes in a school. She works about 8 hours each day and feels her job is going well because she is very responsible and has the patience to teach, especially children.

Diana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for providing support with which she will buy individual folders to give private classes in her home. This way, she could earn more income and keep working to make her dream a reality: "To have an English school."

loans.use: to buy folders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn flour and firewood to continue increasing tortilla sales

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.fr: Madame Mwinja est la vice présidente du groupe de crédit Umoja. Mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés à l'âge de 27ans est mariée à un homme ayant pour profession le gardiennage.  Elle traverse la frontière (RD Congo-Rwanda)  pour acheter des divers en plastics au Rwanda. Elle rêve accroitre son entreprise et avoir un dépôt de ces produits ; sur ceux ; le credit sollicité lui procurera une douzaine de bassin, une douzaine de seaux et autres ustensiles plastics. Elle remercie Hekima pour ses crédits et le prie de revoir le remboursement hebdomadaire à bihebdomadaire.
texts.en: Mwinja is the vice president of the Umoja loan group.  She is the mother of five children who are all in school.  She is 27 years old and married to a man who works as a caretaker.  Mwinja crosses the Democratic Republic of the Congo - Rwanda border to buy a range of plastic products in Rwanda.  She dreams of growing her business and having a store where she can sell her products.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy a dozen bowls, a dozen pails and other plastic products.  She thanks Hekima for their loans and pledges to make weekly to twice-weekly repayments.

loans.use: to buy a dozen bowls, a dozen pails and other plastic products

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
La joven Karla de 27 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, casada, su nivel académico es hasta el bachiller, madre de dos hijos que están a su cargo, actualmente la hija mayor estudia su primaria. Karla se dedica al comercio es dueña de una pulpería  desde hace tres años negocio que le heredo su mama, hoy en día Karla se encarga de la administración de su pulpería, este ha sido su primer negocio donde recibe el apoyo de su esposo que le ayuda a atender a los clientes en sus tiempos libres, sus productos los comercializa en su casa de habitación.
Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada y aporta para los gastos del hogar como otros ingresos, ella tiene como expectativa diversificarse en productos para su pulpería con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, frijoles, pan, leche,  enlatados, avena, jabón, etc. El cual estima será de ayuda pues podrá surtir su pulpería con productos más solicitados por su clientes, sus metas próximas es llegar a tener su miscelánea con productos variados, crecer en ventas para obtener mejores ingresos para la familia y poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karla is 27 years old and is from the city of Managua. She is married and has a high school academic level. She is the mother of two children that are her dependents. Her older daughter is in primary school. Karla makes a living as the owner of a grocery store, and inherited it from her mother three years ago. She is in charge of the administration of the store. This has been her first business which she receives the support of her husband who helps her to attend to the customers during his free time. She sells her products in the house in which she lives. 

Her husband works in a private business and contributes to the household expenses with his earnings. She hopes to diversify her store's products with the objective of satisfying her customers' needs. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, oil, beans, bread, milk, canned goods, oats, soap, etc. She believes that this will be of help because she will be able to stock her store with products that her customers demand most. Her next goals are to have more varied products, grow in sales to receive greater earnings for her family and to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil,  beans, bread, milk, canned goods, oats, soap, etc.

loans.name: Limoncito Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LIMONCITO, Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes todas mujeres la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Dalcy vive por la localidad de la Limoncito de ahí viene el nombre del banco de emprendimiento, ella tiene 49 años y un hijo de las edad de 21 años, La Sra. Dalcy  se dedica a la venta de y fabricación de artesanías en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma localidad donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Dalcy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra materiales para la fabricación de sus artesanías,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Dalcy va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda de artesanía grande y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Dalcy es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Limoncito is made up of nine members who are all women.  The president of the bank is Señora Dalcy who lives town of Limoncito from which the communal bank's name came.  She is 49 years old and has a 21 year old son.  Señora Dalcy makes and sells craftwork in her shop, which is found in the town where she lives.  

This is the first loan for the institution, and Señora Dalcy will use it to buy supplies to make her craftwork.  She hopes to improve her business with this loan by using the funds to buy additional supplies which will result in a better income.  She desires to have a large craftwork shop to allow her to offer better service to her customers.  

Señora Dalcy is a very hard-working person who feels happy to have the opportunity given to her and to the other members of the group who, in some cases, are the sole providers for their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make craftwork.

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es:
Don Roberto sigue laborando como jefe de planta en una zona franca de maquila, con doce años de experiencia, lo que logro hacer su casa, su esposa es ama de casa y sus dos hijas cursan la secundaria. Ha logrado aumentar a corto plazo su casa con préstamos, equilibrando sus gastos en alimentación, pago básico, estudios, y otros.
La mejora que desea hacer es repellar paredes internas y externas como la construcción del baño, logrando mejor higiene y seguridad para su familia. Materiales a comprar: cemento, arena, bloques, hierro, piedrín, puerta e inodoro para mejorar esta condición el cual va poco a poco con el apoyo de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Roberto continues working as a plant manager in a tax-free zone. He has 12 years of experience and has managed to build his house. His wife is a homemaker, and his two children are students. He has been able to expand his house in a short amount of time through loans, while meeting expenses for food, utilities, education, and so forth.

The improvements he wants to make are plastering both the interior and exterior walls and building a bathroom so that the house will be cleaner and safer for his family. To improve his house little by little with Afodenic's support, he will buy the following materials: cement, sand, concrete blocks, iron rods, gravel, a door, and a toilet.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to plaster his walls and buy a toilet.

loans.name: Ramiro Martin

texts.es:
el señor ramiro, junto a su esposa trabaja desde años las piñatas , las cuales venden a diferentes partes de la localidad, ademas de que juntos han logrado tener su propoio negocio y sacarlos adelante. su proposito es extender la cobertura de sus piñatas ya que ellos las consideran grandes artesanias.
asi poderce darce a conocer i tener mas clientes
ramiro para eso dece poder hacer la compra de materia prima
con la cual el señor ramiro hace las piñatas
i asi poderce extender en su ramo
adquiriendo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ramiro and his wife have been working with piñatas for some years, selling them in different parts of town. Together they have managed to have their own business and get ahead. His purpose is to extend coverage of his piñatas as they consider them to be great handicrafts, thus they can become to be known and have more customers. Ramiro to do this needs to be able to buy the raw materials which he uses to make the piñatas and thus be able to expand in his field obtaining a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Francisco Andres

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Andres,  se encuentra casado, 
desea, reparar las paredes del costado de la casa, y construir unos cuartos al frente de la vivienda.   
al igual que los acabados exteriores de su vivienda
para ello,, el deca hacerle alguna smejoras a su vivienda
dejando un buen patrimonio asu familia en mejores condiciones
evitando enfermedades y problemas de inseguridad
asi francisco andres, esta mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Francisco Andres is married. He wants to repair the side walls of his house and build some rooms onto the front of his home. In addition to the exterior finishes of his home, he wants to make some additional improvements to his home, leaving his family heritage in better conditions. By preventing sickness and security problems, Francisco Andres is improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to finish his home exterior

loans.name: Lamara

texts.ru:
Ламара уже на пенсии. При этом она работает на рынке - получает дополнительных доход. У нее есть два торговых киоска на центральном рынке Запорожья.

Ламара продает женскую одежду. Одежда недорогая, но хорошего качества. Ламара просит предоставить ей кредит на  летние блузки. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Lamara is retired. Now she works at the market and earns additonal income. She has two retail stalls at Zaporozhe's central market. Lamara sells womens' clothing. The clothes are inexpensive but of good quality. Lamara is requesting a loan for summer blouses. She hopes to earn an additional profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy summer blouses

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Rocio, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica a su actividad principal que es la docencia de educación primaria, pero también a su actividad paralela y no menos importante de su tienda de abarrotes, en la cual expende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, y  leche entre otros productos que le permiten ofrecer un ingreso extra a su economía y asi mantener de mejor manera a su familia. Rocio en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería y surtir su comercio de abarrotes.
Rocio está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member is Rocio, who belongs to the Communal Bank "Reyna de los Angeles" in the Urubamba province in Cusco, Peru. Our member makes a living in her main job teaching primary education. She also has another job which is no less important: her grocery store in which she sells basic products like rice, sugar, noodles and milk, among other products. This allows her to offer an extra income to her economic needs and thus better her family. In this opportunity she will invest the requested loan to buy goods and stock her groceries. 

Rocio is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and for helping her with the growth and strengthening of her work. The member is thankful for the loan and is committed to make her payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar by the sack to sell.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Cinthia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, actividad que le permite mantener a su familia, principalmente a su pequeño hijo. Cinthia en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar Cuyes y aumentar su producción, debido a la demanda que tiene.
Cinthia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a member of the village bank Reyna de los Angeles in Urubamba Province in Cusco, Peru. She raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, which allows her to support her family, especially her little son. Cinthia will use the requested loan to buy guinea pigs and increase her production to meet customer demand.
Cinthia is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to offer her family a better quality of life and for helping her expand and strengthen her business.
She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time and in full.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Edna Martha

texts.es:
La Sra Edna se encuentra casada y con dos hijos tiene un pequeño negocio de renta de maquinitas y venta de bolis, quiere incrementar la variedad de productos , aprovechando el intenso calor que prevalece actualmente, pues aumentarian sus ganancias y al mismo 
ya que edna tiene venta de bolis i productos congelados
ty al mismo tiempo mejoraria la calidad de vida de su familia ´
asi  incrementar sus ingresos y tener mas variedad en su negocio
ala vez se dria a conocer i tendria mas clientes.
texts.en: Edna is married with two children and she has a little business renting gaming machines and selling popsicles. She wants to increase the variety of products, taking advantage of the intense heat that prevails currently, and increase her earnings at the same time. Edna sells popsicles and frozen treats, improving the quality of life for her family while increasing their income and she wants to have more variety in her business, and as she becomes known she will have more customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Talandaneh I Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Talandaneh I” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Together, they are requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mabinty. Mabinty is age 27. She was born in Waterloo town where she is currently residing together with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is a businessman and 1 of her children is attending primary school and the other is not of school-going age. For 6 years now,  Mabinty has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With this loan, she will buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: God Is Great Ii Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Tonkolili district 37 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has 1 child who is not of school age. 

For 8 years now, Mohamed has been selling secondhand tires, etc.. With the help of this loan, members of this group will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mohamed will use his share of the loan (2,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand his business. He will buy secondhand tires at wholesale to add to his current ones.

loans.use: to buy secondhand tires at wholesale to add to his current ones.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La socia Alicia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de chocolate y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar chocolates y galletas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member Alicia was born in the city of Cusco and is 38 years old. She is in a common law marriage in which she has two children. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta" and it is going very well for her thanks to her punctual payments.

She makes a living making chocolate and requires a loan to buy chocolate and cookies. She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. She is thankful for the loan and is committed to making her payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy chocolates and cookies.

loans.name: Kelita

texts.es:
Kelita tiene 53 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está separada del padre su única hija, quien ya es independiente. Ahora vive con su anciana madre en la casa que compró a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Su actividad es la venta de zapatos femeninos, los cuales compra de otra ciudad a precios cómodos y luego los vende desde su casa entre sus amistades, vecinos y familiares al contado y otras veces en crédito de 20 días. Se inició en esto hace más de 5 años con un capital propio y animada por una amiga que se dedica a lo mismo, y lo considera bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene. Antes no tenía problemas económicos, pero sí tenía muchas ganas de generarse sus propios ingresos. Y paralelamente, cuenta con un empleo de medio tiempo en un programa social del estado.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP y se siente contenta por el apoyo financiero que tiene para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Además, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de zapatos femeninos de los últimos modelos, traídos de otra ciudad, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Kelita, 53, is a woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She's separated from the father of her only daughter, who is already on her own.  Now she lives with her elderly mother in the house she bought with great effort and hard work.

Her job is selling women's shoes, which she buys in another city at affordable prices and then sells from her home to her friends, neighbors, and relatives for cash or, sometimes, 20-day credit.  She began this job more than five years ago with her own capital, encouraged by a friend who works in the same business.  She considers it very profitable because of her earnings and the demand.  She didn't have financial problems before, but she did very much want to generate her own income.  She also has a half-time job in a state social program.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she's happy about the financial help to make progress with her business.  For this reason she promises to make her payments on time, as with the previous loans.  In addition, she comments that she's comfortable with her communal bank because she considers it to be a close and supportive group.

She will invest the requested 1500 nuevos soles [PEN] in buying the latest styles of women's shoes, bringing them from another city where she gets the lowest prices for buying wholesale.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.ru:
Мария осталась одна, без мужа, когда дети были еще маленькие. Она начала свой бизнес на небольшом рынке. Некоторое время торговала на другом рынке - большом центральном городском рынке. 

Несмотря на больший торговый оборот, аренда торгового места была слишком дорогой. Мария переехала обратно на крытый рынок, сейчас имеет желание купить еще один киоск, чтобы увеличить объем продаж. 

Мария торгует одеждой для женщин среднего возраста. Просит предоставить ей кредит на летние сарафаны.
texts.en: Maria became single when her children were still yong. She started her own business at a small market. For a while she had been working at a different market — the large central city market. Despite her large sales turnover, the rent for the shop stall was too high. Maria moved over to the covered market, and would now like to buy another stall to increase her sales. Maria sells cothes for middle-aged women. She would like a loan to buy summer dresses.

loans.use: to buy women's summer dresses

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Florencia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica a la producción y el comercio mayorista de verduras como legumbres y hortalizas, y lo distribuyen en los diferentes mercados de la región, pero también a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, con estas actividades nuestra socia saca adelante a su familia. Florencia en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar algunos productos como tomates, cebollas y zanahorias para surtir su oferta.
Florencia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our partner Florencia belongs to the Communal Bank "Reyna de los Angeles" in the Urubamba province in Cusco, Peru. She makes a living producing and selling vegetables  and beans wholesale. She distributes them throughout different markets in the region. She also raises small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. With these jobs, she carries her family forward. In this opportunity she will invest the loan requested to buy some products such as tomatoes, onions and carrots to stock up her products. 

Florencia is very thankful for Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and to grow and strengthen her work. She is thankful for the loan and is committed to making the payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is divorced and has three children. Her husband is a brick layer. Ama sells bread and eggs near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for 10 years. She uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Ama will use this loan to purchase flour and eggs. With the new profits, Ama plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour and eggs

loans.name: Lillie

texts.en:
As part of her family tradition, Lillie learned to cook as a child. Lessons from her grandmother and mother led to the opening of her start-up restaurant, "Soul Heaven Café". After conducting customer research, Lillie leased a building in her hometown of Mobile, Alabama, that’s surrounded by multiple businesses where soul food has little competition other than a couple of nearby fast food restaurants.

Besides her knowledge of cooking from scratch from her family, Lillie worked for a major Italian chain restaurant that sent her to culinary school. She also managed multiple restaurants. She says corporate always wants what’s best for it rather than the customer. “What I have learned from managing other businesses is you have to jump through hoops. It’s not about the customer, it’s about the dollar,” she says. Lillie plans to do just the opposite with her restaurant. She is starting out small to ensure she can properly cater to customers’ needs. When she opens in the middle of July, her restaurant will be the only one in her area offering made-from-scratch breakfast before 11 a.m.

Since her business is a start-up, Lillie is the only employee. The restaurant is modeled after a take-out establishment, but can comfortably sit 15 hungry customers. She says Soul Heaven Café will create four new jobs when it kicks off, but, for the time being, she’ll receive help from family when needed. Lillie’s menu will consist of a variety of dishes, including chef salad, chicken salad, grilled or fried chicken sandwiches, fish sandwiches, vegetables, fruits, wings, and homemade cakes and puddings. She will also offer daily specials and party platters. 

To get started, Lillie needed more kitchen equipment. But knowing she might not qualify for a loan, she purchased cooking equipment progressively until she inquired about a loan. Lillie says she did a quick Google search for loans in her area and came across Accion Texas Inc. However, she didn’t follow through with an application until the Alabama Women in Business organization encouraged her. The Accion loan will help her business flourish, as she is able to purchase equipment and offer more menu choices, she says. Without the loan, it would have taken Lillie longer to open. “I would like to thank Accion for believing in my dreams and helping me achieve my dreams.” She is currently in the process of obtaining the domain name for her future website, but has a Facebook page for now: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Soul-Heaven-Cafe/203786046407460.

loans.use: to pay for kitchen equipment

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
Maseray is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Maseray was born in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. She is married to a motor mechanic and the couple has 3 children – 2 of whom are attending secondary school and the other is not of school-going age.  Maseray sells secondhand motor spare parts and has been doing this business for 8 years now.

With the help of this loan, Maseray and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Maseray will use her share of the loan (1,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy used spare parts for motors at wholesale for resale.

loans.use: to buy used spare parts for motors for resale

loans.name: Have Faith In God Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Marie was born in Tonkolili district, Northern Sierra Leone 38 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Marie sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and has been doing this business for 10 years now.

With the help of this loan, Marie and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Marie will use her share of the loan (1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba est une femme mariée , mère de quatre enfants.Elle s'occupe à longueur de journée des taches ménagères.Depuis quelques mois, elle pratique l'embouche bovine à domicile afin d'obtenir des revenus pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants.Elle sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter un boeuf.
texts.en: Daba is married, and a mother of 4. All day, she takes care of the house. For a few months now, she has undertaken a cattle fattening activity at home in order to get an income to meet her needs and that of her children. She is asking for a 200 000f loan in order to buy a bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El socio Martin nació en el departamento de Puno pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la venta de manejeria de forma ambulatorio y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar botones, agujas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: The borrower Martin was born in the department of Puno but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 38 years old and has a common law marriage from which he has two children. He belongs to the communal bank “Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta” and is doing very well thanks to the punctual payments of the fees. He works moving about as a traveling salesman and at this time needs a loan to buy buttons, needles and other things. He has been in this business for some years and it is going very well. The member is grateful for the loan and he agrees to comply with the payment of his fees in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy buttons, needles and other things

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Juliet has a beauty salon that offers hair relaxing, hair rebonding, manicures and pedicures. Aside from that she also sells beauty products and personal care products. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy materials to use in her beauty salon and to pay for electricity for the salon.
Juliet has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane est un homme marié, père de quatre enfants.Il pratique l'élevage traditionnel depuis son jeune âge.Toutefois, depuis ces dernières années, les nombreux problèmes que connaît ce type d'élevage l'ont obligé à changer de pratique et à faire de l'embouche bovine.Il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse puis revend au bout de 7 mois.Cette activité lui permet de générer des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Actuellement il sollicite un pret de 350 0000f de l'UIMCEC pour acheter un boeuf et des aliments bétail.Il ambitionne d'agrandir d'avantage sa capacité d'élevage.
texts.en: Ousmane is married and a father of 4. He has practiced traditional livestock farming since his youth. However, since the last few years, given the many problems linked to this type of farming, he has been forced to switch to cattle fattening. He buys bulls which he fattens, then resells them after 7 months. This activity has enabled him to generate an income substantial enough to meet his family's needs, as well as his own. He is currently asking for a 350 0000f loan from UIMCEC in order to buy a bull and cattle feed. His goal is to expand his farming capacity.

loans.use: to buy a bull and cattle feed.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.en:
María Consuelo is 31 years old and married with four children.  She lives in northern Peru with her husband and children in the rural area of the Tambogrande District, Piura Province.

María raises sheep, poultry and pigs in a place close to her house. She fattens them with balanced feed and when they have reached an adequate level of development, she sells them to her neighbors and to the merchants who come to her place. This business activity allows her to help her family with the daily expenses. 

María has also developed a passion for farming and she primarily grows lemons. She harvests the lemons and then sells them to her neighbors. They buy her products because of the reliability and good quality. María always works hard to be able to get her family ahead.

María has successfully repaid a previous Kiva-funded loan, and this will be her second.  She plans to use this loan to buy more balanced feed for her livestock, as well as fertilizers for her lemon crop. She has proven to be a responsible person who knows her business well and wants to take advantage of potential opportunities in her area of work.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock, and fertilizers for a lemon crop

loans.name: Diégane

texts.fr:
Diégane est un homme marié, père de deux enfants.Il est agriculteur mais pratique en même temps l'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine.Il achète un bœuf qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de 7 mois.Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Afin de réaliser une nouvelle opération d'embouche, il sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter 1 bœuf.

Son ambition est réaliser un enclos assez moderne pour élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Diégane is married and a father of 2. He is a farmer, but at the same time, pratices cattle fattening. He buys a bull which he fattens and resells after 7 months. This activity generates an income substantial enough to provide for his family.

For his next fattening operation, he is applying for a 250 000f loan so he can buy 1 bull.

His ambition is to build a fairly modern enclosure to expand his activity.

loans.use: to buy 1 bull.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 50 years old and the widowed mother of four children. She lives in the town of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she makes a living by providing beauty services to local community members. She's been in this business for 16 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,900 to buy more of the supplies she needs to run her business. Amelita joined GDMPC in 2009 as a way to improve her business and one day buy a house and a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for her transportation business.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie, from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 23 years old and single. To make a living, for the past two years Elmie has owned and operated a motorcycle transportation service, earning 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Elmie joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora judith, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, actividad que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y con la cual saca adelante a su familia. Judith en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar algunos cuyes y gallinas, pero también lo que le quede ahorrará, porque ella posee una cultura del ahorro.
Judith está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower is Judith. She belongs to the communal bank “Reyna de los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) from the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Perú. The borrower continues raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens, an activity that she has been doing for a long time and with which she can move her family ahead. Judith at this time wants to invest the requested loan to buy some guinea pigs and chickens, but also she wants to save what is left, because she is in the habit of saving.

Judith is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give a better quality of life to her family and for helping her with the growth and strengthening of her activities. The borrower is grateful for the loan and she agrees to complete her payment of fees according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs and to be able to save

loans.name: Saoya's Group

texts.en:
Saoya lives in a village in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang, Cambodia. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of whom are still dependants. Saoya earns a living as a rice farmer and supplements her income by selling groceries. She has been in business for five years and earns about KHR 26,000 per day. Her main challenge is a lack of capital. 

Saoya is a member of a two-person loan group which has taken out and repaid three previous loans from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. These past loans have helped her improve her family's living conditions. This group is now applying for a new loan from VisionFund for KHR 1,400,000 per person. As the leader, Saoya is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm and also use some of it to plow her land. She hopes to earn more income from her business so that she and her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for a farm.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
Loren, from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the past five years Loren has owned and operated a general store selling a variety of products such as milk, vinegar, canned goods, etc. in the local community. She earns 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Loren joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 11,900 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Pacincia

texts.en: For the past two years Pacincia, a 62-year-old widowed mother of two grown children living in Bintangan, Larena, Siquijor, has managed her own piggery business to earn a living.  A member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year, she has requested a loan a PHP 4000 to purchase feeds and medicines for her enterprise. Pacincia hopes to renovate her house from her business profits.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and medicines for backyard piggery business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo, 27 years old, single and living in the Philippines, has been providing motorela or motorcycle services for five years now. A member of HSPFI since 2012, he is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline. In the future, Alfredo hopes to improve his services so he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Von's Group

texts.en:
Von lives in a village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang, Cambodia. She is 58 years old and the widowed mother of seven children. For the last nine years, she has supported her family by growing rice on her one-hectare farm. She earns about KHR 22,200 per day, and her main challenges are the low price of rice and recent flooding. 

Von leads a two-person loan group, and has taken out and repaid six previous loans from Kiva's partner VisionFiund. The other member of this group is taking out her third loan. Past loans have helped Von better support her family and save money for the future. This group is applying for a loan of KHR 800,000 for each member. Von will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farm and plow her land. She hopes to increase her crop yields so that she can earn enough money to set aside some savings and open up a new business which will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Cheikh ( qui tient la fiche sur la photo) est un homme marié.Il est père de trois enfants.Depuis son jeune âge, il voue à d'agriculteur une vraie passion.Période cette période,il accompagnait son père dans les champs et s'occupait de la chasse des oiseaux granivores.Aujourd'hui, il exploite les champs de son père après la mort de ce dernier.Il cultive du mil, de l'arachide, des haricots et du melon.Une partie de la production est destiné à la consommation alors qu'une autre est vendue sur les marchés locaux.Ceci lui permet d'obtenir des revenus afin de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Actuellement il sollicite un pret de 150 000fcfa pour acheter des semences et de l' engrais.Son ambition est de creuser un puits pour faire du maraîchage durant la contre saison.
texts.en: Cheikh (holding the application in the picture) is married and a father of 3. Ever since his childhood, when he would go hunting seed-eating birds in fields with his father, he has been passionate about farming. Since the man died, Cheikh has been working on his father's fields. He grows millet, peanuts, beans, and melons. Part of the production is for personal consumption, the rest is sold in local markets. This activity has enabled him to generate an income substantial enough to meet his family's needs, as well as his own. He is currently applying for a 150 000f CFA loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. His ambition is to dig a well for off-season truck farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eutimia

texts.en: Eutimia is 59 years old and the widowed mother of one child who lives in Canal, Siquijor, Siquijor. She earns a living by selling food, and earns about PHP 2,000 per month. Eutimia is requesting a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy ingredients which she will use to make food to sell. She is a new member of the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and in the future would like to earn enough money to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food-vending business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia operates a provision store near Kwarhinkrom in Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a businessman. Cecilia has been selling provisions for five years now. She is responsible for paying for her children’s school fees as her husband is in charge of other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for her store. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for her store

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en: Eugenio is married and has seven children. He is 58 years of age, and he lives in Canibungan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He raises bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers for his farm. Eugenio been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, he hopes to improve his business so that he can give a brighter future to his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for grazing his cows.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana, age 63, earns a living by selling gasoline in her local barangay. She and her husband live in South Poblacion, Siquijor, Siquijor, and have five adult-age children.
 
Emeliana has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PhP 5,000.00. She has requested a loan of PhP 3,000 to purchase gallons of gasoline to offer for sale.

Emeliana is a newly-recognized member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. In the future, Emeliana hopes to build savings from the increased profit of her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of gasoline to offer for sale

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Crisanta is married and has nine children. To make a living, Crisanta owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Crisanta been engaged in business for six years and earns PHP 10,000 a month from these activities. 

Crisanta is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. In 2006, Crisanta joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Tureme Group

texts.fr:
Anitha fait partie du groupe  Tureme et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 23 ans et est mariée à  Elie, agent des services  aéronautiques.
Elle prend soin de 2 enfants qui étudient.

Elle vend les services de secrétariat public  depuis 3 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de matériaux de bureaux (fardes, papiers duplicateurs, enveloppes sac,...) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait avoir un grand capital.
texts.en:
Anitha lives in Bujumbura and is a member of the Tureme group. She is 23 years old and married to aeronautical service agent named Elie. She takes care of two children who both attend school.

She has been selling public secretarial services for three years now.

This is her third loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan that she is receiving, she will increase her capital and buy lots of office supplies (folders, ditto machines, catalog envelopes,...) to resell in order to earn more money.

In the coming years, she would like to have a large amount of capital.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy lots of office supplies (folders, ditto machines, catalog envelopes,...) intended for resale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 52 years old and lives in Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is married with five children. To earn a living, Erlinda has a business selling food. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Erlinda has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to pay for labor, and to purchase nails, wood and other materials for house renovation. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to succeed in her business.

loans.use: To pay for labor, and to purchase nails, wood and other materials for house renovation.

location.town: Plaridel-Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 49 years old and lives in Helen, Larena, Siquijor.  He is married with two children. Leonardo has a General Store business and earns approximately PHP 7,200 each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for labor, and to purchase nails, cement, wood and other materials for house construction. Leonardo is a newly recognized member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative as he joined last May 29, 2012.  In the future, Leonardo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To pay for labor, and to purchase nails, cement, wood and other materials for house construction.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Wilfreda is married and has six children. To make a living, Wilfreda owns and operates a business venture, providing repair services to local community members. Wilfreda has been operating her business for 33 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Wilfreda is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. In 2010, Wilfreda joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Charisma

texts.en:
Charisma  is  30  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Charisma has a sari-sari, or food/retail shop, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Charisma has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Charisma hopes to improve her business to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
A married father of six children, Kao is aged 62, and living in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. Out of his six children, he still has four (two daughters and two sons) children who are dependent to take care of. To support his family, he has been involved in cassava planting on two hectares, cashew on one hectare and rubber planting on four hectares of farmland. He has been in this business for ten years. The current business earns him approximately USD 11.00 per day and he is able to save about USD 4.00 each day. 

Kao is in his fourth cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He completely paid back the past loans, which have helped him relieve family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now he is applying for a loan of USD 1,500 with VisionFund. He will use this loan to buy rubber seedlings for his rubber plantation and use a portion of it to spend for labor and land plowing. With this loan, he hopes to make more income so as to build on some savings to fulfill his future dream of have a bigger house for living in.

loans.use: To buy rubber seedlings for his rubber plantation.

loans.name: Ma. Tessie

texts.en:
Ma. Tessie is 44 years old and lives in Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

Ma. Tessie has a pig-raising business and earns approximately PHP 3000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more pigs to raise.

Ma. Tessie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to have a piggery in their barangay.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: 05.05.21 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Điệp, age 41, operates a food-stall restaurant, selling sweet rice. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for the food she prepares and sells. Điệp is the group leader of the 05.05.21 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her husband and their two children.

The main hardship that Điệp faces in her business is lack of capital. In 2009, Mrs. Điệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Điệp hopes to secure her children's educations, to ensure that her family is healthy and happy, and to help her business thrive.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for the sweet rice that she prepares and sells

loans.name: Clemencia Cecilia

texts.es: Clemencia ha solicitado su crédito para comprar respuestas de automotores, pernos, llaves, filtros y accesorios de carro ya que esto son los productos que oferta en su negocio. Lo empezaron juntos después que su esposo salió de la cooperativa de transporte de pasajeros en la cual trabaja, con la liquidación que recibió y algo de dinero que tenían ahorrado pusieron el negocio. Fue una buena alternativa ya que sabe de automotores y de repuestos, ahora está saliendo adelante a pesar de tener competencia. Clemencia se dedica más la atención al público y del trato con los proveedores, abre el negocio todos los días de lunes a sábado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. El sueño de Clemencia a futuro es poder abrir un restaurant en el centro de Quevedo el cual está en marcha ya que quiere empezar un negocio nuevo e independiente del de su esposo.
texts.en:
Clemencia has requested a loan to purchase spare car parts, bolts, keys, filters, and car accessories because these are the products she offers in her store. She and her husband started it together after he left the passenger transportation cooperative at which he worked, and using the settlement he got and a bit of money they had saved they opened the business.

It was a good option since he knows about cars and spare parts. Now it's doing well despite competition. Clemencia focuses more of her attention on the public and dealing with suppliers. She opens the store every day Monday through Saturday from 8 in the morning until 6 at night.
